loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en:
Anjeline is a married woman with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Anjeline dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a 28-year-old member of Wendani B Group in Faulu Kenya. In the group, the members share business ideas, save their money, and guarantee each other's loans. Purity runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for thirteen years. She also practices dairy farming for more income. Being a single mother of two, she works hard in her business to meet her children's needs. She hopes to someday expand her shop into wholesale. With 20,000 KES, Purity will buy sugar and rice.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Laure Abajo Group

texts.en:
Saturnina, Maria Suyapa, and Claudia Carolina, who reside in the San Lorenzo, Honduras, formed the Laure Abajo solidarity group in June, 2011. They will collectively serve as guarantors of one another's loans. Maria Suyapa sells snacks and refreshments and is requesting a loan of LPS 8,000 with which to purchase a refrigerator. The refrigerator will enable her to sell frozen items, such as chocolate-covered bananas, which are very popular in her area. 

Claudia Carolina sells basic foodstuffs out of her home and is requesting a loan of LPS 5,000 to purchase merchandise. Saturnina runs a small convenience shop where she sells basic foodstuffs and household supplies. She is requesting a loan of LPS 8,000 to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra de 45 años de edad, casado con Teofilo de 45 años, que fruto de esta relación tiene 2 hijos, Elba de 8 años y Abel de 6 años, quienes la motivan a seguir  trabajando y sacarlos adelante y hacer de ellos unos hombres de bien, útiles a la sociedad. Ellos viven en su propia casa ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Alejandra desde su niñez, siempre le ha gustado ayudar a sus padres  en el trabajo que le encomendaban, pero sus padres tuvieron fuerte caída en el aspecto económico. La tienda que tenía y que los proveía de ingresos dejó de funcionar, además el negocio agrícola también decayó. Ante esto Alejandra y su familia tuvieron muchos percances pero con el tiempo lograron salir adelante y bajo muchos sacrificios hoy tienen una tienda en donde vende ropa. Ahora ella aprendió a ser precavida en las decisiones que toma con respecto a su negocio, es así como ha mejorando. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja, pero usualmente ella trabaja por cuenta propia y sus productos lo venden en su propia casa. Ella anhela en un futuro cercano, ampliar su tienda con la finalidad de captar mayor clientela. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que ella esta agradecida  a la vez comprometida en cancelar puntualmente  el pago de sus cuotas. En su banco banco comunal es una persona entusiasta y motivadora.  Con los 2.000 mil nuevos soles desea adquirir más prendas para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 45-years old and married to 45-year old Teofilo. They have two children, Elba aged 8 and Able aged 6. They are the reason why Alejandra and Teofilo work so hard; they wish to see their children grow up to make something of themselves and become a useful part of society. They live in their own house located in Pichari district.

Ever since she was a child, Alejandra has enjoyed helping her parents with any jobs they gave her, but her parents knew very little about economics. The store she used to run and which provided their income failed, and their agricultural business also fell through. Alejandra and her family had many problems but over time, they succeeded in overcoming them and with much sacrifice they now have a store where she sells clothing.

Alejandra has now learned to be cautious with the business decisions she makes and is doing better. Sometimes she has assistance from Teofilo but usually she works on her own. She runs the store out of her house. 

In the near future her wish is to better stock the store so she can gain more customers. This will be her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, for which she is grateful and promises to make the repayments punctually. In her community bank she is a enthusiastic and motivated member. With the loan of S/. 2000, Alejandra will buy more clothing for the store.

loans.use: to buy more clothing

loans.name: San

texts.en: San is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a Tok Tok taxi driver and their income is $5 per day. They have three children and all of them are studying. Every month, she has to spend $25 on food, $10 on school fees, $15 on house rental fees, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy a new motorbike for her husband's career as a Tok Tok driver because the current motorbike is old. In the future, she plans to buy grocery goods to sell at the house instead of working in the factory so that she can stay home and take care of her children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny  es natural D. Huancayo, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en casa D. sus padres. DesD. que nació, sus padres le inculcaron en elL. el gusto D. trabajar en las tareas del campo, Cuando llega a L. adolescencia llega a radicar en L. ciudad D. Huancayo para buscar mejores oportunidades, sin embargo optó por vender ganado en las ferias comerciales, actividad que más le agrada. Es así que compra a un menor precio los animales y al cabo D. un rigoroso tiempo alimentándolos, los revenD. en L. misma feria a un precio más alto. Con los años D. experiencia, sabe identificar que animales debe o no comprar y no dejarse engañar con animales enfermos que pueD. afectar su inversión. Durante toda L. semana tiene disponible su capital para estar en búsqueda D. animales como ovejas, cerdos y toros. Para Marleny es un buen negocio desarrollar estas actividades que le permite mejorar su economía para el bienestar D. su familia. Es su tercer crédito que trabaja D. L. mano con MFP, durante todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos y se ha ganado L. confianza D. los demás integrantes D. su grupo solidario. Con el dinero que solicita, lo seguirá invirtiendo en L. compra D. más animales porque en esta época del año tiene más ventas y requiere D. incrementar su capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Marleny is from Huancayo.  She lives with her husband and three children in her parents’ house.  Since she was born her parents instilled in her the joy of working doing field chores.  When she became an adolescent she moved to the city of Huancayo seeking better opportunities.  However, she opted to sell cattle at the commercial markets, the activity that most pleases her.  This is how she buys animals at a lower price and after a rigorous period of time feeding them she resells them at the same market for a higher price.  With all these years of experience she knows which animals to buy and which ones to pass on and she is not fooled by animals that might be sick and affect her profits.  She has her capital available all week to seek out sheep, pigs and bulls.  For Marleny, it’s good business to develop these activities that allow her to improve her economy for her family’s wellbeing.

This is her third loan working hand in hand with MFP.  During all this time she’s been punctual with her repayments and has won over her fellow members’ trust.  She will use the requested funds to buy more animals because this season of the year she has more sales and needs to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy more cows and bulls.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is a rice farmer who is engaged.  He has been a farmer for the past 10 years. He learned rice farming from a formal training program.

He will use his Kiva loan to pay for labor costs during rice production such as nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs for his rice production

loans.name: Roy Lenin

texts.es: El joven Roy tiene 20 años de edad,  es natural de San Martin y en la actualidad esta cursando su ultimo ciclo en la carrera de Topografia en el Instituto de SENCICO en el departamento de La Libertad.  Su deseo mas anhelado es poder terminar sus estudios empezar a trabajar y convalidar cursos a fin de poder terminar su carrera en la universidad. Su inspiracion es su madre ya que gracias a todo el esfuerzo dado por ella el esta estudiando para poder ser un hombre de bien.
texts.en: Young Roy, 20, is from San Martín and is currently enrolled in the last cycle of Topography studies at the SENCICO Institute in La Libertad Department.  His most fervent dream is to finish his schooling and to start working and validate his courses so that he can complete his university career.  His mother is his inspiration because thanks to all the effort she’s exerted he is studying in order to become an upstanding citizen.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Melida Carlota

texts.es:
La Señora. Melida es socia del banco comunal Tres de Noviembre, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la agricultura y cría de animales, son personas muy amables, carismáticas y trabajadoras.

La Señora. Melida tiene 32 años, vive en unión libre y está embarazada a días de dar a luz a su primer hijo. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando los servicios de su vehículo realizando fletes, la casa en la que habita es propiedad de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

La Señora. Melida se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa se dedica a la cría y venta de animales como ganado y cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para mejorar el terreno y tener buen pasto para sus animales.
 
Su meta es tener  casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Melida is a member of the communal bank "Tres de Noviembre".  She lives in the parish of Cumbre; this area has a cold climate, and its people work in business, agriculture and raising livestock. They are very friendly, charismatic, and hard-working people.

Señora Melida is 32 years old.  She is in a common law marriage and is pregnant, within days of giving birth to her first child.  Her partner is a driver by profession, and works providing freight service with his vehicle.  The house where they live belongs to her parents, with whom they share the household expenses.

Señora Melida does the household chores, and as this takes place at home she also works raising and selling animals like cattle and guinea pigs, which she sells in her community.

This is her second loan with the communal bank, and she will invest it in buying manure to improve her land and grow good pasture for her animals.

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Fanm Kapab 1 Group

texts.fr:
Guerline  est la coordinatrice de son groupe FANM KAPAB

 Elle n’est pas mariée mais Elle a un enfant.

Guerline habite dans la ville de trou du nord d’Haiti. Elle a dirigé son business pendant les 7 dernières années.

Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des lampes a batteries. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Guerline dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant .

Des autres membres de FANM KAPAB ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson.

Elle dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est la construction d’une belle maison.
texts.en:
Guerline is the coordinator of "Fanm Kapab 1" Group. She is not married, but has a child. She lives in Trou-du-Nord in Haiti.

Guerline has run her business for the past seven years. She would like to use her loan to buy battery powered lamps. She hopes that the loan will enable her to expand her business. She says that her biggest challenge is the lack of loyal customers.

The other members of the group need their share of the loan for their businesses, such as coal, rice or fish stores.

Guerline says that her main objective is to expand her business. She dreams of building a beautiful house.

loans.use: to buy battery powered lamps.

loans.name: Perrse

texts.en:
Perrse is a 34 year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in the school.  She has a business of selling dried fish in Hai Mahad in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for five years. She can also earn some income from selling alcohol, like beer, at home.
Perrse requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles tiene 35 años por lo que tiene su actividad que es la venta de ropa. Desde hace 3 años ella se dedica a este medio de vida, la necesidad de obtener ingresos para su hogar hizo que María buscara  este trabajo. Ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante para ofrecerle a sus diferentes clientes productos como pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, traje entre otros productos. Sueña con realizarle modificaciones a su vivienda pues los materiales de construcción están muy caros.
texts.en: María de los Ángeles, 35, and her activity is clothing sales.  She’s been in this line of work for three years.  The need to obtain income for her home was what pushed María to seek out this work.  She is a street vendor and offers her customers such things as pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and outfits, among other products.  She dreams with making some home improvements because building materials are very expensive.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Samun

texts.en:
Samun, 51 years old, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. She is a single mother with three children, all of whom are studying. But two are studying and working at the same time, earning $14 per day in all.
 
Every month Samun has to spend $66 on food, $10 on electricity, and $35 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $800 for school fees, $400 each for two of her children, to pay for their studies at the university. 

She doesn’t have any plan for a new career because she is getting old and she doesn’t have any knowledge to do anything else.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 39 years old. She is married and has five children. To earn a living, she runs a grocery. She has been in this business for two years. She has employed two people to assist her in her tasks. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more focused in her business and she hopes to open other outlets of the business. Florence has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with three children. She is 35 years old and resides at Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
 
Editha earns a living by operating a business raising crops, planting and harvesting root crops such as cassava to sell. She has been in this business for ten years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase land to raise additional crops. Editha has been a member of GDMPC for almost four years.
 
In the future, Editha wants to make improvements to her house and wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase land to raise additional crops.

loans.name: Masaba Umoja B Group

texts.en:
Edwin is the facilitator of the Masaba Umoja B group. Edwin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Edwin takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Edwin had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Edwin was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Edwin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Edwin will build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Masaba Umoja B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is the mother of 4 children, 3 daughters and a son. All of them are enrolled in local school and getting their education. Her husband sells cow milk. Nasreen also supports him in his business after getting free from her household responsibilities. She milks the cows and also gives them food.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband's business. With the loan investment, he will buy another cow that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits. It has become very difficult for Nasreen to pay the school fees of her children and she is hopeful that by investing the loan, her husband will make more profits and she will be able to continue giving education to her children.

Note:In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: to buy a cow for a dairy business

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 48 years old, married and has 6 children.  Two of her children are in school.  Mildred lives in the Philippines and raises pigs for a living.   

She has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Mildred has been raising pigs for 10 years, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mildred would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years olds and married to Naomi. They are blessed with five children. He has been in the farming business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 8,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Joseph will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to build his own house on his new land.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en: Gordon is a single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as optimistic and jovial. He operates a motorcycle transportation service. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located near his town. He describes his biggest business challenge as restricted access to Kisumu town centre, where many of his customers are. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy spare wheels for his motorcycle. Gordon's business goal is to own several motorcycles within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more spare wheels.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: Азиза красивая, активная, умная девушка. Ей всего 21 лет, она жительница города Худжанд. Азиза выросла без отца, ее воспитывала мама. Она живет вместе с матерью, сестрой и баритом. Азиза училась только в школе, у нее среднее образование. Она решила не сидеть содам и зарабатывать самостоятельно. Азиза занимается один видом бизнесом. Она продает сим-карты и карты для пополнения баланса. Азиза начала свою работу 6 месяцев назад. У нее хорошо получается и она уверенная девушка. Азиза хочет расширить свой бизнес. Она за счет кредита решила увеличить ассортимент товарооборот. Азизе очень нужно Ваша помощь. Не откажите ей, поддержите молодую девушку. Азиза надеется на поддержку.

loans.use: Для расширения бизнеса и увеличения ассортимент товара.

loans.name: José

texts.en:
José offers wholesale and retail sales of seafood (shrimps, fish, crabs) for a living. He has 30 years of experience in this trade. His father was a fisherman and as a child, José and his brothers had to learn this occupation so they could put bread on the table. When he got married, he came to Guayaquil-Isla Trinitaria to live with his parents and kept on with his business. He goes out fishing with a group of 5 people in his own motorized canoe, in deep waters around different spots in Guayaquil. He comes home every 2 days. When he comes back with the catch of the day, he sells it straight to the wholesale market. On Saturdays and Sundays, he retails his seafood close to his house because sales are good. The only day they don’t go fishing is on Wednesdays because they take a rest. His wife also has a small business where she sells, in the countryside, whatever people request for. Both husband and wife generate income.

José needs a loan because he would like to change his fishing nets and his wife needs to buy some of the products her clients have ordered.

He and his wife were born in Naranjito. He is 40 eyars old with 4 small children. Jose’s wife is his partner and personal support in his work. She also generates income by selling merchandise in the village they were born in. They are a humble, hard-working family that wishes to get ahead for the children. They have been able to get their most precious possession, the house, which used to made out of cane and now it’s completely made of cement. Their dream is to open a store.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

José se dedica a vender mariscos (camarón, pescado, cangrejos) al por mayor y menor. Tiene una experiencia de 30 años en esta actividad. Su padre fue pescador y desde niño junto a sus hermanos, tuvieron que aprender el oficio para poder llevar el pan diario a la casa. Cuando se casó, se vino a vivir a Guayaquil-Isla Trinitaria junto a sus padres y continuó con su negocio. Él sale a pescar en grupo de 5 personas en su propia canoa a motor en aguas profundas por diferentes puntos de Guayaquil. Regresa cada 2 días a la casa. Cuando viene con la pesca la vende en el mercado mayorista directamente. Los sábados y domingos también vende cerca de su casa al menudeo porque la venta es buena. Sólo los miércoles no salen a pescar porque descansan. Su esposa también tiene su pequeño negocio vendiendo en los campos lo que le pidan. Ambos generan ingresos.

Él necesita el préstamo porque desea cambiar las redes de pescar y su esposa necesita comprar algunos artículos que le han solicitado.

José y su esposa nacieron en Naranjito, tiene 40 años, con 4 hijos todavía pequeños.Su esposa es su compañero y su apoyo en el trabajo. Su esposa también genera ingresos vendiendo mercadería en el pueblo donde ellos nacieron. Son una familia humilde, trabajadora, con el deseo de seguir adelante por sus hijos. Ellos han podido obtener su bien más preciado que es su casa, era de caña y ahora es de cemento totalmente. Su sueño es tener un negocio

loans.use: Comprar redes de pescar y ciertos artículos

loans.name: Roe

texts.en: Madam O. sells charcoal on a large scale to her customers. She needs a loan of $850.00 from Kiva to enable her get going in business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Mr. Dionicio sells soft drinks near schools in his area from a cart that he bought with his savings of $150.00 from his previous job. He began by selling to people passing through bus stations near his home, and eventually began to sell near schools in his neighborhood. Lately, his route has generated steady customers and increased demand for his products.

With the loan he plans to buy more of his products and to add sweets and other goods that customers have requested from him. He has more customers every day, due to the enthusiasm with which he attends to them. He is sure that by buying more merchandise and increasing his number of customers, he will be able to give a better life to his children.

Dioncio is 48 years old, has three children who are studying, and his house is built of cane. With economic stability, he hopes to have more family stability.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Dionicio se dedica a la venta de refrescos cerca de las inticuciones educativas de su sectorde de forma ambulante mediante un triciclo que adquirio con un ahorro de $150 de su anterior trabajo. Dionicio inicio atendiendo a los transeuntes de las estaciones de buses cercanas a su hogar luego comenzo a visitar las escuelas de su barrio. Actualmente su ruta de ventas le ha generado clientes seguros y mayor demanda de su producto. Con este prestamo el tiene pensado comprar mas de su producto y agregar golosina y articulos de bazar que han sido solicitado por sus clientes que cada dia son mas debido al carisma que tiene para atenderlos. Dionicio esta seguro que con la compra de mas mercaderia y el aumento de su clientela en su negocio podra otrogarles una mejor vida a sus hijos. El tiene 48 años, tres hijos que estan estudiando, su casa es de caña, con una estabiidad economica el espera tener una mejor estabilidad familiar.

loans.use: To add more products to his inventory

loans.name: Ferahim

texts.en:
Ferahim M. is 50-year-old married man who has two grown up children. He lives in Otuziki village in Imishli town, situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Ferahim has been working in his own farm for 12 years. He started his business in 1995 when he purchased two calves, raised them and sold them for meat. Then he started to farm cows for milk and sell products such as milk and yogurt. These products are in high demand and during the day Ferahim sells 3-4 liters of milk and 5 liters of yogurt.  

Ferahim has decided to go back to where he started his business since life in the village is a lot harder and would like to purchase four calves and start selling meat again. In addition he would like to purchase another cow for milk. He is requesting a loan for 1,200 USD. The estimated costs for a calf is 200 USD and for cows are 700-800 USD. Ferahim has saved some money which he will also use to make this purchase.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves each for 200 USD for meat productiona and one cow for 800 USD

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. is a 37 year-old widowed woman. She has four children and cares for two of her sister's children. Caring for the children of other members of your family (brothers or sisters) who have died (often from AIDs) is the norm in Rubaga.

Fatuma has a small home with a very low doorway that requires one to step down and duck in order to enter. In her house (with approximately dimensions of 10’ x 10’), with no apparent light except for the weak rays from the doorway, she collects a large stack of T-shirts piled on a chair. She walked to the market and bought 40-50 of the shirts, which she will now hang up and sell outside of her home. She has been doing this for two years now and goes to the market a couple times per month.

With her loan, she hopes to buy T-shirts in larger quantities. She hopes that she can buy a “bale” which would be 1,000 T-shirts. The loan will be sufficient for her to buy her first bale. This is exciting for her. She has been planning for some time how the increased quantities and the reduced cost per item will help her buy clothes for her own children.

(If you would like to learn more, please check out the Fellows Blog: The Women of Rubaga)

loans.use: To buy t-shirt in larger quanities, bales, to reduce the cost of each shirt

loans.name: Poreh

texts.en: Poreh lives in the outskirts of Kabala town in Sierra Leone.  Married with five children, she needs to work hard to make ends meet and also take care of the children.  Because the children are still small, this thirty-year-old mother cannot travel out of the house to purchase her business items.  Poreh is assisted by her mother and brother to purchase palm oil and spices from the villages.  She sells the palm oil from her home.  With her previous loans, she expanded her business and was able to purchase an additional 30 gallons of palm oil.  She is requesting a $375 loan to purchase more spices and 20 gallons of palm oil.  This will enable her to generate more income for the future of her children.

loans.use: Purchase additional spices and palm oil to sell, generating additional income

loans.name: Verina

texts.en:
Verina is 40 years old and widowed with 4 children. She also takes care of 2 orphans. She currently has a produce stand but would like to one day run a retail store of her own. People often start with selling wares/food at a produce stand as a way to support their families. However, these are temporary stand alone structures into which all goods must be packed up at the end of the day. It can be hot out there between the stores and the street.

Unless you are in the marketplace with all the other produce vendors, you will probably want to eventually have a retail store where you can get out of the heat, lock up at night and stock with a lot more items. Verina would like to have a store, but for now she uses her profits to just pay school fees. With her loan she will continue stocking her produce stand and hopefully expanding her business.

loans.use: Verina plans to use her loan to continue stocking her produce stand.

loans.name: Aina

texts.en: Aina I. is 38 years old, married with five children and lives in Ajamgbadi town in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a stylist who sells beauty supplies, and also runs a grinding machine used to process farm items such as pepper and beans. Aina has been a LAPO client for the last three years, and has applied for a new loan of $450 to buy supplies for her salon.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for a beauty parlor

loans.name: Maria De La Concepci

texts.es:
Maria is 42 years of age, she is married and has 5 children she has to nourish and educate. She lives in the Los Ríos community, a rural zone whose lands offer favorable environmental conditions for the cultivation of pineapples, especially the “Monte Lirio” variety. She owns several blocks of land in which she has grown pineapples, and she sells her product during the months of May, June and July, when the harvest gives its best fruit. Maria’s husband helps her in the entire process from the pre-sowing stage, to the cut and transportation of the fruit for its sale.

The earnings they obtain with the sale of their agricultural products vary according to the time of year, for which reason Maria’s husband has another occupation in addition to growing pineapples. He works as a carpenter making wooden furniture. With this activity they can cover all the expenses of the harvest as well as cover their household expenses and other necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos a quien alimentar y educar, habita en la comunidad de Los Ríos, zona rural, tierra que presenta condiciones ambientales favorables para el cultivo de piña, especialmente de variedad “Monte Lirio”. La señora cuenta con unas manzanas de tierras en la que ha sembrado piña, su producto lo comercializa en los meses de Mayo, Junio y Julio, meses donde la cosecha da su mejor fruto, el esposo de Doña Maria le ayuda en todo el proceso de pre-siembra hasta el corte y acarreo del fruto para su debida comercialización. Las ganancias que obtienen con la venta de sus productos agrícolas varían según la época del año, es por eso que el esposo de Doña Maria realiza otra actividad aparte de cultivar piña, trabaja de carpintero (elabora muebles de madera). Es con esta actividad que pueden hacer frente a todos los gastos de la cosecha así como cubrir los gastos del hogar y demás necesidades.

loans.use: Purchase chemical fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Wartteny

texts.en: Wartteny lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. She sells clothing from her home. This is the fourth time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs $1200 to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the shop

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Gumercinda is a very popular and enterprising lady. Since she was a young girl, she has always tried to generate her own income to support her humble parents with the expenses of her home. So after she concluded her secondary studies she decided to work selling seasonal products. Now, for this season she is selling a big variety of gifts for weddings. She buys the products wholesale in the city of Tacna and she sells them in the city of Juliaca and other bordering little towns. Thanks to this small business she is managing to cover her basic needs and at the same time, support economically her dear parents. Gumercinda has many plans with her business and she is certain that with your support she will be able to increase her working capital and increase her profits in a short period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Ana GabrieL. Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Gumercinda es una dama muy popular y emprendedora, desD. niña siempre ha tratado D. generar sus propios ingresos para apoyar a sus humildes padres con los gastos D. su hogar, es así que cuando concluyó sus estudios secundarios decidió dedicarse a L. venta D. productos por campañas. Ahora, por esta temporada oferta una gran variedad D. regalos para matrimonios, mercadería que trae al por mayor D. L. ciudad D. Tacna y ofrece en L. ciudad D. Juliaca y demás pueblitos aledaños, gracias a este pequeño negocio está logrando cubrir sus necesidades primarias y al mismo tiempo apoyar económicamente a sus queridos padres.Gumercinda tiene muchos planes con su negocio y está segura que con tu apoyo podrá aumentar el monto D. inversión e incrementar sus beneficios en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Increase of working capital to be able to offer a bigger quantity of products.

loans.name: Olga Alicia

texts.es:
Olga started her business to support her husband with household expenses. Since her husband didn’t have a stable job, she was forced to look for a lucrative activity, and that’s how she got into selling clothes. She started two years ago, selling door to door. Now she holds events where she shows her clothes three times a week, a strategy that has resulted in greater sales.

She is presently requesting a $400 loan, to be repaid in six months, which will be invested in buying a sales rack, to be used in more frequent clothes shows.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga inició el negocio para salir adelante por si misma y para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y salir adelante. Su principal necesidad fue el que su esposo no tuviera un trabajo fijo, lo que la obligó a buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos y se puso a vender ropa. Comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo casa por casa hasta realizar demostraciones 3 dias por semana, estrategia que le genero mejores ventas y es asi como ha continuado su negocio.

Ahora solicita un prestamo por US $ 400, que pagará en 6 meses, para comprar un estante para ventas y poder utilizarlo para realizar demostraciones de ropa más de 3 veces por semana.

loans.use: Purchase of a sales rack.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao M., 39, and her husband, Mr. Savuth Ma, 39, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometres from Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. One of their sons is construction worker and the other two children are in local school.

Mrs. Sreymao has been a silk weaver since she was nineteen years old, a skill she learned from her neighbour. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Savuth works in a parking station. 

Sreymao is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Zenayda

texts.es:
Zenayda has made a living selling and distributing clothes for 4 months. She had worked selling food for 9 years before, but she had to wrap up that business to care for her children. She now sells clothes on order to her neighbors and friends. The business allows her to spend more time with her children.

The loans that Zenayda has applied for have been used to buy the clothes she sells. She would like to have a space of her own for selling her clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Zenayda se dedica a la venta y reparto de ropa desde hace 4 meses. Ella se ha dedicado por 9 años a la venta de comida, sin embargo tuvo que dejar este negocio debido a que tenía que cuidar a sus hijos. Ahora se encarga de vender ropa por pedidos a sus vecinos y amigos. De este modo, comparte más tiempo con sus hijos.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar la ropa que ofrece. A ella le gustaría tener un puesto y vender su ropa allí.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a new assortment of stylish pants to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas M. is 42 years old. She is married and has three children. Her family lives in Khujand, Northern Tajikistan. Mukaddas sells clothes for children in the central city market. The location of her vending store is very favorable as it’s in a busy place.

Mukaddas has been in this trade for 2 years. She has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Mukaddas is hoping to take a loan of 300 USD to increase the variety of inventory in her store and keep her business running successfully this autumn season. She promises to fulfill the loan term within 12 months. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the education expenses of her children.

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Maura G. me dedico a la venta de frescos naturales y tambien vendo lacteos como ser quesos, mantequilla y quesillo, mi negocio lo tengo ubicado en un lugar muy estrategico para las ventas ya que es una zona muy transitada por mucha gente y eso hace que mis refrescos se vendan muy bien.
en estos momentos necesito un credito para poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion la cual me ha costado mucho y deseo tener una mejor calidad de vida.
las mejoras que le deseo hacer a mi casa es ponerle piso y repellar las paredes ya que solo estan los puros ladrillos y en el piso solo esta la plancha de cemento.
soy madre soltera y he sacado a mis hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Hi, my name is Maura G., and I sell natural fruit drinks and also butter and fresh cheese. My business is located in a very strategic location for sales because it is a neighborhood well-traveled by many people. This means that my drinks sell very well. Right now, I need credit to remodel my house, which costs a lot, and I would like to attain a better quality of life. The home improvements that I wish to make are remodeling the floors to be made of cement and walls to be made of brick. I am a single mother, and I have raised my children.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials such as cement, brick, sand, etc.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La señora Sandra, socia del BC Mujeres Activas,  vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito D. Bellavista. Tiene 37 años D. edad, vive con su esposo  que es chofer. Se dedica a la venta D. pollo y gallinas evisceradas así como  a la venta D. verduras en los 2 puestos D. venta que tiene en el mercado D. la ciudad.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará verduras como cebollas, zapallos, zanahoria, tomates, papa, entre otros, también comprará pollos y gallinas para sacrificar y venderlos al menudeo. Quiere contar con todo lo que requieran sus clientes. 

Sandra tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal y cree que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres emprendedoras. Trabaja duro cada día porque quiere crecer en su negocio y contar con una bodega bien implementada más adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra, a member of the BC Mujeres Activas, lives in the San Martín region, Bellavista province and district. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband who is a driver. She sells chickens and hens with their organs removed as well as vegetables in two stalls that are in the central market in the city. With this loan of 2,000 soles ($650), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy vegetables such as onions, squash, carrots, tomatoes, potatoes, among others, and also chickens and hens in order to slaughter and sell them in the market. She wants to have all that her customers need. Sandra has 5 years working with the communal bank and believes that Manuela Ramos is a support for her and her family, as well as for other women entrepreneurs. She works hard every day because she wants to grow her business and later have a well-established storeroom.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables such as onions, squash, carrots, tomatoes and chickens and hens

loans.name: Migdonia

texts.es: Migdonia tiene 44 años, es viuda, vive con sus dos hijos, Henry de 19 años y Yenny de 17. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas, detergentes, aceites, etc., además, de variedad de productos comestibles, ella vende en la Mina la Rinconada, donde lleva sus productos, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde aproximadamente, ya que también debe dedicarle tiempo a sus hijos, los cuales se encuentran en edades muy difíciles requiriendo de su guía. El negocio es rentable, lo más difícil es tener que trabajar en el inclemente frío de la zona. Migdonia se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos para comercializar y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Migdonia is 44 years old, widowed, and lives with her two children, Henry who is 19 years old and Yenny who is 17. She sells candy, detergents, oils, etc, as well as a variety of food products. She sells these in the Rinconada mine, where she brings her products, working from 8 in the morning until approximately 3 in the afternoon. She must also devote time to her children, who are at a difficult age and require her guidance. Her business is profitable; the most difficult thing is that she has to work in the inclement cold of the region. This is Migdonia’s first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money requested, she will buy a large quantity of products to market and in this way increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Seynabou Ablaye

texts.fr: Seynabou Ablaye, 45 ans, mariée, 08 enfants et 02 autres en charge est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son petit commerce de fruits locaux et saisonniers (orange, clémentine, mandarine).Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Seynabou Ablaye, age 45, is married and has eight children, plus two others in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Khodoba for seven years. She wants to bolster her small-scale scale business in local and seasonal fruit (oranges, clementines, mandarin oranges). Her income helps her improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell local seasonal fruit

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. is forty five years old. She is widowed and has six children, four girls and two boys. Two of her children are in junior high school. Some children have completed junior high school but due to financial constraints, they are unable to continue to the senior high school. Hawa lives with her family, in an old family house at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming and commercial town. The majority of the inhabitants are either farmers or trade in farm produce.  Very few dwellers of Offinso are office workers. 

Hawa trades in maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She distributes this maize to food vendors in her community and those who come from the cities to buy in the local market where she sells. She has been in business for over twenty years. She wants a loan to buy maize in large scale so that she can supply the increasing number of customers and also to increase her profit margin. She aspires to improve the living condition of the family. It is also her desire to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy maize in large quantities for resale

loans.name: Ally

texts.en: Ally K. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and married man. He runs a business of selling charcoal at Kisiwan ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases charcoal bags directly from the producers wholesale and sells it retail to customers from Vituka. K. has been running the business for three years. The income generated is used to meet his family's daily demands and to pay his children's school fees. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to increase his purchases of charcoal bags.

loans.use: To buy more stock (charcoal)

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh A. is 46 years old, and lives with his wife and eight children. He continues working hard to give his family a better tomorrow. Sadly, Saleh has a daughter who suffers from heart disease, a sickness that requires continuous treatment in the hospital, along with all the related high costs.

Saleh's works repairing and selling spare parts for appliances.  He made up his mind to turn to Ryada for a loan of $1000,  With this loan he will be able to purchase more parts and accessories needed for completing the his many jobs. He hopes this investment will increase his profits, which in turn, will allow him to better provide for his family, including his sick daughter's medical services. Let us help Saleh‘s daughter who has been hit by some of the unfortunate things in life.

loans.use: To purchase more parts and accessories for appliance repair

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El Sr. Isidro es casado y tiene 1 hijo menor de 5 años. Isidro y su familia viven en Hernandarias en un asentamiento muy conocido y muy poblado.

Isidro tiene una despensa bien surtida y es la única del barrio. El se inicio hace varios años con muy poca mercadería que poco a poco fue aumentando con el pasar de los años hoy día el tiene una despensa bien surtida y con buenísima clientela ya que es la única despensa que se encuentra en su comunidad.

El es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable a sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Isidro is married and has one young five-year-old son. Isidro and his family live in Hernandarias in a very well known and densely populated settlement. Isidro has a well stocked convenience store, the only one in the neighbourhood. He started a number of years ago with very few goods and little by little has built up his business with the passage of time so that today he has a well-stocked store with an excellent customer base as it is the only convenience store in his community. He is a very hardworking person and very responsible in his commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods such as flour, sugar, noodles and so on

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke is 42 years old and married with three children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She hopes to own a big supermarket in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Tagbaneh Group

texts.en:
This is Ejiatu J., Fatu K. and Jariatu K.. Ejiatu (in the middle) is the leader of the group. Ejiatu sells cooking oil, flour, margi and so on at the Makeni city market. She buys her goods from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city, where commodities are relatively cheap. She has been a businesswoman for many years. Ejiatu will combine this loan with her current business capital to buy ten bags of sugar and ten bags of salt. A bag of sugar is sold at 100,000 leones and a bag of salt costs 20,000 leones.

Ejiatu is 45-years of age. She is married to a farmer and they have eight children. Seven of their children are still in primary and secondary schools and the eldest is now a grown-up. She was born in Sanda, a series of small towns about 30 miles from Makeni city.  

This group is named Tagbaneh. The members are local entrepreneurs in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have accessed several loans from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have promoted development in the lives of these businesswomen. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 leones each in order to further strengthen their businesses.

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar and salt

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi G. is fifty-five years old. He is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters. Three of them have already completed school. The last born is currently in senior high school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Kofi's wife works to help him support the family financially. She is a food vendor. Kofi is a craft man. He makes artifacts for sale. He weaves baskets from canes. He buys the canes from nearby communities. Kofi supplies the baskets to the market women. He wants a loan to procure working materials such as cane in bulk. He has been in business for over twenty years. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy cane in bulk

loans.name: Rosa Rafael Muabsa

texts.pt:
Name : Rosa Rafael Muabsa C.
Internal Client ID : 18555
Location; BOANE
Primary Activity:  COMERCIO
 Loan Requested ; 18.000,00mt
Repayment Term: 16 
Loan Use; Compra e venda de produtos
Disbursement Hluvuku; 01/06/09


Rosa nasceu em vilanculos (a 800 km de boane) tem 45 anos de idade, casada e mãe de cinco filhos. frenquentou escola ate 4 classe. Parou de estudar por motivos sociais e financeiros dos seus progenitores. O primeiro filho tem 17 anos de idade e o mais novo é que estuda na Escola secundaria de Boane.
 É residente da Matola a 24 anos. Chegou a maputo a covinte da sua irmã que arranjou lhe emprego no bairro peri urbano da cidade de Maputo (chamanculo), onde trabalhou somente um ano e tendo depois contraído matrimonio com seu marido e passaram a viver na Matola ate hoje na cas própria.

No ano de 1992, logo depois do acordo geral da paz, iniciou um negocio de venda de artigos diversos e já tem uma experiência de pelo menos 19 anos nesta actividade. Vende mantas/cobertores que as compra na áfrica do sul e revenda a 1.200,00MT cada, como seu principal objecto de negocio. Nesta e estação de inverno aqui em Moçambique, vende mais e o rendimento diário varia entre 2.000,00MT e 2.300,00MT.

Não tem empregado porque consegue fazer pessoalmente sem problemas. Este é seu segundo empréstimo com a hluvuku e primeiro com KIVA no valor de 18.000,00MT para aumentar o volume do negocio e responder a demanda de mantas neste momento de frio. Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições financeiras e que ouviu falar da hluvuku em conversa com as amigas.
Propõe se a pagar sem problemas para pedir mais empréstimos com objectivo de expandir mais o negocio assim como construir um salão de cabalaria e construir mais uma casa.
texts.en:
Name : Rosa Rafael Muabsa C. Internal Client ID : 18555 Location; BOANE Primary Activity: COMERCIO Loan Requested ; 18.000,00mt Repayment Term: 16 Loan Use; Compra e venda de produtos Disbursement Hluvuku; 01/06/09 Rosa was born in the city of Vilanculos, situated 800 Km from Boane, Mozambique. 45 years old, married, and the mother of 5 kids, Rosa's studies were interrupted in 4th grade, due to her family's financial constraints. Her oldest son, now 17, is enrolled in High School, in Boane. She moved from Vilanculos to Maputo when her sister found her a job in the neighborhood of Chamanculo, where she worked for a year before marrying her husband and moving to Matola. They have been in Matola, where they own their own place, for the past 24 years. After the General Peace Treaty was signed, in 1992 [ending Mozambique's 16-year civil war between the ruling party and the opposition], Rosa started a business of buying and selling, among other things, blankets and bedspreads--buying them in South Africa and reselling in Matola for profit. Her daily income varies from 2.000.00 and 2.300,00 MT. She has been in this business, which she runs by herself, for 19 years. Rosa heard about Hluvuku through friends. This is her second loan with Hluvuku, and the first with Kiva (she's never had loans with other institutions). These 18.000,00 MT will allow her to buy more blankets to answer the increase in demand during the upcoming winter months. She anticipates paying her loan back without difficulties, and plans to take other loans out in the future, to continue improving her business as well as to start a hair salon and build another house.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in her business

loans.name: Nassiratou

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans ce commerce ce qui a fait qu’elle a une parfaite maîtrise de ce commerce. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Sa clientèle grandissante, elle veut associer à son commerce de pagnes le commerce de bijoux, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 différents bijoux et 15 colliers. Elle est mariée et mère de 01 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman sells "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) to earn her living. She has been in this business for 3 years, which means that she has a perfect mastery of the trade. She buys her inventory in the big open-air market of Lomé.

As her clientele is growing, she wants to add to this business selling "pagnes" the sale of costume jewelry, so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 20 different pieces of jewelry and 15 necklaces. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pagnes and costume jewelry

loans.name: Chelsea Group

texts.en:
These gentlemen are small-scale businessmen in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group after their favorite football team, Chelsea. This will be the first loan they are accessing from SMT/Kiva. Business has been growing at a very slow pace for these entrepreneurs, but with the help of a loan, their businesses will develop at a faster rate and make better profit, so that their living standards will improve.

Gibo Akim K. (right) is the leader of the group. Gibo was born in Makeni city thirty-two years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have two children. One of their children is in class six and the other is in class two. Gibo owns a shop in which he sells a variety of items including drinks, biscuits, sugar, batteries, onions, etc. He has been in this business for more than ten years now.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia started her own cafe business selling food two years ago. She works 18 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings. She is a 34-year-old woman, separated from her husband, and the mother of three children. Her children are 12, 7 and 3 years old; she also cares for two other dependents. Alicia is a member of the Twiga borrower group. 

This is Alicia's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 200,000 in order to buy more rice and sugar for her business. With the profit she gains from the use of this loan, Alicia hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, wheat and sugar

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is a 19-year-old young man living with his parents. In 2007, he decided to help his parents with his university fees by working at his university repairing computers. Jimmy is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy computer parts in order to develop his work and therefore, his income.

loans.use: Buy computer parts

loans.name: Sergyi

texts.en:
Sergyi is married and has two children. His family is an average Ukrainian family trying to survive in the midst of a difficult global financial situation. Sergyi is a small market vendor, and sells women’s outer clothing in the central marketplace in his home town of Belaya Tserkov. Sergyi has been in the trade for nine years. He has established good contacts with his suppliers, and he buys his inventory from Ukrainian manufacturers. This helps him keep his prices low and attract more customers. Sergyi currently has about 24,000 Grivnyas invested in his business.

Sergyi is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to restock his merchandise for the fall season, and his sales will increase as a result. He is very energetic and full of expansion ideas. Sergyi is very grateful for financial assistance which has become a helpful tool in his entrepreneurial endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase and restock merchandise

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 63 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 2 años se dedica a la venta D. comida, día a día prepara los alimentos que ofrecerá y repartirá a sus clientes a la hora del almuerzo, quienes en su mayoría son los empleados D. las diversas instituciones y empresas D. su localidad. Teresa reparte los almuerzos en recipientes D. plástico para dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Y debido a su buena sazón ha notado las ventajas, pues su clientela va en aumento, lo que favorece al crecimiento D. su negocio.
Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas, por lo que renueva su compromiso D. responsabilidad. El dinero que viene solicitando será para invertirlo en la compra D. los ingredientes básicos para la preparación D. sus comidas, como arroz, azúcar, papas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Teresa is 63 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home. She started selling food 2 years ago. Everyday Teresa prepares meals and offers them at lunchtime to her customers, who are mostly employees from different institutions and businesses in her area. She also delivers lunches in plastic containers to proviD. greater convenience to her customers. Her tasty meals have resulted in more customers and an increased growth of her business.

This is Teresa’s second loan with MFP. During this time, she has demonstrated that she is punctual with her loan payments and promises to continue in the same manner. The money she requested will be used to buy basic ingredients for preparing meals such as rice, sugar, potatoes, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing meals

loans.name: Llinset Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Linsset del Carmen López, tiene la edad de 44 años, vive  en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casado con tres hijos de 13,15,17 años estudiantes,  sus planes es poder construir su casa para dejar un buen patrimonio a sus hijos, su esposo se desempeña como contador, y ella en facturación en una distribuidora desde hace trece años, el cual ha ido poco a poco construyendo su casa, es el cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara bloques para terminar de cerrar la casa toda de concreto en la parte trasera para mejor seguridad ante la delincuencia. Agrádese a la institución por la oportunidad de mejorar su vivienda.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para terminar de hacer su casa de concreto

loans.name: Ndiaplay

texts.fr:
Madame Nidapaly N. est une commerçant de boubou et tissus en Camberene, Dakar.  Avec son prêt de 100.000 CFA, elle voudrait augmenter son fond roulement pour acheter des nouveaux tissus pour son petit entreprise.  Elle est mariée avec deux enfants.
Madame N. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndiaplay N. is a retailer of boubous (wide-sleeved West African robes) and fabric in Camberene, Dakar. With a loan of 100,000 CFA, she would like to increase her working capital to buy new fabric for her small business. She is married with two children. Ms. N. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC (one of Kiva's field partners) and the Program for the Development of Children and Families (PDEF in French) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community, and especially to protect children who come from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can benefit from loans having more flexible terms, as compared to ordinary loans. Since the agreement's inception in December 2008, 120 parents have received financing in amounts varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge her stocks of merchandise

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 35 year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Mouhamad has been running a big generator for five years. This generator allows several apartments to have electricity when there is an electricity cut off. Since in his region there is a lot of cut offs, he wants to expand his business to provide electricity to more houses. Mouhamad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase diesel and do some maintenance work on his generator. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mouhamad first started his business, he had to face competition. Mouhamad decided on doing his work because of his experience and he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase diesel and do some maintenance work on his generator.

loans.name: God Is Love Group

texts.en:
Marie M. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called God is Love. 

Marie is 29 years old and married with 3 children who are between 1 and 9 years old. Their educational levels range from nursery school to 2nd grade. Marie and her family live in the Brewerville community north of Monrovia, Liberia and work in the Nezoo community, south of Monrovia. 

Marie runs a general goods store (provision shop). She buys general goods like candles, oil, sugar, milk, etc. from wholesalers and sells them retail to residents of the Nezoo community. Marie has been running this business for a year, and wants to improve her business by establishing branches in Monrovia in the future.

Marie has excellent customer service skills; consequently, customers come to her repeatedly. She started by selling by using a sum of LD 35,000.00 that was given to her by her husband.

Marie needs this loan to purchase more goods to improve business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and changing their living conditions.

loans.use: purchasing general goods like candles, oil, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”,vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 36 años de edad , cuenta con estudios primarios concluìdos, es casada, tiene en su poder a un hijo y se dedica a la compra y venta de ovejas.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años atrás y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ganado ovino.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invertirá en la compra de ovejas.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener una casa en Ilo. Lo que màs le gusta de su organización son las reuniones y el ahorro mensual, porque esto le permite tener un fondo de emergencia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda is a member of the “24th of June” community bank. She lives in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao in the area of Puno. She is 36 years old and has her secondary studies completed. She is married and has a son in her charge. She buys and sells sheep for a living. She works with the Manuel Ramos movement for the the last three years and her first community bank loan was for S/300 Peruvian nuevos soles, all of which she invested in the purchase of sheep. She is requesting a loan of S/3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles, which she would invest in the purchase of sheep. Her hope for the future is to have a home in Ilo. What she likes most about the organization are the meetings and the monthly savings because it allows her to have an emergency savings fund.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Sakariaou

texts.en: Mr. A. runs a grocery store in the Bé district of Lomé. He is married to a hotel manager and they have 2 children. This will be his first loan with WAGES, which he will use to restock his shelves for his clientele. He will purchase prepaid cellphone cards, canned sodas, preserves, pastas, and other diverse products. With the profits, Mr. A.’s entire family will benefit.

loans.use: purchase a variety of grocery products

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian I. is single and has received a junior high education. Since 2006 she has been working as a hairdresser in her own beauty salon at Ataabazi near Elmina, where she also sells hair creams and weavons. Vivian uses her income to pay her rent and utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase more hair creams and weavons to meet customer demand. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vivian plans to save so that she can invest in her business and improve her services.

loans.use: To purchase more hair creams and weavons

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 70 years old with eight adult children. She is a dairy farmer in the Murang'a area of the Central Province of Kenya. She also earns income from coffee and milk sales and maize and bean farming. She's been a farmer for over twenty years and also keeps bees and rabbits. She says that the major challenges for her business are lack of funds to buy more dairy cows and feed for her rabbits.

She requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. In the future, she hopes to have at least a total of four dairy cows, increase her bee hives, and acquire more rabbits. She hopes to increase her income through milk sales so that she won't have to rely on her children. She says that the future is bright because Juhudi loans will help her and other members achieve their farming goals.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta E. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Mareta is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mareta owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily-use products in the local community. Mareta has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mareta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mareta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mareta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mareta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jorge Humberto

texts.es:
el sr. Jorge Humberto O. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la colonia Sempe de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, tiene un pequeño comedor en el cual vende desayunos, almuerzos y la especialidad del negocio es la carne asada. Don Jorge cuenta con 4 empleados. Jorge se levanta a las 5 de la mañana todos los dias ya que tiene un contrato de servicio de alimentacion con la policia Municipal.
Jorge es casado y tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos estan estudiando y uno es recien nacido.
el credito que solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en su negocio ya que las ventas estan mejorando y no se da abasto para cubrir las necesidades de todos sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con todos los gastos de su familia y de su hogar. dice sentirse muy feliz ya que tuvo la bendicion de Dios de darle otro hijo que nacio sano. su hijo apenas tiene dos semanas de haber nacido.
texts.en:
Jorge Humberto O., 38, lives in Tegucigalpa's Sempe neighborhood. He has a small eatery where he sells breakfasts and lunches; his specialty is grilled meat. Jorge has 4 employees. Jorge gets up at 5am every day because he has a contract to prepare food for the municipal police department. Jorge is married and has 4 children, three of whom are students and one, who is a new-born. He needs funding to invest in his business because sales are improving and he does not have enough supplies to meet all customer demand. He needs the profits to cover family and household expenses. He states that he is very happy because God blessed him with another son who was born healthy; his son is barely two weeks old.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef, pork, chicken, vegetables, soft-drinks, lard, cooking oil, spices, tortillas, bread, beans, rice, sugar, disposable plates and drinking glasses, coffee, water, juices, potatoes, cabbage, yucca, eggs. butter, cheese, quesillo (a type of cheese similar to cottage cheese)

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
El Señor Derlis B. de 28 años de edad, esta casado  con la Señora Maria Bajeza de 27 años de edad, ellos aun no conocen la dicha de tener hijos.
   Don Derlis se dedica  al rubro de reparaciones de celulares  aproximadamente  desde el año 2.005; el empezó a trabajar con el capital que su papá le prestó, vendiendo aceites y filtros para camiones, años después descubrió que seria más rentable para el, la venta y reparación de celulares y decidió trabajar fuertemente es este rubro,  en la actualidad su negocio progreso bastante.
   El utilizaría este crédito para comprar de herramientas que el utiliza en su trabajo y además   para la compra materiales de construcción para la refacción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Derlis B., 28, is married to Maria Bajeza, 27; they have no children, yet. Derlis has had a cell phone repair shop since 2005. He began a business selling truck lubricants and filters with funds that his father lent him. However, years later he discovered that the sale and repair of cell phones was a more profitable line of work so he decided to invest heavily in it. Currently, his business has made much progress. He will use the funds to buy work tools he uses and will also buy building materials and suplies for some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools and building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Wilma Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora Wilma Franciasca tiene 33 años de edad ella vive en Cochabamba sola con sus 2 hijos pequeños, su esposo vive en Santa Cruz, Wilma vive en inmediaciones de Mallco Rancho, en la periferia de la ciudad, en una zona agrícola de la Zona de Sipe-Sipe de la provincia de Quillacollo.

Wilma es una señora que dedica a la producción de leche cruda, ella y su familia siempre están en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, por esa misma razón su esposo viajo hasta Santa Cruz para buscar trabajo y así desde ese departamento poder enviar dinero a su familia, a pesar de los esfuerzos que ambos esposos hacen, no pueden cubrir todas las necesidades que quisieran dar a sus hijos, pues viven en dos cuartitos rústicos fríos y de paredes de adobe, ella usa un fogón para cocinar con leña, y usa ollas de barro. Wilma tiene los deseos de comprarse un terreno peño donde poder dar cobijo y sustento a sus hijitos.   

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de soya para poder aumentar la producción de leche y la elaboración de quesillo y teniendo más ingresos podrá ofrecerle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
. Wilma Franciasca, 33, lives alone in Cochabamba with her two, small children; her husband lives in Santa Cruz. Wilma lives near Mallco Rancho, in the outskirts of the city, in a farming area of Sipe-Sipe, Quillacollo province. Wilma is a raw milk farmer; she and her family are always looking for ways to improve their quality of life. This is why her husband moved to Santa Cruz: to find work and send back money to the family from there. Despite the couple’s joint efforts, they are still unable to meet all household expenses and provide all they’d like for their children. They live in two, rudimentary, cold little rooms with adobe walls. She cooks in a hearth with firewood and uses clay pots. Wilma dreams with buying a small lot where she can provide shelter and sustenance for her wee ones. She is asking for funds to buy feed for her cows to increase milk production and to make quesillo (a cottage-cheese like product) so that income will increase and she can offer her family with an improved standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy cow feed.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Con Propositos Group

texts.en:
Aurelinda is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Unidas Con Propositas (Women United with Purposes), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, a city famous for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner.

Aurelinda is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She makes curtains in her business. By purchasing a sewing machine and purchasing more fabric, her business will grow. She will use the profits to invest in growing her business to be a full fledged production center with several employees. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Fabric, sewing machine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. wants to find a way to improve her family's standard of living. To fulfill this aspiration in life, she joined one of Kiva's field partners, ASHI, in 2004, and felt very glad to be given the opportunity for a loan. 

She retails food vending products and has been doing so for the past six years. As a busy entrepreneur, Elizabeth has also been selling different small items for supplementary income. Building her business, Elizabeth would like to receive a loan of 20,000 PHP to increase the inventory of goods sold  through her food vending business and support the inventories of her secondary business of retailing different goods.

She is planning to purchase additional products such as chicken, sugar, pork, milk and tuna, and the remaining money will be used to maintain her secondary business of selling small items like bath soap, shampoo, and other supplies. Elizabeth believes that offering a larger assortment of goods to customers will increase revenue from her businesses and maintain customer fidelity.

With the loan from Kiva, Elizabeth wants to resupply from wholesalers so she can better manage to offer good service and to match the needs of her customers. With her expected profits, Elizabeth wants to focus on her grandchildren's schooling and to invest in her home. 

Her long term goals are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her businesses and to have a full-fledged expanded business.  Through hard work, Elizabeth is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial initiatives and from the support from ASHI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
