This group loan has four people who live in Boeng Leu-I village in Kandal province. They will each use their loan for different purposes that will improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Kheng S. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. 

Mrs. Kheng S. owns a general store and also sells fish. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it.  Therefore, Mrs. Kheng S. is asking for a loan to buy more fish to resell. Her husband, Mr. Kak Heu Kry, is a farmer who owns ten-hectares of land and grows crops to sell to support the famiL.. Through this activity, the couple supports three children.  Two of the children attend the local public school and the youngest is a year old.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Jacques  Babatoundé

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est âgé de 34 ans, il est un couturier brodeur, il fait cette activité depuis 1998, la machine qu’il utilise pour faire son activité de broderie est en panne, il souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat d’une nouvelle machine à Broderie. Il est marié et père  d’un enfant .
texts.en:
This gentleman is 34 years old. He is a tailor and embroiderer, and has been active in this profession since 1998. The machine he has been using for embroidery is out of order and he needs a replacement. This is why he approached WAGES requesting a loan to buy a new embroidery machine. He is married and the father of one child.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: D. Jeannette est née le 06 Juin 1976 et est mariée à BEDOU Raoul, un commerçant. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Jeannette s’est installée avec son mari et leurs enfants au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis environs quinze ans. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différentes charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Jeannette vend des friperies à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Jeannette achète ses produits aussi à Dantokpa. Jeannette exerce cette activité depuis treize ans environs et a déjà obtenu quatre prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Jeannette désire rehausser le niveau de son activité et accroître sa clientèle pour se faire plus de revenus ; c’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter un cinquième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ms. D. Jeannette was born on June 6, 1976 and is married to Mr. BEDOU Raoul, a merchant.  The couple have three children who are all in school.  Along with her husband, she settled in the Avotrou district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, about fifteen years ago.  The couple jointly provide for their family.  To support herself, Jeannette sells second-hand clothing in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She buys her goods at Dantokpa too.  She has been in this business for about thirteen years and has already had four loans, which have all been repaid.  Jeannette would like to raise her level of business and grow her customer base in order to bring in more revenue.  This is what has lead her to request a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying used clothing

loans.name: Sivai

texts.en:
Sivai T. is 55 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Sivai has 4 years of experience in this business.  Sivai needs a loan of WST$2500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US$125 per week) to improve/expand the business.  Sivai is an active client and wishes to expand the business and assist her family financially.

This is Sivai's 4th loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Sivai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Shamim Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhter lives in Pakistan in the historic city called Lahore with her husband and children. She is a seamstress and sews clothes for her nearby clients. She has a worker who collects orders for her so she completes them on time and earns an income. 

Shamim fulfills her responsibilities as a housewife and a mother very efficiently as well. Her family respects her a lot for her courageous nature and dedication towards both her responsibilities. 

Her husband runs a grocery shop in the market. Every day he faces new challenges with other grocery shops. To conquer those challenges he has to perform extraordinarily. This can only happen when he fulfills the demand of his customers. 

Therefore, Shamim has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. He will be using the loan amount by adding grocery inventory to his grocery shop. She is hopeful that this loan amount will have a positive impact on her husband’s business.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Taibatou

texts.fr: T. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis très longtemps déjà. elle y a associé une activité saisonnière qui se trouve être le commerce d'articles scolaires. la rentrée scolaire étant proches elle souhaiterait s'approvisionner en articles scolaires et profiter acheter quelques produits d'alimentation générale raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de wages un prêt pour acheter  2 cartons de cahiers,  1 cartons de bics, 1 cartons de crayons et divers autres produits d'alimentation générale. elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. runs a money-making business selling general food products. She has already run her shop for a very long time. Along with this business, she runs a seasonal business selling educational items. With the beginning of the school year approaching, she wishes to stock up on educational items and and to buy some general food products, which is why she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 2 boxes of notebooks, 1 box of Bic pens, 1 box of pencils and various other general food products. She is married and the mother of 3 children.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is an active member of the Eronge Youth Group which is being funded by Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo. He is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. He has been farming for five years and employs two people from his community. He sells his milk, maize and tea at a local market.

Joshua is 25 years-old. He is married and has been blessed with two children, ages three and six. One of them attends school.

Joshua has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will help increase his milk productivity which will inturn increase his income.

He faces the challenges of dry weather and hailstorms which destroys his crops. In the future, he plans to acquire more land and cows and to sell his produce wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maida

texts.es: La Sra. Maida vive en la Urbanización El Recreó en la zona del Plan 3000, ella se dedica a la venta de comida que prepara en su casa y saca a vender durante las noches en su mismo domicilio, además de vender en su casa ella prepara a pedido comida para eventos sociales, ella es muy conocida por el buen servicio que brinda además de ser responsables y trabajadora. Su esposo trabaja como taxista en transporte urbano, ellos tienen 3 hijas que asisten a primaria. La Sra. Maida necesita del crédito para poder comprar una nueva heladera y un freezer para poder almacenar la carne y verduras que compra, ya que con los que contaba se le arruinaron un corte de energía eléctrica que hubo en el barrio.
texts.en:
Maida lives in the El Recreo Urbanization in Plan 3000 zone. She sells food that she prepares at home and sells outside her house in the evenings. Besides selling outside her home she also prepares food on special order for social events. She is very well known thanks to the good service she provides as well as for being very responsible and hardworking. Her husband is employed as an urban taxi driver. They have three daughters that go to primary school. Maida needs funds to buy a new refrigerator and a freezer to store the meat and vegetables she buys because the ones she used to own were ruined due to an electrical short in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and a freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more rubber utensils and sets of dishes for her business

loans.name: Asylkan

texts.en:
Asylkan D. is young farmer who lives in Shopokov village in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. She is 26, married, and has one son aged four.  Her husband works at the woodworking plant and makes all his efforts to provide his family with essentials. Unfortunately, his salary is very low and doesn’t meet all expenses. In order to find an additional means of subsistence and support for her family, Asylkan started her business in cattle breeding. She bought cattle for fattening and reselling and concentrated all her efforts on supporting and expanding her household. Revenues from this activity allowed Asylkan to buy a small house in the village. Also she started to breed ducks, which became her favorite hobby.

Now Asylkan wants to take a loan of 90,000 KGS to buy bull-calves for fattening and forage for cattle. With the revenues from this investment, Asylkan  plans to give a good education to her son. In the future, she plans to develop her farm by means of livestock breeding. As for her dreams, Asylkan is fond of American culture and wants to see Chicago some day. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes T. is 52 years old, married, and supports her family by operating three business ventures: fishing , fish vending and a general store. A resident of Purok 4, Brgy. Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental, Lourdes has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Lourdes is now borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her fishing boat. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lourdes aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her fishing boat

loans.name: Rachel's Group

texts.en:
Rachel M. is from Labuyo Tangub City. She is 26 years old. Rachel is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rachel is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Rachel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rachel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rachel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rachel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rachel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products for resale

loans.name: Lourdes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lourdes está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Claudia C. Gónzales de 27 años quien vende Gallina desde hace 7 años negocio en el que invertira el crédito especialmente porque en esta época navideña hay mucha demanda y desea aprovechar esta oportunidad.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son María Lourdes G. de 55 años quien vende gallinas desde hace 20 años y Manuel S. quien trabaja de sastre.
texts.en: The Lourdes Group is made up of three hard-working individuals. One of them is Claudia C. Gónzales, 27, who has been selling chickens for the past seven years. She will use the loan because during the holiday season there is high demand and she wants to take advantage of this opportunity. The other members of the group are María Lourdes G., 55, who sells chickens and Manuel S. who works as a tailor.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Lorenzo Antonio

texts.es:
Lorenzo, reside en San Simón, departamento de Morazán, tiene 59 años de edad, se dedica a la siembra y comercialización de hortalizas, él vive con su familia que es su esposa y cinco hijos quienes son: María de 29 años, Juan Pablo de 23, Lorena de 22, Pedro Eugenio de 20 y Lucio de 16 años de edad. Don Lorenzo tiene más de 14 años de dedicarse a sembrar las hortalizas, esta siembra la realiza en verano con la ayuda de sus hijos,  él recibió asesoría técnica para realizar los cultivos.
Don Lorenzo quiere sembrar en esta temporada que comienza el verano y para realizarlo solicita un préstamo ya que no cuenta con dinero para comprar los materiales agrícolas como fertilizantes, además necesita poliducto para hace llegar agua hasta la zona del cultivo y poder regar durante el crecimiento.
Con esta ayuda desarrollara la siembra y le dará el cuido necesario para que crezca sanamente y pueda dar frutos, aunque su riesgo son las plagas que pueden llegar y dañar la producción; Su objetivo es cancelar en las fechas establecidas, recibir una buena cosecha, vender a los mejores precios para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante y que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Lorenzo lives in San Simón, in the department of Morazánin. He is 59 years old and his business is the growing and selling of vegetables. He lives with his family, consisting of his wife and five children: María, 29; Juan Pablo, 23; Lorena, 22; Pedro Eugenio, 20; and Lucio, 16.

Lorenzo has been cultivating vegetables for more than 14 years. Each summer his children help him bring in the harvest. He also receives technical agricultural advice.

Lorenzo is seeking a loan for planting a new crop, as he does not have enough money for agricultural supplies such as fertilizer. He also needs plastic pipe to irrigate his fields. With the help of this loan, he will complete the planting and give the plants the necessary care to grow healthy, although there is always a risk of damage by insects. His goal is to pay off the loan on schedule, have a good harvest, and sell at a good price. This will help his family get ahead and his children get an education.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and plastic pipe

loans.name: H. Philomène

texts.fr: H. Philomène est née en 1950 à Savalou dans le département des Collines au Bénin. Mariée à un certain ZODANKPO, Philomène est mère de quatre enfants dont seulement un est à sa charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Il y a près de vingt cinq ans que Philomène habite le quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Philomène n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Philomène mène comme activité la vente de maïs et de façon secondaire, la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile. Philomène s'approvisionne dans le Nord du Bénin. Philomène exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année et a déjà obtenu cinq crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a remboursés. Dans le but d'agrandir davantage son activité et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire pendant cette période de fête de nouvel an, Philomène sollicite à nouveau un autre crédit.
texts.en: H.Philomene was born in 1950 in Savalou, in the Collines Department  of Benin. Married to a Mr. Zondakpo, Philomee is the mother of four children, only one of whom is now in her care. Some of her children study.  For about 25 years, Philomene has been living in the Avotrou district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The spouses jointly take care of the family budget. Philomene did not attend school. In order to support herself, Philomene sells corn; as a secondary business activity, she sells charcoal out of her home. Philomene stocks up in the north of Benin. She has been in this line of business for about a dozen years, and had five prior loans from ALIDé, all repaid. With the goal of growing her business and increasing her revenues during this holiday season before the new year, Philomene is seeking a new loan.

loans.use: Purchasing bags of corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, onions, tomatoes, seasoning, beans, peppers etc.

loans.name: Venatie

texts.en: Venatie is 32 years old. She has three children, the youngest being 4 months old, while the eldest is 6 years old. Venatie, together with her husband, owns a driving school, and she is requesting a loan in order to buy another motorcycle for their driving school. Venantie’s husband works at their driving school, and they have been running this business for six years. She plans to buy a tailoring machine to open up a tailoring workshop.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for the driving school

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma T. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 33 years old and married with four school-aged children. 

Irma owns a barbecue food stall. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 months and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Irma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials for her barbecue business.

Irma is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for house repair. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house repair

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en:
Gulmira A. is 40 years old and widowed. She lives with her daughter’s family in Novonikolaevka village. 
In 1990, at the age of 20, Gulmira got married and became the mother of one daughter. Unfortunately, after seven years of happy marriage, her beloved husband died in car accident. In order to find means of subsistence for her small family, Gulmira started her business in cattle breeding. Using the money she had earned, in 2008 she bought a house in Novonikolaevka village with derelict grape bushes. As Gulmira had always dreamed to be engaged in land cultivating, she decided to revive a beautiful grape garden. Today, her garden consists of more than 200 bushes of grape in 11 different sorts. Such an assortment allows Gulmira to earn about more than 4,500 KGS in a month.  
Now, in order to buy chemicals to manure land and get the system flowing, Gulmira has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS. With the revenues, she plans to scale up her cultivated land and enlarge the number of grape bushes. In the future, Gulmira wants to help her daughter buy a flat in Karabalta town. 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals to manure land

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, tiene 41 años de edad, tiene seis hijos, nació en la ciudad Urubamba del departamento de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Maria se dedica a la venta de verduras es mayorista, ella reparte a los revendedores y vendedoras del mercado de Urubamba. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Maria en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz.  

Maria pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and has six children. She was born in the city of Urubamba in the Department of Cusco and still lives there. Maria sells vegetables as a wholesaler. She distributes her products to retailers and merchants at the market in Urubamba. Maria has been in this business for fifteen years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy corn.

Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Mainique” which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity being given to her and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase corn.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha T., 38 years old, is currently in the business of selling alcohol. She is married to a businessman and they have nine children. Four of the children are going to school. 

Her future goal is to own a shop.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol.

loans.name: Fanny Maria

texts.es: La señora Fanny U. es casada y con tres hijos los cuales debe de mantener y suplir cada una de sus necesidades. Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo directamente en el pago de los estudios de los hijos y compra de utensilios escolares como cuadernos y lapices. Es por este motivo que ella muy confiadamente acude a solicitar dicho crédito porque se siente confiada que le servirá de mucho apoyo para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en: Fanny U. is married with three children, all of whom she is responsible for and provides them with necessities. Currently she is asking for a loan to invest directly to pay for her children's studies and the purchase of school materials, such as notebooks and pencils. For this reason, she is confidently asking for said loan because she feels assured that it will offer much support for the development of her children.

loans.use: to pay for high school for her children and to purchase school materials such as pencils and notebooks.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia tiene 46 años de edad, está casada con el señor Patricio quien es profesor de una escuela primaria, ellos tienen 4 hijos, pero vive nada mas con ellos su hija que es madre soltera y su nieto llamado Santiago de 4 años de edad el cual doña Lety se hizo cargo de él desde que nació ya que su hija estaba estudiando y en estos momentos trabaja como contadora. Doña Lety está pidiendo su préstamo para invertir en su negocio de joyería fina (oro) ella se surte en la cuidad de Moroleón Guanajuato ya que en esa ciudad le dan buenos precios ya que es clienta desde hace 12 años y a los cuales ella les puede subir un poco y no dar tan cara su joyería . Ella comenta que le está echando muchas ganas a su trabajo ya que quiere que su hijo que estudiando leyes pueda terminar su carrera y pueda comprarle los libros que el ocupa. Ahorita uno de sus propósitos es aclientarse y vender  agente que no le quede mal en sus pagos, más que nada personas que tengan un trabajo estable, y uno de sus sueños es rentar un local y establecerse ya que es muy peligroso traer joyas finas en la calle, también uno de sus sueños es poder remodelar su casa ya que en tiempo de lluvia se le trasmina el agua.
texts.en:
Leticia is 46 years old and is married to Patricio who is an elementary school teacher.  They have four children but only their daughter (a single mother) and their grandson Santiago, who is 4 years old, live with them.  Lety has taken care of Santiago since he was born since her daughter was studying and now she works as an accountant.

Lety is requesting this loan to invest in her business selling fine (gold) jewelry.  She buys her stock in the city of Moroleón Guanajuato since they offer her good prices in that city because she has been a customer for 12 years.  She can then raise the price just a little and not have to sell her jewelry for too high a price.  She tells us that she is putting a lot of effort into her work since she wants her son, who is studying Law, to be able to finish his degree and she wants to be able to buy him the textbooks he needs.

Right now, one of Leticia's goals is to attract customers and sell to people who will be able to meet all their payments, above all people who have stable jobs.  One of her dreams is to hire premises and set her business up there since it is very dangerous to carry fine jewelry in the street.  Another one of her dreams is to repair her home since it leaks during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy fine (gold) jewelry

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been in the "Matatu" transport business for the last seven years with an income of KES.20,000 per month. He is 42 years old, married to Lydia Nyambura and a father of four children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and he is applying for his first loan of KES. 30,000 to repair his vehicle by buying spare parts which will be used to fix it.

He will use the anticipated income to improve the living standards of the family. In future he hopes to grow his business and have a fleet of 67-seater buses.

loans.use: To repair his "Matatu" (van used for transport between towns.)

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 4 years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She sells household goods such as cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Irene dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cereals, detergent and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, detergent and cooking oil.

loans.name: Traice

texts.es:
Traice
Operación 2011-137
350000 colones

Traice tiene 27 años de edad, en este momento tiene 3 meses de embarazo y vive con su pareja Greivin, en la casa de sus padres. Es una joven emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación, termino la carrera de terapeuta física en la Universidad, pero ante la dificultad de conseguir empleo, esta trabajando en un oficio que aprendió hace mas de 10 años, el arreglo de uñas de pies y manos y actualmente se está especializando en la el arte de uñas artificiales.

Se enteró de Fundación Mujer por medio de una visita realizada a la Ofician de la Mujer en la Municipalidad de Puntarenas, vive en la zona de Carrizal de Puntarenas en la costa del Pacífico Central de Costa Rica, ella se ha estado capacitando en el arte de las uñas artificiales y desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de materiales para esta nueva labor, la cual le va a incrementar los ingresos y espera continuar ahorrando para el próximo año casarse.

Desea ofrecerle a su hijo, que está en su vientre, la oportunidad de contar con una buena calidad de vida. Por la mañana atiende los oficios de la casa y en la tarde empiezan a llegar las clientas o va a visitarlas a domicilio. Con este préstamo, la solicitante va a adquirir materiales para su negocio y continuar capacitándose para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes.

El impacto del crédito es de suma importancia, ya que les da la oportunidad de comprar materia prima y apoyar a su familia ahorrando para alquilar una casa, su moral de pago se demuestra excelente, y las recomendaciones que presenta la demuestran como una persona horada y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Tracie is 27 years old.  Right now, she is 3 months pregnant and lives with her partner Greivin, in her parents' home.  She is an entrepreneurial young woman who has a great desire to improve herself.  She finished a university degree in physical therapy but, faced with difficulty finding work, she is now working in a trade that she learned more than 10 years ago, fixing people's toenails and fingernails.  She is currently specializing in artificial nails.

Tracie found out about Fundación Mujer through a visit to a Women's Office in the town of Puntarenas.  Tracie lives in Carrizal district, in Puntarenas, on the Central Pacific coast of Costa Rica.  She has been training in the art of doing artificial nails and would like to invest her loan in buying materials for this new line of work.  This will help her to increase her income and she hopes to continue saving so that she can get married next year.

Tracie would like to offer her unborn child the opportunity of enjoying a good quality of life.  In the morning, she takes care of her housework and, in the afternoon, either her customers start to arrive or she goes to visit them at home.  With this loan, the borrower would like to acquire materials for her business and continue training so that she can improve her service to her customers.

The impact of this loan is of utmost important since it will give Tracie the opportunity to buy supplies and to support her family, saving up so that she can rent a house.  Her repayment behavior is excellent and the references she has provided show her to be an honest and hard-working person.

loans.use: to invest in materials for a new field that she is working in (fixing people's nails)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 75 pieces of traditional African wax fabric.

loans.name: Iris Nohemy

texts.es:
Iris, administra una tienda, vive con su familia conformada por sus cuatro hijos, ellos le ayudan a atender a los clientes, no tienen un horario fijo para atender y actualmente necesitan invertirle al negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos domésticos tales como: aceite, azúcar, sal, huevos, papel higiénico y bebidas, la compra le ayudara a surtir el negocio y a mejorar la atención a la clientela.
Su objetivo es fortalecer sus ingresos a través del negocio, mantener todo lo necesario en los hogares de los clientes, y ayudar a sus hijos en todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Iris owns a store and lives with her family, which is made up of her four children.  They help her serve customers, and there is no fixed schedule.  She currently needs to invest in her business.

She is asking for this loan to purchase domestic products such as oil, sugar, salt, eggs, toilet paper, and drinks.  The purchases will help stock her store and improve customer service.  

Her goal is to increase her income from the business, provide her customers with everything they need for their homes, and help her children with all of their needs.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar, salt, eggs, toilet paper, and drinks.

loans.name: Kepha

texts.en:
Kepha is 47 years old and has been farming for 10 years in the Kisii area, South Rift Kenya, employing five farmhands in his farm.  His produce of vegetables, tomatoes, maize, beans and onions are sold locally.

Kepha has requested a loan of 30.000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow.  He says the milk produced will improve the health of his children as well as enable him to educate them.  He adds that he is focusing on expanding his farm acreage to improve tomatoe and onion farming both in quantity and quality.

Kepha believes farmers are facing challenges of  poor knowledge in crop diseases and training on the same would be appropriate.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Deniz

texts.es: El deseo de hacer algo diferente de sus amigos de la secundaria motivó a Deniz  de 24 años de edad a estudiar en la universidad La Católica más de cinco años  y decidió que sería el ’lugar perfecto’ para estudiar y descubrir nuevos desafíos. Ahora habiéndose graduado con el título de ingeniero electrónico, Deniz confía  en que ha tomado la decisión correcta, el considera que aprender a ser independiente es uno de los resultados más importantes de la vida, ya que gran parte de los años en la universidad le ayudo su madre en el pago de los estudios. Cuando Deniz empezó a buscar trabajo se encontró  con muchos empleadores y decidió  trabaja en la Bolsa de Valores de lima como Asistente de Servicios de Negociación, su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su propia empresa y que el rubro este asociado con lo que estudió. En sus ratos libres le gustar jugar futbol con un grupo de la universidad, Con el actual préstamo lo utilizara para su curso de maestría.
texts.en:
Motivated to do something different than his friends from high school, Deniz, 24, enrolled in the La Católica University over five years ago deciding that it was the “perfect place” to study and discover new challenges.  Now, having graduated as an Electronics Engineer, Deniz is sure that he made the right decision.  He considers that learning to become independent is one of life’s most important results because his mother helped him pay for a large part of his university years expenses.  

When Deniz started to look for employment he found many options but decided to go to work for the Stock Market in Lima as a Negotiations Services Assistant.  His major dream is to someday have his own firm in an area associated with what he studied. 

In his spare time he enjoys playing soccer with a group at the university.  He will use the present loan to pay for his Masters Degree course.

loans.use: to pay for his schooling.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora María del Rosario, es de un lugar bonito, en donde celebran la fiesta del señor san Pedro ya que es el patrón del pueblo, ella es cada con el señor  Bernardo y con quien procreo  tres hijos que aun que están su responsabilidad.-

    Ella solito el  préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de gallinas ponedoras y después  vender lo  huevo en la misma localidad, en donde lleva cinco años y cometa que ele va bien ya que con ello a tenido un buen ingreso en sub hogar.

    Lo que  lo motivo a esta actividad fue su propia creatividad para poyar a su esposo así juntos aportar con los  ingresos de la casa  y sacar adelante a su pequeña familia.
 
     Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo pueda tener un mejor desarrollo económico  para así a seguir apoyando a sus hijos  a que sigan delante.
texts.en:
María del Rosario is from a beautiful place where they celebrate the feast of Saint Peter, who is the patron saint of the town.  She is married to Bernardo and they have three children who are still their responsibility.

She is asking for this loan to purchase laying hens and later sell the eggs at the same location.  She has done this work for five years, and she said that it is going well because she has had a good income.  

She was motivated to start this work by her own creativity to support her husband, so that they could both contribute to the household expenses and help their small family get ahead.  

She hopes that with her small business and this loan, she can have better economic development so that she can continue supporting her children.

loans.use: to purchase laying hens and later sell the eggs.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Cuenta con educación superior incompleto.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de      S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de artesanía
Eva solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1350.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de materiales como lanas de diversos colares para la producción de bayetas (telares) luego dibujarlos y venderlos en la localidad de Juli.  Trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo es maestro de obra, la señora  cuenta que antes vendía bordados ahora tiene telares.
Su sueño es tener más telares para la producción de bayetas y venderlos mejor.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  son las reuniones, la puntualidad, responsabilidad y las charlas que se les brinda.
texts.en:
Eva is a member of the “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli” communal bank, located in the Juli district of Chucuito province, in the department of Puno. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Her first loan was for the sum of 500 nuevo soles; money that she used for her handicrafts business. 
 
Eva is applying for a new loan of 1350 nuevo soles. She will use the loan to buy materials such as wool of different colors, to make  
weavings, which she will then decorate and sell in the town of Juli. 

She works alone in her business, her husband is a foreman.  Eva tells us that she used to sell embroidery and now she does weaving. Her dream is to have more looms for making weavings and to sell more of them. What she likes about the communal bank are the meetings, making payments on time,  responsibility, and the talks that are offered to them.

loans.use: To buy wool of different colors.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: La señora Claudia Maria, ella tiene 37 años, es una mujer casada y tiene 2 hijos bajo su cargo. Hace más 12 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa, ubicada en su casa y de manera ambulante. Ella dio inicio a este negocio ante la necesidad que sufría de ingresos para la manutención de su familia en general. Por lo que con todo el esfuerzo logro obtener capital propio. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, vestidos entre otros. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: 37-year-old Claudia Maria is a married woman and has two children in her care.  She has been selling clothes from home and as an itinerant street vendor for more than 12 years.  She started her business as she needed to make income with which to support her family.  With a lot of effort, she managed to obtain her own capital.  This loan will be invested in buying pants, shirts, skirts, suits and dresses, etc.  Claudia's dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, suits, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: La señora Genoveva y su familia viven en la zona D. Kupini que ubicada a veinticinco minutos del centro D. la ciudad D. La Paz. Ella y su familia tienen un pequeño taller D. elaboración D. calzados D. cholitas y trabajan D. esta manera desD. hace veinte años atrás. Los calzados D. cholitas son elaborados D. manera muy tradicional y es por eso también que tienen varios clientes en diferentes ferias D. esta ciudad y la ciudad del Alto. Los calzados D. cholitas son hechos con diferentes materiales pero actualmente los mas utilizados son el plástico transparente y cuerinas además D. suelas y plantas D. goma. Y son muy parecidos a zapatillas pero son utilizados principalmente por cholitas y señoras D. pollera quienes saben apreciar un trabaja tradicional y bien realizado como son los calzados del taller D. doña Genoveva. En esta oportunidad la señora Genoveva solicita el préstamo D. dinero para el mantenimiento en general D. un automóvil que tiene y lo hace trabajar en el servicio D. radio taxi.
texts.en: Mrs. Genoveva and her family live in the Kupini area which is about 25 minutes from downtown La Paz.  Her family has a small shop where they make "cholitas" , having been in business for 20 years.  This type of footwear is maD. in a very traditional style and that's why they have several customers at the different fairs around the city and in the city of Alto.  The cholitas are maD. from different materials but the ones used nowadays are maD. of transparent plastic and synthetic leather, with rubber soles and heels.  They are very similar to slippers but worn mainly by the cholitas (wearing typical dress) who know how to appreciate traditional and well-maD. crafts such as the shoes from Mrs. Genoveva's shop.  She is requesting a loan on this occasion for general maintenance of her automobile which she uses to proviD. a radio taxi service.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with seven children who are all grown up. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house that has electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has owned real estate housesl for the past ten years. Her clients are the housing tenants. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing building materials. She dreams of building more real estate houses to rent out in the future.

With the Kshs 70,000 she wants to purchase construction materials to renovate her real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu because of the variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to renovate her real estate houses.

loans.name: Sale

texts.en:
Sale is 48 years old. She is a single woman with no children. Sale owns and operates a business selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has two years of experience in this business. Sale needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Sale joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sale's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 47 years old and sells food in his small eatery in his community. It has been three years since he started this business and it was a great help to improve his poor lifestyle. His business is a source of his income when he got sick. He was thankful that he built his eatery business through the help of Alalay Sa kaunlaran Inc., because it serves as his source of expenses in times of emergencies. 

Richard is being patient to cook every day in order to earn a higher income. He is saving for emergencies as well as for the education of his nephew that he adopted, due to inability of his parents to send him in school. 

As of now, he is asking for a loan of 18,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy pancit (noodles), soy sauce, calamansi (a citrus fruit), bihon (rice vermicelli) and soft drinks as additional raw ingredients to sell. He hopes through these goods he can make a higher income.

loans.use: to buy pancit, soy sauce, calamansi, bihon and soft drinks as additional raw ingredients to sell

loans.name: Atulinda

texts.en:
Atulinda is 42 years old and father of eight children aged 10-19 living in Hioma, Uganda. He has other dependents and he lives in his own house with 11 family members. 

For seven years he has been farming and he started with a half an acre of land but now has ten acres. He faces a challenge of bad roads which makes transportation of his produce to the markets difficult and his vision is to start processing juice. Atulinda needs the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zambaonga Del Sur. She is 36 years old. Judith is married and has one school-aged child.

To make a living, Judith owns and operates a tricycle transport service. A tricycle is a motorcycle with a passenger cab. Judith has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Judith is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a vehicle used in the business.

In 2008, Judith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.
She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 44-year-old woman who is married with three sons and one daughter. She is a school employee with a decent salary.

Sawsan wants to improve her house conditions such as changing windows, installing doors, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan amount of $1,500 from FATEN. When Sawsan gets the loan, she will be able to pay for these expenses and make all the necessary improvements to her house. This will enable her to offer better home living conditions to her family. Sawsan is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to improve the condition of her house

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is 47 years old and widowed with four chidren, of which only one daughter is dependent and still in school. She is a farmer, who has been farming for four years and supplementing her income by raising pigs and planting rubber. 
She is a second cycle client, who completely repaid the first loan with VisionFund. After the loan, she has a regular income to support her children and earns around 13 U.S. Dollars per day. 
Now she is requesting another loan. She will use this loan to buy feed for her pigs and will also use some of the loan to buy fertilizer for her rubber plantation. She hopes this loan will enable her pigs to become fat and healthy and to grow rubber trees to be bigger and healthier. 
In addition, she hopes to make a better living and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and fertilizer for her rubber plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Emran

texts.en: Emran, who is 21 years old, is talented at playing the piano.  He is looking to buy a new instrument so he can improve his talent by training on it.  He needs a loan from FATEN to reach the payment amount.  When Emran gets the loan, he can buy a real piano and train more to improve his talent.  In the future, he is looking to make an income with his talent.  Emran is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: purchase a new piano.

loans.name: Katheriane's Group

texts.en:
Katheriane has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her livestock business. 

With the loan investment, she will buy a dairy cow to get a larger quantity of milk. This will help her selling milk in larger quantities and increase her income.

She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past many years. She is confident that her business will improve after the loan investment and it will help her family to live a better financial life.

Katheriane also performs her duties very well along with her business. Her husband is a farmer by profession. He is a very hard worker and work 8-10 hours a day. Katheriane has given birth to two sons and a daughter. All of them are getting their education. She is hopeful about her family’s bright future as a result of an investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Katheriane.

loans.use: To buy a cow for livestock business

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: El señor Marco es carpintero. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de 300 pies cuadrados de Madera Cedro, para un trabajo especial. Marco es soltero  y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa alquilada la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda  vez que trabaja con kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Marco is a carpenter. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy 300 square feet of cedar wood for a special job. Marco is single and has no children. He lives in a rented house in the District of Alto Irpavi in the city of La Paz.

This is the second time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cedar wood.

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en:
Nixon is age 35 and has been in active farming in his hometown of Kitale for five years. He is married with four children aged between 12 and 6 years. He says his family livelihood relies fully on farming.

Nixon has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow to help him boost his dairy income. He adds that dairy farming has been of great help to his family by providing milk for their daily consumption as well as income to meet other basic requirements.

Nixon says the major challenge of poor feed remains, especially during droughts.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo is from the village of Villa Concepcion. He is married and has two children. Ronaldo is engaged in his sari-sari store for five years. This is the only source of income for his family. That is why he works hard to uplift his family from poor living. 

Ronaldo wants to buy additional stocks of items to sell, but he lacks the necessary capital.  In this  regard, Ronaldo is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, sugar, vinegar, salt, bread, and daily use products to sell. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop his business.

loans.use: restock his store

loans.name: Los Tres Amigos Group

texts.es: Don Román es miembro del Grupo Solidario Los Tres Amigos, tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y tiene seis hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, es una familia responsable y trabajadora. El negocio lo aprendió desde muy pequeño cuando trabajo en una tienda vendiendo ropa, después de un tiempo decidió poner su propia tienda de venta de ropa interior, luego fue adquiriendo experiencia y  se dispuso a vender también fardos de ropa usada al por mayor  y menor, actualmente se dedica a la venta de fardos y ropa interior. Desde hace 40 años se dedica a este negocio, el trabaja en conjunto con su hija, ella es quien le administra el negocio mientras don Román sale a repartir el producto a las tiendas, su horario de atención inicia por las mañanas de 7:00 a.m. y culmina como a las 5:00 p.m. La única desventaja es porque tiene que pagar alquiler de local. Don Román gracias a Dios es una persona sana, muy jovial, amable y muy conocida por sus vecinos. El solicita este préstamo para comprar ropa interior nueva y fardos de ropa y así surtir su negocio de estilos actuales. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá llamar la atención de más clientes y seguirá teniendo una actividad económica que le permita cubrir sus gastos. Su sueño es tener su local propio y surtir bien su negocio. Este es el segundo financiamiento que obtiene don Román en FAMA y hasta el momento ha cumplido puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: COMPRA DE FARDOS Y ROPA INTERIOR

loans.name: John

texts.en: Kiva lenders! Meet John, a passionate and hardworking go-getter. He is based in Endebess, a remote village in Kitale, Kenya. This area is faced with hardcore poverty and very bad terrain. For the past three years, he has actively been involved in mixed farming and his primary source of income has been milk and eggs. John passionately loves farming, but the biggest challenge he faces is transportation of the products to the market and timely delivery. The Endebess area has poor roads and the terrain makes it even worse. He faces challenges transporting his produce, especially during the rainy seasons. John is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Because of poor feeder roads and bad terrain, this loan will assist him a great deal. Through the loan, he will be able to transport his produce from the farm and deliver it to the market on-time. Milk is very perishable and requires quick delivery to the market and through the loan, he will be able to make quick deliveries and never suffer losses. Eggs are very fragile and they require proper handling and through the motorbike, he will be able to transport his eggs using crates to the market. Through Juhudi Kilimo, an institution that supports small holder farmers, John is assured that his dreams will come to pass. John has gone through financial and technical training with Juhudi Kilimo and is confident that through savings from the loan, he will improve his living conditions and repay back the loan. This loan will be a stepping stone for the success of John.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
The following description was written by Moses Onyango, a volunteer with Village Enterprise Fund and partner representative for Kiva in Uganda:

Elizabeth O. is a widow with seven children in her family.

Village Enterprise Fund (VEF) donated 100 Dollar grant to her in the year 2000.

She started with a small business of selling greens, tomatoes, onions and cooking oil. He business continued well for a period of eight months as she realized some profits.

In 2001, VEF organized for business training course for all the beneficiaries in Tororo District. She happened to be among the participants who attended the training.

She learnt how to choose a profitable business, marketing, book keeping and business strategies.

She then decided to change her business to Fish Mongering.

Here she got a better market whereby the profit in her business has enabled her to buy goats, cow, pigs, chicken and also taking her children to school.

Given a loan of US $500, she will be capable of doing better business, by expanding her stock and also shift to Tororo town in order to meet the middle man for the progress of her business.

She is capable to handle the loan and to pay it back promptly.

Being a widow, I know that she will be helped a lot in development of her family.

loans.use: Increase stock, open new location in Tororo town (as opposed to village area)

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is a very optimistic and entrepreneurial woman. Some years ago she suffered a difficult divorce, which is when she tarted working for a company. But she started to have problems and her salary was not enough to cover all her payments, and she also needed to pay for her daughter's daycare. This is why she started selling clothes. This way she earns a little more money and she can still care for her daughter herself. She has managed to pull through, motivated by the love for her daughter.

Today she requires a loan of $925, that she will put towards the purchase of more merchandise to offer her clients and this way increase the volume of her sales and her roster of clients. Don't wait and help Maria Magdalena. She and her daughter need you and thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Magdalena es una mujer muy optimista y emprendedora, hace varios años sufrió un difícil divorcio, quedándose sola con su pequeña de 2 años, por lo que comenzó a trabajar como empleada en una empresa, pero empezó a tener problemas, ya que con su sueldo no alcanzaba a hacer todo los pagos necesarios, además que tenía que pagar la guardería de su hija. Por todo esto hace tiempo que decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa, de esta manera obtiene un poco de más ganancias, además que puede cuidar a su hija ella misma. Ella ha logrado salir adelante impulsada por el amor a su hija.

En este momento ella necesita de un préstamo de 925 DDLS, mismos que destinará en la compra de más mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar el volumen de ventas y su cartera de clientes. No lo dudes más y apoya a María Magdalena, ella y su hija te necesitan y te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 43 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. Patience has been running her own business since 2002. She specializes in the sales of fresh tomatoes and onions. US$400 will be of great help to her in expanding the business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: wholesale buying and retailing of condiments

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mr. Cheng S. is 61 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. He currently earns $3 a day buying cardboard boxes from his community and selling them back to wholesalers and recycling plants. He would like this loan so that he can increaS. the amount of cardboard boxes he buys from his community and therefore increaS. his earnings.

loans.use: Mr. Se would like to buy more cardboard boxes from his community to resell to recycling plants.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 38 years old and married with three children. She started her business when she was 22 years old, but it was destroyed during the civil war in Sierra Leone. She picked up again after the war but at a very small scale due to lack of capital.

With previous loans from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), Fatmata has been able to generate additional income to help her pay the family's expenses. She is requesting an additional loan to further expand her business. Fatmata says that she would like to purchase more stock for Christmas sales to earn a good income from the increased sales she expects during the holiday season.

loans.use: Increase her capital for the Christmas season when her sales are expected to rise

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is 36 years old and married with 3 children.  She runs her business in the small village trading center of Fadugu in Sierra Leone.  She sells essential commodities and also kola nuts, rice, and palm oil.  Fatmata’s husband is a subsistence farmer with a few cows.  Both work together for the family.  She would like to rear sheep in the future and expand her business. She is therefore requesting the loan for that purpose. She said raising sheep is a long-term business and it will generate income for the children’s school fees. The income from her current business will take care of loan payments.

loans.use: She would like to increase her business and purchase sheep for rearing.

loans.name: Generous

texts.en:
Generous is 39, widowed, and looks after her three children as well as an orphan. She runs a hardware store in Ntugamo, selling mostly building materials. In the rural areas most homes are still built with twigs and mud, or adobe bricks and mud which do not require store-bought materials. But for every 10-20 earthen homes you will see a brick home with a concrete slab for a floor. So, bricks and cement are the main items for sale in hardware stores. Since there are no pre-mix concrete trucks, pouring even a small concrete floor can require hundreds of bags of cement that then need to be mixed with sand and gravel to make the concrete on site. Nails and metal items are few, due to their high cost.

Therefore, Generous' store meets an important construction need in her neighbourhood. She has been in business for 12 years and has been a member of her lending group for the past 4 years. With her Kiva loan, she plans to buy more bags of cement.

loans.use: Generous plans to buy more bags of cement and hardware for her store.

loans.name: Fahriya

texts.en: Fahriya is a refugee from the Shusha region, which is situated in the west part of Azerbaijan, in the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone. She lives in the Binagadi settlement in the suburbs of Baku now. She sells clothing in the local market. She has been in this business for more than 3 years. She has taken loans from Normicro Baku branch before and successfully paid back her loans. She wants to increase the number and variety of her goods and she has little of her own funds. She applies again for a loan in the amount of $1075. She will repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Kirangira East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Eriraida M.. She is currently in the business of sugarcane growing and is requesting a loan to rent more land for cultivation. Eriraida is 37 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 4 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Eriraida makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in her business. Eriraida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to boost business and the loan was paid back on time.

Eriraida is joined in her small group by Lydia B., Ruth N., Adiah K., and Scovia A.. Lydia B. has a business selling used clothes and wants to increase stock. Ruth N. is currently operating a business in poultry farming and wants a loan to place an order for more chicks. Adiah K. operates a business of poultry farming and wants to purchase more farm supplies. Scovia A. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add stock.

loans.use: To add to sugarcane business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina has been a member of the Banco Comunal Firmeza for 4 years.

Marcelina is divorced, 38 years old, with one daughter aged 14. Marcelina sells cosmetics and natural products through a catalogue; she also sells sportswear and shaped corsets to friends and family in the city of Lima. Furthermore, Marcelina is an aerobics instructor in various gyms in the city of Ayacucho and she would like to open her own gym.

Marcelina needs a loan of 2400 soles, money which she can then invest in purchasing sportswear, shaped corsets, creams, colognes and jewelry.

She will use her savings to finish off her home and set up her gym. Marcelina has hopes for a successful business, a gym which offers personal training, as well as hopes for her daughter to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza hace 4 años.

Marcelina es divorciada, tiene 38 años y 1 hija de 14 años, Marcelina vende cosméticos y productos naturales por catálogo, también vende ropa deportiva, fajas moldeadoras a amigos, familiares, sus productos los trae de la ciudad de Lima. Además Marcelina es instructora de aeróbicos en diferentes gimnasios de la ciudad de Ayacucho y tiene proyectado aperturar su propio gimnasio.

Marcelina necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa deportiva, fajas moldeadoras, cremas, colonias y joyas.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará para el acabado de su casa y la implementación de su gimnasio. Los sueños de Marcelina son tener una empresa de éxito, un gimnasio de atención personalizada y que su hija sea profesional.

loans.use: Marcelina needs a loan of 2400 soles to invest in purchasing sportswear, corsets, creams, cologne and jewlry.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Teresa H. is 47 years old and requests a loan to invest in the construction of an annex (bedroom) for her 18 year-old daughter and, if possible, to change part of the roof of her house, which was built several years ago by a Spanish project in the Bº Madrid. With previous loans she constructed other annexes for her other children. She has a total of four children, of which two study, one is outside of the country and the other is one year old.

Maria Teresa is well-recognized in the city for her support to those most in need; with much effort she was able to graduate as a lawyer and currently works for MIFAMILIA where she continues helping the disadvantaged.

She has paid off all of her loans responsibly and she intends to continue working with AFODENIC because of the good service and attention that they give her and because her dream in life is that each one of her children has their own room.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maria Teresa H., de 47 años, esta solicitando un credito para invertirlo en la construcion de un anexo (dormitorio) para su hija de 18 años, y si es posible cambiará una parte del techo de su casau casa, ya que tiene varios años, pues fue construida por proyecto español en el Bº Madrid. Con los creditos anteriores construyó otros anexos para otros hijos, pues tiene un total de 4, de los cuales 2 estudian, 1 está fuera del pais y otro tiene 1 año de edad.

Maria Teresa es una persona muy reconocida en la ciudad por sus cualidades de apoyo a los mas necesitados, con su propio esfuerzo logró graduarse de abogada, actualmente trabaja en MIFAMILIA donde continuará apoyando a los desprotegidos.

Todos sus creditos los ha pagado con responsabilidad y piensa continuar trabajando con AFODENIC por el buen servicio y atencion que se les brinda, porque el sueño de su vida es que cada uno de sus hijos tenga su propia habitacion.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials (construction of a room)

loans.name: Thị Nhung

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thị Nhung, the group leader, is 43 years old. She's requesting a loan of 2.714.000 VND to replenish the stock for her food stand. Her income is, on average, 120.000 VND/day. She likes taking out loans from SEDA because she can repay in installments. She was the group leader in the last round, her group has repaid the loan. This time she has recruited new members to join her team. She has 3 school aged children.

- Mrs N. Thị Chung is 24 years old. She owns a shop making aluminum windows.She's seeking 2.242.000 VND to buy material for her shop.

- Mrs N. Thị Lan is 69 years old. She sells bamboo. She's seeking 2.242.000 VND.

- Mrs Lê Thị Ngân is 44 years old. She has a food stand selling snacks. She is seeking 2.006.000 VND.

- Mrs N. Thị Liên is 25. She sells CDs. She's seeking 2.006.000 VND.

- Mrs N. Thị Lan is 21. She runs an internet cafe. She is seeking 2.006.000 VND to buy a computer.

- Mrs N. Thị Thêm is 37. She sells refreshment drinks. She is seeking 2.006.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô N. Thị Nhung (MS: 030007), năm nay 43 tuổi. Cô vay 2.714.000 VND mua hàng chế biến về bán hàng ăn. Mức thu nhập trung binh là 120.000 VND/ngày. Cô rất thích tham gia vì được trả dần. Cô đã làm nhóm trưởng hết một kỳ, nhóm cô đã hoàn trả vốn vay của chu kỳ 1. Lần nay cô kết nạp thêm một thành viên mới vào nhóm để họ cũng được vay vốn của chương trình như cô. Cô có ba con hiện còn đang đi học. Chị N. Thị Chung (MS: 030008),năm nay 24 tuổi. Chị vay 2.242.000 VND để mua bán khung nhôm cửa kính. Cô N. Thị Lan (MS: 030010), năm nay 69 tuổi. Cô vay 2.242.000 VND để mua bán nứa, tre. Cô Lê Thị Ngân (MS: 030024), năm nay 44 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để mua nguyên liệu bán hàng ăn, chè nước. Chị N. Thị Liên (MS: 030027), năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua bán băng đĩa. Chị N. Thị Lan (MS: 030036), năm nay 21 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua thêm máy kinh doanh của hang Internet. Chị N. Thị Thêm (MS: 030026), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để bán nước giải khát.

loans.use: food stand

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
For the last three years, Oksana has been investing her time and finances into developing her small retail business at the busy central mall in Khoost. Years of experience have equipped her to be a very successful entrepreneur. Her business has grown to the point now where she has been able to generate about 3000 Ukranian Hryvnias in turnover capital. In addition to her daily work, Oksana also cares for her husband and daughter, Roksolana.

Oksana is known as a goal-oriented business owner who is optimistic about the future. She dreams of purchasing a second sales facility and would like to increase her inventory in order to boost her earnings. She is asking for a loan of $650 US to purchase additional inventory, which will help her to continually meet the needs of her customers while providing for her own financial responsibilities.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana had worked as a street vendor for several years. She sold breakfast and lunch. However, she then decided to sell fresh fish in a mini-market near her house. She also sells fried fish in the afternoon to the public. She works from 9 a.m. until 11 p.m. The loans she has requested have helped her cover the expenses of her business. Juana would like to expand her sales with more and better merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Juana ha trabajado como vendedora ambulante por varios años. Luego vendió desayunos y comida. Sin embargo, luego decidió vender pescado fresco en un mini-mercado cerca de su casa. Asimismo, por la tarde ella ofrece pescado frito al público. Trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para cubrir los gastos de su negocio. A Juana le gustaría ampliar sus ventas con mayor y mejor mercadería.

loans.use: To cover the expenses of her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 41 years old. She is married with 5 children, aged between 14 and 22. She has been a fish seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 9am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for re-sale

loans.name: Mrs. Chheum Sokha Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people in Trapeang Phnov village in Kampong Cham province have formed the village bank loan and they each plan to use the loan for a different purpose.  Mrs. Chheum S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.  She owns a small grocery store in the local village.  Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory.  Her husband, Mr. Nuon Mengsrun, is a village chef who makes a small salary to support his family.  Mrs. Chheum S. is 33 years old and the mother of two children who are both attending school.  

Two men among the three in the picture came to take the loan instead of their wives so they are presented here.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These nine members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Amara

texts.en:
This is Amara K.. Amara. 25, was born in Kabala. He is single with no children. Amara is a business man who sells soaps, batteries, milks, drinks, and cassettes tapes.  Some people also come to Amara to charge their mobile phones for a fee. He has been in this business for the past two years. Amara is requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000.00 ($1200 USD) to add goods to sell in his business.

Previously, he received a loan of Le 3,500,000.00 from Kiva through SMT. That loan was of great help to him. It enabled him to expand his business because€" he was only selling tapes, but now he has a shop full of items.

Amara can now travel as far as Freetown (285 miles from Kabala) to buy the goods he sells. Freetown is the only place in Sierra Leone where he can get access to goods at a fair price. 

Amara uses the profit to improve his living condition and reinvests the rest back into the business.

loans.use: Buy additional goods to sell in his shop

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo cuenta con 33 años de edad, aun no se ha casado, tiene dos hijos con su conviviente que le acompaña en todas sus actividades. Es agricultor, desde niño se ha dedicado a la actividad del cultivo de la tierra, en esta oportunidad tiene sembrado con 50 sacos de semilla, comenta muy feliz, que su mundo es trabajar la tierra, dice que hay que conocer las temporadas para sembrar y mantener un adecuado cuidado, con todo esto la chacra produce muy bien. Gerardo siembra con peones en grades cantidades porque esta es la fuente principal de ingresos económicos para su familia. Lo le incomoda es el precio de los fertilizantes, el alza de estos ha repercutido negativamente, ya que tiene que sembrar en menor cantidad de lo que acostumbra. Es cliente por vez primera en MFP. Con este préstamo comprará herbicidas con un importe de 380 soles, lo que le sirve para fumigar su chacra de papas, ya que las yerbas no dejan desarrollarse bien tubérculo.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 33 years old, still has not married, and has two children with his live-in partner who accompany him in all his activities. He is a farmer, and since childhood has dedicated himself to cultivating the soil. At this opportunity, he has sown 50 sacks of seed and comments that he is very happy as his world is working the land. He tells us that one must know the times to plant and take proper care so that the crop will produce very well. Gerardo works with laborers of varying skill, given that this is the primary source of income for his family. A difficulty for him is the high price of fertilizers, which have impacted him negatively by forcing him to plant less than he normally would. He is a first-time customer with MFP. With this loan, he will purchase herbicides at a cost of 380.00 soles which will allow him to fumigate his potato crop since weeds do not allow the tubers to develop properly.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase herbicides for his farmland.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeurn N. is 34 years old and she lives in Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pigs are getting bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to support her breeding. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food for her business.

Mrs. Yoeurn N. has six children, one of whom uses an electric plow to plow fields for villagers for an income, while another one is a pig breeder who helps in their mother’s business. The others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Phai Ren, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband is present with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy pig food for her pig breeding business.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Lina B.  es una señora de 41 años de edad oriundo de la ciudad de Roque González está casada hace más de 22 años con el Sr. Francisco Montiel  de 43 años de edad, tienen 5 hijos  3  en edad escolar y  2  ya son  mayores de edad y gracias a sus padres ya son profesionales.
          Se casaron  muy  jóvenes  y emprendieron  viaje a la Argentina en  busca de trabajo la  Señora  trabajo  como empleada  domestica y  el Señor como  albañil  trabajaron  incansablemente y  lograron reunir  un capital  importante  como para  regresar al  país  ,a su  regreso  buscaron una actividad  para  poder  invertir y  con  los  ingresos   poder sobrevivir  y dieron apertura  a  un  pequeño almacén  que  hoy  día es el  sustento de la familia  
             Con el  crédito   comprará: Harina, azúcar, yerba, fideos  arroz y otros.
texts.en:
Lina B. is a 41 year old woman living in the city of Roque González. She has been married for 22 years to Mr. Francisco Montiel, who is 43 years old. They have 5 children, 3 of which are in school and 2 who are older and thanks to their parents are professionals. Lina and Francisco married very young and traveled to Argentina in search of work. Lina worked as a domestic employee and Francisco worked as a bricklayer. They worked tirelessly and successfully gathered important capital necessary to allow them to return to their country. Upon their return they searched for business to invest in and with the income be able to survive. They were give an opportunity with a small general store that sustains their family to this day. With the loan they will purchase: flour, sugar, herbs, noodles, rice and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, and meat.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella A. is forty two years old.  She is divorced but has given birth to two sons.  One of them has completed junior high school while the other is in the final year.  

Stella lives with her two sons in a rented house.  They live in a farming/business community called Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  Stella says it has not been easy providing for herself as well as her two sons since her ex-husband does not show any concern.  

She trades in ‘gari’, tomatoes and vegetable cooking oil on a table top in the local market.  Gari is a local delicacy produced from cassava.  The milled cassava is thoroughly squeezed of water by putting it under pressure.  It is then fried in a hot metal pan over a strong fire.  It is either served hot with cooked beans and oil, or cold with sugar, milk and roasted groundnut.
