She buys bags of gari and cooking oil from nearby towns at affordable prices.  She distributes the gari mostly to the food vendors in her community.  Stella has been in business for three years.  She wants a loan to buy goods in large quantities so she can increase her profit margin to provide for her children.

loans.use: To buy ‘gari’ and vegetable oil

loans.name: Hajra M. Ameen Group

texts.en:
Hajra baji is a 41 years old married lady and has been a citizen of the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Her husband, M. A., has a chicken selling business. Hajra baji also helps him with his business. She packs the chickens in a web mesh for selling. She has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for another loan to buy more chickens to expand her husband’s business. 

She is a loan group leader of several women of her locality. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business. Zarina baji wants a loan to buy wooden beams for her window shutter business. Ameeran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy chickens for resale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hạnh  năm nay  58  tuổi chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con đã trưởng thành tại thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc.Chị Hạnh  tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Hiện tại chị Hạnh và chồng đang chăn nuôi và bán thuốc tây tại nhà còn các con đi làm công nhân.Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thuốc về bán.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Hạnh is 58 years old. She is living with her husband and two grown children in the town of Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc province. Ms. Hạnh joined TYM Fund in 1999. Currently, Ms. Hạnh and her husband are rearing livestock and selling western medicine from home while her children are employed. These are also the family's main sources of income in the amount of 6,000,000 VND per month. For the upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND to purchase more western medicine to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products to resell

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Doña Juana  es originaria de la comunidad de Paxtoca del departamento de Totonicapñan  doña Juana se dedica a la venta de cortes  tipicos en la plaza municipal de Totonicapan los dias sabados y martes ella solicita un credito en ASDIR para sustir su mercaderia y buscar nuevos mercados en la venta de su producto y aprovechar la semana santa ya que es una tradicion en departamento en las ventas de los cortes tipicos para damas.
texts.en:
Juana is from the Paxtoca community in the department of Totonicapan. She sells traditional clothes in the Totonicapan municipal plaza on Saturdays and Tuesdays. She is asking ASDIR for a loan to stock her merchandise and look for new sales markets. She will take advantage of the area’s tradition of buying women’s traditional clothing during Holy Week.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Mrs. Angelita L. is 52 years old and married to Aurelio, a farmer and a carpenter. She is a MIGS, or Member in Good Standing, with Paglaum PMC under the Microfinance Program of Palayan 1 Center. Pig raising was her project when she borrowed the amount of PHP 20,000 for pigs and feed. She wants to have more additional pigs and also a pig pen someday. She hopes also to have their own concrete house and lot.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela G. es viuda, y tiene un hijo autista de 20 años bajo su responsabilidad. 
    Tiene cuatro años dedicándose a la elaboración de rapo y  accesorios (lo que son aretes, collares y pulseras de piedras y cristales.
   Este es el ingreso, pero le está haciendo falta más material para poder realizar los pedidos que tiene pendientes y entregar a tiempo, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que está necesitando, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir y así su negocio tendrá mas ingresos para sacar a su hijo adelante y poder los tratamientos que necesita.
texts.en:
Graciela G. is a widow and she has a 20 year-old autistic son in her care. She has been working for four years making clothing and accessories (such as earrings, necklaces, and bracelets made with stones and crystals.) This is her income, but she needs more materials to fill the orders she has and turn them in on time. She is requesting a loan to buy the material she needs, because she doesn’t have the money she needed to invest. With the loan, her business will have more income and she will be able to help her son and get the treatments he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Martha es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Martha junto a su esposo tienen una tienda de repuestos de carros en un local alquilado, su esposo es mecánico. Además Martha vende cosméticos por catálogos y también brinda servicios de corte y confección de prendas de vestir.
Martha necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos de carro.
Los sueños de Martha son ampliar su tienda, tener otra sucursal y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the community bank of Tulipanes. She is 38, married, and has 3 children. She and her spouse (a mechanic), rent a store out of which they sell spare auto parts. Besides that, Martha sells mail-order cosmetics, and also offers tailoring services. Martha needs a loan of 2100 soles which she will invest in the purchase of car parts. Her dreams are to expand her store, open another branch, and build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of car parts

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
L. Trần Thị (1108060238) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has three adult children.

L. owns and operates a business raising fish for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

L. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 8th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia A. is 40 years old. She is married and has four children—two sons and two daughters. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Felicia sells food items such as groundnuts, vegetables, oil, and so forth on a tabletop at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and Kumasi. Felicia also treks to other towns to sell her products on their market days. She has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Nialing

texts.fr: Nialing B. est âgée de 57 ans, veuve avec 6 enfants en charge. Elle vend du jus de fruit et de la bouillie locale qu’elle prépare elle-même. Son objectif est d’assurer une partie des charges familiales et de renforcer ses activités.
texts.en:
Nialing B., 57, is a widow with 6 children. She sells fruit juice and porridge made out of local ingredients which she prepares herself. Her goal is to cover a part of the family's expenses and bolster her businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: prepare and sell fruit juice and locally-produced porridge

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a member of the Chapakazi borrower group,In kihesa,Morogoro. She is forty years old, married, and a mother of five children aged 25, 23, 19, 19, and 9 years. Anna started her own business selling fish twenty years ago. She works twelve hours a day and gains a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tsh.

This is Anna's first loan from BRAC Tanzania, and she has requested the amount of 150,000 TZS to buy more fish to sell. With the additional profits she will gain from the use of this loan, Anna hopes to save more money, pay school fees, get more food for her family, and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish  for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. is 52 years old and married to Grace Wangechi. They are blessed with four children: one daughter and three sons. John and his family live in Shanzu, Mombasa, where he runs a business of key cutting and padlock repairs. He has been in the business for the last 14 years.

John learned about KADET through an existing client and is happy to access his first loan to uplift his business. 

He plans to purchase stock of keys and padlocks and other assorted tools for his business. With the extra profit, he also plans to expand his business further by procuring machines for his trade to ease and hasten operations, and his future hope is to have a permanent premises for his work.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya

loans.use: Purchasing stock of keys and padlocks, and other assorted tools for his hardware business

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Juan Ramon de 32 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 niños (una de 2 años y la otra de 9 años) trabaja como despachador de farmacia para el Hospital Asuncion de Juigalpa desde hace 9 años, habita en casa de sus padres, los que le han dado un cuarto para que viva con su familia, esta solicitando su 10mo credito para arreglarlo y darle mayor comodidad e independencia a su esposa e hijos, instalando el servicio de energia electrica y ademas levantando una pared para terminar un cuarto que desea anexar, cuenta con  la mayoria de los materiales, solo le falta comprar el cemento y la mano de obra para concluir la obra.  El mayor sueño de Juan Ramon es poder brindar comodidad a sus pequeños y a su esposa que trabaja como enfermera en el Hospital y que ademas lo apoya con los gastos y con este proyecto.
texts.en:
Juan Ramon is 32 years old, married, and has 2 daughters (one is 2 years old and the other 9). He has worked as a dispatcher at Hospital Asuncion de Juigalpa for 9 years. They live with his parents who have given him and his family a room to live in. He is asking for a loan so he can fix up their living space -- making it more comfortable for his wife and children. He wants to install electricity and build a wall for an additional room. He has most of the materials and only needs to buy cement and labor to finish the project. Juan’s greatest wish is to provide a comfortable space for his daughters and wife (who is a nurse in the same hospital and who helps out with expenses).

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall and install electricity

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana N. sells groceries like milk, Milo (a milk beverage), sugar and food supplies at Elmina near the seashore. She has received junior high school education and is married and has three children. Her husband is a trader.

Christiana has been selling groceries since 2001, supporting her husband with the housekeeping. Her loan will be used to buy groceries and other food supplies in large quantities to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy groceries and other food supplies in large quantities

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is married and has three children aged 24, 22, and 19, all of whom are in school.  Felipe and his family live in the town of Cabilona, in Cochabamba Department.
With this loan from CIDRE, Felipe is going to buy food, primarily soy husks, to feed his dairy cows.  He also sows several crops on his family's land, such as onions and carrots.  Felipe is completely dedicated to funding his children's education.  Two of his children are at university, and the third is in military school to become a sergeant.  In the past, he has borrowed from CIDRE to purchase more livestock as well as fertilizer.  Felipe and his wife continue to work hard so that their children will have all that they need.  He is also trying to increase his earnings to help care for his brother-in-law, who is currently sick and unable to work.

loans.use: Purchase of food for livestock

loans.name: Musurat

texts.en: Musurat sells children's shoes, clothes and bags in Oyo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for over 20 years. Musurat is 42 years old and married with four children. Musurat is soliciting a loan of 70,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more children's shoes, clothes and bags. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more children's shoes, clothes and bags

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 44 years old, divorced and has given birth to two children. Both of her children are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Rose is a trader. She runs a provision store by the road side in her community. She has been in business for over 20 years and would like a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock. Rose desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store in bulk.

loans.name: Suffer To Gain Group

texts.en:
Prince K. is a leader of a group of five borrowers called Suffer to Gain. He is 39 years old, married and has two children aged ten and eighteen years old (they are in the fourth and tenth grades). He also cares for his mother and two sisters. Prince and his family live and work within the Baptist mission school community in Brewerville, north of Liberia’s capital, Monrovia. He dropped out of school in the seventh grade due to financial difficulties.

Prince’s business is in metal works. He buys and welds metal items for residents of his community. He started by using a friend’s tools and machinery, became experienced and decided to work on his own. Prince provides his own materials when working for customers in order to encourage them to continue patronizing his business. He has been in business for seven years and would like to continue improving his shop.

Prince needs this loan to purchase rebar, sheet metal and paint to improve his business. He dreams of giving his children a better education and building a house.

loans.use: To purchase rebar, sheet metal and paint for his business.

loans.name: Meur

texts.en:
Meur L. is 42 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. Since 2002, she has been growing and selling vegetables to sell at the local market to earn approximately US$2 of profit every day. Her husband is a farm guard and makes US$1 per day. This couple has five children, two of whom are construction workers building houses and three are students.

Meur L. would like to take out a loan of US$600 to make a new investment in order to raise her standard of living. She will use this loan to invest in a grocery-stand business.

loans.use: To invest in a grocery stand

loans.name: Kodjovi Eloge

texts.en: Mr. A. is a single man who repairs and sells refrigerators. This will be his first loan with the Kiva field partner, WAGES, which he will use to purchase ten refrigerators for resale. He purchases his stock from Lomé, but sells his merchandise specifically in the Bé district. This loan will help Mr. A. to further his professional development in this useful profession.

loans.use: to buy refrigerators to sell

loans.name: Adkhamjon

texts.en:
Adkhamjon is 28 years old. He has been running his business of raising and selling cattle for 11 years. Adkhamjon tries to invest as much time as possible in his animals. He tries to bathe and vaccinate his animals, which is very tedious, because there is only one place to bathe them and it's not easy to reach. Without a doubt, the results please him: to be able to see clean and healthy animals is a big source of satisfaction. 

Adkhamjon now plans to invest the money that he is requesting in the purchase of a good breed of livestock to improve the quality of his animals. He will then generate more income, and, with that, he will improve his quality of life.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Valantino Nassiwa‘S Group

texts.en:
Valantina has a stall in Owino Market (one of the busiest markets in Uganda) selling fruits and vegetables. She sells all kinds of fruit including mangoes, pawpaws, oranges and yellow bananas. She mainly sells retail. She works seven days a week and serves about 30 customers a day. She has been in this business for two years now. Her main challenge is that there are many stalls selling fruit so the competition is very high. 

Valantina is 40 years of age and married with three children between the ages of 5 and 15. All her children go to school. She lives in a rented two-room house with six people. She has three meals a day. She takes care of additional family members. Her three largest monthly expenses are utility bills, school fees for her children, and rent for her  residence and business premises. 

Valantina has been with MCDT for two years – now on her fifth loan with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more baskets of fruits and vegetables. She hopes to see her business grow and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Dina Esther

texts.es: Dina Esther V. R. de 30 años de edad, reside en Lourdes colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su compañero de vida y su único hijo de dos años de edad. Ella posee una venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, la cual esta ubicada en el Mercado Municipal d Lourdes Colón, lugar en el cual durante más de 5 años ha tratado de seguir adelante con su negocio, ya que es este el que le permite solventar todos los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo. Dina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa, sobre todo ropa para jóvenes la cual esta muy de moda, lo que le permita ser más fácil de vender. Esto es vital para Dina ya que la estabilidad de su hogar depende en gran manera de las ganancias obtenidas por ella. Para Dina el bienestar de su familia es primero, razón por la cual cada día de 8 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde ofrece su producto a las personas que visitan el mercado, esto con la esperanza de poder obtener mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Dina Esther V. R. is 30 years old and a resident of Lourdes Colón, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her lifelong partner and their only child who is two years old. Dina sells clothing for men, women, and children at the municipal market in Lourdes Colón. She started this business more than five years ago because she wanted to join her husband in meeting the household expenses.

Dina is requesting a loan so that she can buy clothing in larger quantities, particularly the trendier clothes for young people because they are easier to sell. Her business is vital since the stability of her household depends largely on the income that she is able to earn. Dina says her family’s wellbeing is her highest priority. For this reason, she works each day from 8am until 6pm and offers her products to people who visit the market. She hopes to generate better sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes in different colors & sizes

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Cristian Gerardo

texts.es:
Cristian Gerardo A. H., tiene la edad de 27 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y 3 hijos de 5,10 y 12 años de edad, son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Cristian también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Cristian Gerardo A. H., 27, is married and lives with his wife and three children, who are his main priority in life; they are 5, 10, and 12 years old. He needs funds to support his farming, specifically his coffee crops. The idea is to buy manure and fertilizer. He wants to give his plants proper care and maintenance so that the coffee produced will be of the best quality in order to command the best possible sale price at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms given. Cristian has been a farmer for many years. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future and to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For his coffee crops.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 38 años, es una madre de familia muy laboriosa, está casada con Rómulo de 29 años, con quien tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales vive sólo con tres. La casa que habitan es propia y la construyeron a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. 

Cuando su última hija nació (hace 3 años) con una enfermedad que le impide valerse por sí sola, Antonia empezó a ver el mundo desde otra perspectiva, pues los anhelos de brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida, han logrado que trabaje con mayor ahínco, sin descuidarla ni un segundo. 
Junto a su esposo, llevan 22 años cultivando café y refiere que todo de la agricultura le agrada, sobre todo seleccionar la calidad de los frutos, ya que le permite obtener buenas ganancias con  las que cubre la educación de sus hijos, los alimentos y le permite ahorrar para más adelante comprar una casa en la ciudad; donde instalará una tienda de comestibles, además de acopiar los granos de café. Dejar por temporadas su vivienda no le será fácil, pero valdrá la pena porque su hija menor podrá recibir un tratamiento adecuado.

Este es el primer crédito tiene con MFP y manifiesta estar muy agradecida con la oportunidad que le brinda la entidad y los integrantes de su banco comunal. Los mil soles que solicita los invertirá en contratar operarios que le ayuden a cosechar su café.
texts.en:
Antonia is 38 years old and a hardworking mother. She is married to Rómulo (age 29) and has five children, but only three live with them. She lives in her own house, which was built after much effort and sacrifice.

Her youngest daughter was born three years ago with a disease in which her body cannot fend for itself. Antonia began to see the world from a different perspective. She was overcome with desires to provide her daughter with an adequate quality of life, so she managed to work with greater devotion without having to neglect her for one second.

Antonia and her husband have been growing coffee for 22 years and enjoy all aspects of farming, especially selecting the quality of their harvest so that they can generate the best earnings to help cover the education of their children, their food, and some savings so that later they can buy a house in the city. There they can open a grocery store in addition to harvesting coffee beans. Leaving their home during the harvest season would not be easy, but it would be worth it so that their young daughter could receive the proper treatment.

This is her first loan with MFP. Antonia says she is grateful for this opportunity given to her by the Institution and the members of her Communal Bank. With the loan of 1000 PEN that she requested, she will hire workers to help with harvesting her coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire workers to help with harvesting coffee

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, 36 years old, sells bread and Semovita. She does her business from home and has been in the business for over 10 years. She makes good profit and she hopes for more business growth in future so she can save and reinvest into her business. Caroline is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more bread and Semovita to sell. She promises to repay her loan.

Caroline’s husband is a commercial motorcycle rider in Lagos and they are blessed with four children. Caroline is very optimistic about the prosperity of her business and of her family. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more bread and Semovita to sell

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor tiene 63 años D. edad, es soltera y vive en el sector Campodónico D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, conocida a nivel nacional como La Ciudad D. la Amistad, se caracteriza por su abundante movimiento comercial y D. transporte, es la capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. cinco años a la elaboración y comercialización D. todo tipo D. pasteles y tortas, ella prepara sus productos en su vivienda y los distribuye a los diversos comerciantes que trabajan en los principales centros D. abasto D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, como mercados y centros comerciales, ellos venden sus pasteles por porciones al publico en general. Adicionalmente Flor también prepara sus productos para compromisos sociales como cumpleaños. Matrimonios, entre otros. 

Flor se ha ido haciendo conocida y poco a poco su numero D. pedidos va creciendo, por ello se ha planteado ampliar su producción para lo que necesita mas materiales e insumos, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el logro D. su objetivo.

Flor es una mujer trabajadora y que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza, sus clientes y conocidos le consideran alguien responsable y D. confianza.
texts.en:
Flor is 63 years old, single, and lives in the Campodónico neighborhood of the city of Chiclayo, known at the national level as the City of Friendship. The city is characterized by its large commercial and transportation sectors. It is the capital of the Lambayeque region. For more than 5 years Flor has been making and selling all types of cakes and pastries. She prepares the products in her home and distributes them to various merchants who work in the main retail centers of the city of Chiclayo, such as markets and shopping malls. They sell her cakes by the slice to the general public. In addition, Flo prepares her products for social occasions such as birthdays, weddings, and other occasions. Flor has become well-known and gradually her orders are increasing. For this reason she is planning to increase her production. To do this she needs more materials and supplies, so she is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles that she will invest to achieve this objective. Flor is a hardworking woman who likes the work that she does very much. Her customers and acquaintances consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies to expand her cake business

loans.name: Dorathi

texts.en:
Dorathi is a 35-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children. She has one son and two daughters. Her husband is a mason, and her children are still in school.

Dorathi has managed a business for a year selling clothes. She is hardworking and enthusiastic. She has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business by purchasing more clothes to sell. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz, a resident of mid-sized city Riwind, Pakistan, owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over ten years. She is a mother of seven children: five sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works in a cotton factory, receiving a monthly wage, and the next eldest is a painter. The others are enrolled in school and read in 8th, 7th, 6th and 5th level. 

Shahnaz operates a clothes-sewing business to pay the education expenses for her children. She sews clothes for her neighbors and completes two dresses in a day, earning Pak Rs. 200 for her work. Her husband's name is M. M. and he has been involved in the dairy business for the last 10 years. He has two buffalo which produce almost 20-22kgs of milk, which he then sells in the community and also in the milk shops. His good quality milk lures customers to come to him for purchasing milk. His income helps to meet the financial expenses of the family. 

Shahnaz has successfully completed three previous loans from Asasah and has now applied for the fourth time to invest the capital in her husband’s dairy business.  He will purchase another buffalo and expand the dairy business.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo to expand the dairy business

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran and her husband M. J. live in Lahore, a city which is famous for historical places and Punjabi foods. In addition to raising four children -- two sons and two daughters -- she leads a loan group with three members. Her older son makes a living embroidering dresses for a boutique. Her younger son is a laborer who works for a daily wage. Her daughters are doing well in school, and Naziran and her husband want to continue to give them a good education. To achieve this dream, their sons are helping them pay their daughters' tuition.  

Naziran and her husband both work very hard. For the last 10 years, she has earned an income working at home as a seamstress, a line of work at which is she is very skilled. Because her prices are low and she is good at what she does, all of her neighbors want her to sew their clothes, and she has an excellent reputation in her area. 

Her husband makes a living selling clothes, buying supplies in cities such as Multan and Faisalabad, where prices are low and quality is high. He sells this clothing in different parts of Lahore, where he works hard to make money to support his family. He has been in this line of work for the past six years.  

Naziran has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah and now is applying for the second loan with her group. She will use her portion of this loan to buy clothing in bulk for her husband to sell to his customers for a good profit.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk for resale

loans.name: Aydelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aydalina del Carmen L. G. mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora. Ella en su niñez aprendió de sus padres el oficio de la zapatería y el cual ha continuado con la creación de su propio taller junto con su esposo hace ocho años aproximadamente. Este es un negocio familiar donde su pareja y sus dos hijos se dedican a la creación del producto mientras ella lo comercializa.  

L. inicio en Adim hace años en un grupo solidario y fue promocionada a crédito individual por su comportamiento crediticio y el crecimiento que obtuvo en ese tiempo. Ella invertirá el crédito en la producción de cajuelas y calzado fino que son los más cotizados en esta época del año. El  sueño de esta mujer excepcional es hacer más grande su taller y lograr tener su propio tramo.
texts.en:
Aydalina del Carmen L. G. is a hard-working, dedicated, enterprising woman. While still a child she learned cobbling skills from her parents and to date has worked with her husband in her own shoe shop for about 8 years. This is the family business where her spouse and two children are in charge of manufacturing the items that she is in charge of selling. She first started collaborating with Adim several years ago as a member of a communal bank but was promoted to individual borrower status thanks to her credit history and the growth she obtained during that time. She will use the loan for boot and fine shoe production which are the items in highest demand during this season of the year. This exceptional woman’s dream is to expand her workshop and to have her own sales area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials like: leather, soles, insoles, adhesive, thread, etc.

loans.name: Mativa

texts.en: Mativa I. is 21 and is married with one child. She owns a business venture catching and selling ocean-caught fish and has three years of experience in this business. Mativa needs a loan of WST 1,000 to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or approximately USD 233 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Mativa joined SPBD and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Buraima's Group

texts.en:
Today women play a vital role in their communities, in improvement of living standards and overall economic growth. When a foreigner goes to any local market in Kyrgyzstan, he can see that the majority of shop assistants and sellers are women. This occurrence shows that old stereotypes about women as housewives have begun to disappear. 

Buraima M. is the leader of this group. She is sixty-four. Both she and her husband are retired. However, Buraima prefers to lead an independent life and therefore still makes her living by cattle breeding. Besides, she and her husband obtain a pension, which amounts to 4400 soms a month. She combines cattle breeding with farming as she also possesses a piece of land where she grows potatoes and cabbage. Another source of income comes from selling milk. 

Buraima’s two sons are engaged in construction and sometimes help their mother in her activities. Due to these joint businesses, Buraima has successfully married off her sons and increased the total population of her livestock. Now Buraima needs a loan. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to buy two sheep. 

Buraima’s partners:

Rukiahon B., 54, is a mother of four children. Two of her sons are working in Russia. To make a living, Rukiahon and her husband are engaged in farming. Her husband is an excavator driver. As for Rukiahon, she grows cotton on a piece of land. Rukiahon hopes to obtain this loan and purchase mineral fertilizers.

Zamira A., 51, has three children. Her husband works in Osh city. As for Zamira, she breeds cattle and does odd jobs. She manages to earn two – three dollars a day. Zamira has applied for this loan to make repairs on their house.

Suvsara M., 76, is a widow. She lives with her grandchild and his wife. In her old age Suvsara continues to work and contributes to her family’s income by raising livestock and growing cotton. She has two cows and obtains a pension. Suvsara needs this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Abduhamid

texts.en:
M. Abduhamid is 25 years old. He is married and has a little daughter. His wife is a teacher at secondary school. Abduhamid is producing tinware. He has been in this business already for 5 years. The finished products are purchased from the house of Abduhamid. The business stability allows him to have income and to ensure the family has the possibility to improve their living conditions. Today Abduhamid  is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 US Dollars in order to purchase raw materials for producing tinware.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of raw material for making tinware

loans.name: Eliezel

texts.en:
Eliezel was born in 1982 and he is married with one child who is 3 years old. He is a self-employed businessman and and his wife is a businesswoman; they both work hard for the purpose of providing all that’s necessary for their family.

Eliezel makes metal doors and windows and he said that this business is profitable once one has enough capital. He employs two people from his community as helpers so that his business runs well; his business is open from six in the morning to eight in the evening, every day except Saturday.

Eliezel is now requesting Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing enough metal to use in the fabrication of more windows and doors. With the extra profits which are expected he will be able to save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase metals for making more doors and windows

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “José Carlos Mariátegui”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de jugos, la socia tiene una jugueria en el mercado de la provincia de Urubamba y su esposo se dedica a la venta de relojes en forma independiente, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de relojes y para comprar  fruta para hacer los jugos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Roxana, 31, is married and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with the sale of fruit juices. She has a juice shop in Urubamba province’s market and her husband sells timepieces independently. She wants to expand her business and is asking for funds to buy timepieces and to buy fruits to make juices. She is a member of the “José Carlos Mariátegui” communal bank located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this platform to express her gratitude to all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy timepieces and fruit to make juices.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes C. is from the village of Sto. Domingo. She is 59 years old. Mercedes is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedes sells clothing products in the local community. Mercedes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Mercedes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Mercedes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.en:
Arnaldo D., a 47-year-old farmer from the town of Sto. Niño, has been planting and harvesting rice crops for 30 years. He says his harvest is used for family consumption and also sold to the market. His farm income helps his family with food, clothes and other needs.

Arnaldo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan from CEVI, he is now requesting his seventh loan for 15000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Arnaldo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca M. is a married woman who lives in Purok 7, Brgy. Malabuhan, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by fishing and selling fish. Her husband, Vitaliano M., who is 45 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living. He also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who range in age from 23 to 30 years old. Rebecca joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rebecca has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,500, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,500, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business selling fish. She continues to save up for future home repairs. Rebecca M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 


About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine H. is from the village of Brgy. Aurora, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Josephine is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business selling vegetables in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.es: La Sra. N. es una mujer muy activa y responsable, deseando simpre tener un entorno agradable y sobre todo el mejoramiento de su casa, a base de esfuerzo y trabajo a logrado ir construyendo su casa, ella es empleada domestica y sus hijos ya estan casado a pesar que siempre la procurar y estan al pendiente de ella, a ella no le gusta depender de ellos es una mujer muy independiente, el credito lo quiere porque esta haciendo una division en su casa para hacer lo que es sala y  comedor.
texts.en: La Señora N. is a very active, responsible woman.  She always wants pleasant surroundings and above all wants to make improvements to her house.  For this reason, she struggles and works to finish the contruction of her house.  She is a domestic worker.  Her children are already married, although they always watch out for her and are very devoted to her.  She doesn't like to depend on them and is a very independent woman.  She requests this loan because she is dividing one room in her house into a dining room and living room.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Angelica M., es una persona que igual que su esposo trabajan  vendiendo, ropa, tamales, y trabajos de albañileria, pero cuentan con el apoyo de sus hijos, que viven con ellos y les ayudan en lo que pueden, ya que el terreno donde viven es muy grande, y es esta la razon por la que la sra. Angelica, esta ampliando su casa, para cuando le llegan  las visitas, tener donde acomodarlas, ella es una persona muy sencilla que le abre las puertas a todo el mundo, y ofrece su confianza , este es el segundo credito que ella tiene con esta institucion, por lo que esta muy contenta de que le hayan brindado la oportunidad de ser una  cliente mas, y asi poder ampliar su casita, ya que su esposo es quien se encarga de hacer los trabajos pesados de albañileria, y eso es un ahorro para ellos.
texts.en: Señora Angelica M., like her husband, sells clothes, tamales, and performs some bricklaying work.  They also depend on the support of their children, whom live with them and help them when they can.  The plot of land where they live is very big, hence Señora Angelica is expanding her house so that when visitors come, she has space to accommodate them.  She is a simple person that opens her door to the whole world and lends them her trust.  This is the second credit that she has had with this institution.  She is very happy that they have given her the opportunity to be one of their clients and as such be able to expand her little house.  Since her husband will be in charge of carrying out all of the heavy bricklaying work, this will be a huge saving for them.

loans.use: Expand the house so there is more room for grandchildren and church visitors.

loans.name: Kanym

texts.en:
Kanym N. is 54 years old and has five grown children. She lives in Ozgorush village in the north of Kyrgyzstan. Kanym has worked as a milker in the local area for a long time. Her colleagues characterize her as an openhearted and hardworking person. Along with her family, Kanym breeds cattle and cultivates kidney beans and perennial herbs. She has worked hard to improve her business and achieve success. Today, Kanym has a farm with milk cows and she sells their milk to the local dairy factory.
  
Kanym plans to use her loan of 70,000 KGS to increase the number of cows she has and to purchase mineral fertilizers and manure to improve her harvest and farm products. In the future, she plans to build a barn to provide better conditions for her livestock.  

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners use Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable populations. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading micro-finance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cows and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; ella tiene 57 años de edad, viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros como polos, chompas, casacas, blusas, ropa para bebes entre otros más, la socia tiene su establecimiento en una galería por el centro de la ciudad, a la vez la socia trabaja como docente en un colegio estatal y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería de ropa para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "SAN VALENTIN" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Maria is 57 years old, widowed, and has 2 children.  Her business is buying and selling children's, women's and men's clothes such as polo shirts, sweaters, jackets, blouses, baby clothes, etc.  She has an establishment in a mall in the city center.  She also works as a teacher in a state school and this is how she gets her family ahead in life.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy merchandise (clothes) for her business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (clothes) for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 46 años, vive con su hijo y su madre en su casa propia. Desde hace 1 año vende cerveza, negocio que realiza desde su domicilio, es así que atiende a partir de la tarde hasta la noche. Siempre recibe la ayuda de su madre, ya que tiene buena acogida, es por ello que se esmera en brindar un  trato amable a sus clientes. Es así que cada cierto tiempo se abastece de mercadería, eso favorece en las ganancias. Ahora su propósito es  crecer su negocio e implementarla con más productos. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en cervezas y así podrá incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Gloria is 46 and lives with her child and mother in her own home. She has sold beer for one year from her home, working from the afternoon into the evening. Her mother always helps her, and the business is well-known. They take great care to offer good customer service, so every time that she stocks up on merchandise, she makes a better income.

She is now hoping to expand her business and stock it with more products. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since she has always been responsible with her payments. Furthermore, she is happy to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very united people.

Gloria thanks those of you who will lend toward her loan, as it will be very useful in the progress of her business. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise (beer), and thus be able to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to stock up on more beer

loans.name: Naipanoi Ene

texts.en:
Naipanoi Ene has been selling clothes and livestock in Naivasha town for the last six years.  She is 56 years old, married to Kiano Ene Kimpat, and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officer and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy 15 sheep which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes S. is a 29 year old married lady with five children. She has been operating a food Kiosk in Watamu for a period of one year, and earns a good income.

Agnes has applied for her first loan of KES. 20,000, which she plans to use to purchase additional stock for her business. By doing this, Agnes hopes to grow her business rapidly; something that will enable her to earn more money. 
 

She hopes that one day she will operate her own retail shop so as to be in a good position to serve her ever growing customers well and in return get more money so as to continue helping out her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of assorted fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, tiene 39 años D. edad, está casado y fruto D. esta unión tiene tres hijos, él nació en la ciudad D. Urubamba y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad. Juan nos cuenta que es albañil y trabaja D. forma independiente. Muchos D. sus clientes a Juan le contratan para que construya casas, cuartos y otras cosas más, él comprá los materiales que utilizará para construir casas y al terminar la obra, él cobra por los materiales y por la mano D. obra utilizada. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Juan en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como cemento, madera, clavos y muchas cosas más. 

Juan pertenece al banco comunal “Los Solidarios” D. la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juan is 39 years old and married.  Together with his wife, he has three children.  He, himself, was born in the city of Urubamba, and he still lives there now.  Juan tells us that he is a builder and works for himself.  Many of Juan's customers contract him to build houses or additional rooms, among other things.  He purchases the materials that he will use to build the houses, and when he is finished, he bills the customer for the materials used and for his labor.  Juan has been making his living in construction for 10 years, and it has been going very well for him, thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  Juan needs the loan at this time to purcahse materials, like cement, wood, nails and many other items.

Juan belongs to the communal bank “Los Solidarios," which is a part of Asociación Arariwa.  He is thankful for the opportunity he has been offered by this organizaiton and he is committed to complying with the corresponding repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase materials like cement, wood, nails and many other things.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is currently in a business of selling tea. She is 40 years old, married to a driver,with no children.Esther borrowed a loan to stock more tea to sell. Her future goal is to open a shop with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more tea to sell.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor, de 40 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y responsable, vive en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Kivinaki, pero tiene su casa propia cerca de su chacra y lo que más desea es brindarle un mejor futuro a su esposa Delfa de 34 años y a sus 3 queridos hijos. Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene Héctor en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos se conviertan en uno de los más productivos de su poblado, él trabaja sin descaso ya que sabe que de su esfuerzo depende la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde vende sus productos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras para aumentar su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, espera cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo y así no perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetado por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras
texts.en:
Héctor is 40 years old and is a loving and responsible father.  He lives in a rented home in the town of Kivinaki, but he has his own home near his fields and what he really wants is a better future for his wife and three children.  His hard work has made his crops some of the most productive in the area.  He works without rest because he knows that his family depends on him for support and his children’s education.  What he enjoys most about his work is harvesting his crops.  He’s been doing this for 11 years and he considers the most difficult part to be transporting the harvest to the city of Pichanaki to sell.  In time he expects to buy more land in order to increase his production.

This will be his third loan through MFP.  He expects to meet his payments so that he doesn’t make the rest of the members of the communal bank look bad.  He is much respected for the responsibility he has demonstrated.  He will use the 1,500 PEN to buy fertilizers to improve his land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo De 1Ro De Enero Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca tiene 50 años, convive con su pareja y tiene dos hijos, los dos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, pero el menor aún vive con ellos. Francisca es presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “San Judas Tadeo de 1ro de Enero” elegida por su carisma y don de liderazgo, en la formación del grupo ella colaboró presentado a señoras activas y propuso el nombre del grupo “San Judas Tadeo” es el patrón del trabajo y “1ro de enero” porque así se llama la zona donde viven.
Francisca se dedica a la Venta de carne Pollos en el Mercado Modelo de su zona, lleva en este negocio cerca de siete años, antes de esto solo se dedicaba al hogar puesto que sus hijos aún eran estudiantes y necesitaban de todo su apoyo; era su esposo quien en ese entonces se dedicaba al negocio  en otro mercado, al ver ella que era rentable decidieron comprar un terreno donde empezó a vender, ahora su casa tiene dos pisos y adquirió un auto que lo puso a trabajar como servicio de Taxi. Francisca no quiere quedarse ahí y pretende comprar otro terreno más céntrico donde pueda abrir otro negocio similar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca is 50 years old and lives with her partner and two son who are both adults and independent; although the youngest still lives at home.  Francisca is the president of the "San Judas Tadeo de 1ro de Enero" communal group and she was elected because of her charisma and leadership.  She collaborated in the training of the group and introduced active women to it.  She also proposed the group name "San Judas Tadeo" for the patron saint of work and "1ro de enero" because that's the name of the area where they live.

Francisca sells chicken in the Modelo Market in her area.  She has been in the business for seven years.  BefO. she was a homemaker because her children were still in school and they needed her support.  Her husband was the one who ran the business at the market.  Seeing that business was profitable they decided to buy land where they began selling.  Now they have a two storey house and a car that he uses to provide taxi service.  Francisca prefers not to stay in their current location and wants to buy property closer to downtown to open a similar business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ismaela

texts.en:
Ismaela, 29, is married with three children. She provides for her family through a small fishing business that she has been running for three years. She is looking to grow and improve her business by taking out a PHP13,000 loan through NWTF for the purchase of fishing gear and other essential supplies.  

The education of her three children, and the goal of sending each one to college, is Ismaela’s ultimate goal.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells beans.  She is 40 years old and a widow with 4 children.  2 of them go to school.

Esther borrowed a loan to stock more beans and onions to sell. She hopes to buy cows and goats in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Estudió solo hasta 2do de  educación secundaria.
Desde hace ocho años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo  fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de panadería.
Con éste nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 2700.00 nuevo soles, comprará siete quintales de harina, manteca, azúcar, levadura, sal, cuenta que por día utiliza un quintal de harina y los días de feria utiliza tres quintales de harina.  Graciela trabaja junto con su esposo quien también trabaja en servicio de mototaxi y maestro albañil, son trabajos eventuales que le permite cubrir otros gastos familiares.
Su sueño es tener una amasadora para seguir trabajando en el negocio.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the “3 de Mayo” (May 3) communal bank located in Ilave District, El Collao Province, Puno Department.  She is 31 years old, married and has three children.  She only finished 8th grade.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 8 years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her bakery.

She will use this new 2700 new sol loan to buy seven quintals of flour, lard, sugar, yeast and salt.  She tells us that she uses one quintal of flour per day and on holidays she uses three quintals of flour.  

Graciela works alongside her husband who also works providing mototaxi service and is a master bricklayer.  Those are occasional jobs that allow him to cover other family expenses.

Her dream is to have a kneader to continue working in the bakery.  What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings and the talks.

loans.use: to buy seven quintals of flour, lard, sugar, yeast and salt.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe tiene más de dos años con su negocio de elaboración y venta de comida. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar material que le esta haciendo falta que es platas, vasos, ollas donde preparar los guisados y varios alimentos. Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que su negocio requiere.
Pagara el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ya que su esposo el señor Felipe se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos, con las ganancias de su negocio que el tiene.
texts.en:
Guadalupe has had her business of making and selling food for over two years.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy the materials that she needs.  She will buy plates, glasses, and pots to prepare stews and various other foods.  She does not now have the money that is needed to make the investment that her business needs.

She will pay back the loan with the earnings she gets from her business.  Her husband, Felipe, will take charge of the family expenses and the school expenses for her children with his income from the business that he has.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, and pots to prepare stews and various other foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow coffee

loans.name: Khairiddin

texts.en:
Since 2004 Khairiddin has been a livestock farmer. He breeds calves, cows and sheep. He is single and lives with his parents.

Khairiddin's father was also a cattle breeder and from childhood he has gained rich experience in the livestock business, enabling him to improve his situation. 

Nowadays, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also to offer related products such as dairy products in the surrounding community.

Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows. Khairiddin is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more cows.

loans.name: Dolia

texts.es: Dolia radica en la ciudad de Huancayo desde hace 20 años,  tiene 46 años y vive con sus hijos en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica en la venta de verduras en un mercado de su zona, se abastece de manera Inter diaria en el mercado central y con la ayuda de sus hijos  instala su puesto de ventas y lista para atender a sus clientes. A lo largo de estos años ha ido mejorando, poco a poco su negocio va creciendo al igual que sus ganancias; pues su meta es tener un puesto más amplio con mayor variedad de productos. Paralelo a ello, vende granos en las ferias comerciales que existen en zonas aledañas a su comunidad, por lo que le genera ingresos extras para la economía de su hogar, y por tal espera continuar desarrollando ambos negocios. Un día recibió la invitación de una de sus vecinas para formar parte del grupo solidario con MFP y desde ese entonces han pasado mas de 3 años de trabajo sumando esta su novena oportunidad de crédito de la cual se siente muy orgullosa de su permanencia y de su buen record crediticio por la puntualidad que ha demostrado por lo que renueva su compromiso de pago. Con el dinero que solicita, aumentará su capital de trabajo, tanto en verduras como en granos para vender, ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dolia has been living in the city of Huancayo for the past 20 years.  She is 46 years old and lives with her children in a home of her own.  She has been selling vegetables at a market within the zone for the past ten years.  She gets her supplies from the central market and, with her children’s help, sets up her stall and serves her customers.  Things have been getting better little by little over the years and her business and income have been growing.  Her goal is to have a bigger stall, with a greater variety of products.  At the same time, Dolia also sells basic grains at the commercial fairs in her community’s surrounding zones.  This earns her extra income for her household expenses.  She expects to continue developing both businesses.

One day one of her neighbors invited her to form part of this group with MFP, and since then she’s been working for three years and this will be her ninth opportunity for a loan.  She feels very proud of her longevity and the punctuality she has demonstrated in making her payments.  She will use the money from this loan to increase her working capital and buy vegetables and grains to sell because her customer demand has been high.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and grains.

loans.name: Norma Elena

texts.es:
La señora Norma Elena tiene la edad de 42 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casado con el señor Rolando que se dedica al trabajo del Operador de autobuces del palmar, ellos tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos ya estan casados y los otros dos tiene la edad de 16 años y 8 años que asisten a la preparatoria y primaria de su comunidad.
Ella nos platica que hacemos de 12 años con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo inicio a vender ropa para dama y caballero casa por casa con su amiga y vecinos de su comunidad poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo e inicio a salir a vender a otras comunidades como san Agustin, Tetela y Cosolapa. 
Ella a hecho cada dia mas clientes y hace algunos años inicia a vender tambien un poco de visuteria (accesorios para dama) y nos dice que Gracias a Dios se ha vendido muy bien. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de blusas, camisas, shorts, ropa interior, pantalones, calcetines, pulceras, aretes y bolsas de mano para posterior venta.
Ella espera que cada dia su negocio cresca mas ya que desea dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y en un futuro poco a poco construir un pequeño local en el cual vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Norma Elena, age 42, only went to high school.  She is married to Rolando, who works as bus operator in Palmar.  She has four children, and two of them are married.  The other two are 16 and 8 years old.  They go to high school and elementary school in their community.

She tells us that in order to help her husband, 12 years ago she started selling women’s and men’s clothes door to door to her friends and neighbors in her community.  Little by little her business was growing.  She started selling in other communities like Agustin, Tetela, and Cosolapa.  

She makes new customers every day, and some years ago she started to also sell a small amount of costume jewelry (accessories for women).  She says that thanks to God she has been selling very well.

She needs the loan to buy blouses, shirts, shorts, underwear, pants, socks, bracelets, earrings, and handbags to sell later.

She hopes that her business grows more every day. This is because she wishes to give her children a better quality of life and to gradually build a small place to sell her products in the future.

loans.use: to sell clothes.

loans.name: Maryuri Alexandra

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana, lugar conocido por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son un gran atractivo turístico del cantón y la provincia misma, allí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas de Agua Fría.

En este lugar vive la señora Maryuri, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 18, 17, 15 y 8 años, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es obrero.
 
Nuestra amiga para generar sus propios ingresos y ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos se dedica a la compra y venta de carne de pollos, ella trabaja todos los días ya que de lunes a viernes vende en su casa y los sábados y domingos pone un local en el mercado de Ayacucho, vende los pollos por libras o enteros, los pollos  compra en una granja de la localidad en la cual trabaja su esposo. Lleva seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nuestra amiga por temporadas también se dedica a la cría de estos animalitos.

Este crédito es para comprar carne de pollo para la venta diaria. Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal, es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque el banco es muy unido.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran local o un frigorífico.
texts.en:
In Ayacucho parish, in the canton of Santa Ana, a place known for its beautiful freshwater swimming areas, which are a great touristic attraction of both the canton and the province, the "Damas de Agua Fría" ["Cold Water Ladies"] communal bank meets every 15 days.

In this place lives Maryuri, who is 36 years old. She has a common-law husband with whom she has four children, aged 18, 17, 15 and 8. The three older children are in secondary school and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband is a laborer.
 
In order to generate her own income and help pay for her children's education, this friendly woman works buying and selling chicken meat. She works every day, since she sells from her home from Monday through Friday, and on Saturdays and Sundays she runs a stall in the Ayacucho market. She sells the chicken by the pound or whole. She buys the chickens from a farm in the area where her husband works. She has done this work for six years, and it is going very well for her. In some seasons, our friend also works raising these creatures. 

This loan is to buy chicken meat for her daily sales. She has been in the communal bank since the beginning; she is the group's payment supervisor, and she likes it because the bank is very united. 

Her dreams are to have a large shop or a refrigerated meat locker.
