loans.use: to buy chicken meat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Denis Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Denis Violeta y el señor Maurilio son padres de familia y tiene tres hijos que actual mente están estudiando.
Solicitan un préstamo ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar la inscripción y que sus niños puedan estudiar este año escolar. 
Doña Denis Violeta se dedica al cuidado y atención de sus hijos ya que el don Maurilio es quien se encarga de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como chofer de un camión de carga con una parte de este sueldo planea pagar el crédito.
Desean darles una  mejor educación para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Señora Denis Violeta and Señor Maurilio are parents to three children who are currently studying.

They are applying for a loan because they do not have enough money to pay the necessary registration fees for their children to be able to study this school year.

Doña Denis Violeta is a full-time mother and Don Maurilio looks after the family expenses with the income he makes from his job as a truck driver. He plans to repay the loan with part of his salary.

They want to provide their children with better education so that they will have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 50 years old, married; he lives with his wife and his four children.

Anwar is an owner of a furniture gallery since 1995, selling bedrooms, dining tables, sitting rooms and kitchens.  He has more than six years of experience in this field and has a good reputation and there are a lot of customers passing by his shop. 

He is requesting a $2,500 loan in order to enlarge his gallery by renting the shop next door to him.  He is aiming to gain more profits to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to enlarge his gallery by renting the shop next door to him.

loans.name: Yamila Jeanneth

texts.es:
Yamila, es sastre, confecciona toda clase D. ropa D. vestir, vive con su hijo y su esposo, ella aprendió el oficio D. sastrería porque su madre se lo enseño, y este oficio le ha servido para poder comprarse todo lo necesario  y apoyar a su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. telas D. diferentes colores, hilos, agujas, entre otros materiales que son muy necesarios, este préstamo le ayudara para mantener en la sastrería los insumos necesarios para la confección, realizando los trabajos en el tiempo requerido por los clientes. La aspiracion D. Yamila es poderce capacitar para mejorar los trabajos y hacer nuevas modas en la confeccion.
texts.en:
Yamila is a tailor who makes all types of clothing.  She lives with her son and her husband.  She learned the traD. of tailor because her mother taught it to her, and this job has served her to be able to buy herself everything she needs and support her family.
 
Currently she is requesting a loan to buy fabric in different colors, threads, needles, and other necessary materials.  This loan will help her to keep on hand the necessary tailoring materials for finishing the jobs in the time required by her customers.

Yamila's goal is to be able to prepare herself to improve her work and to make new styles.

loans.use: to buy fabric in different colors, threads, and needles.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn  is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a shop that sells items such as candies, snacks, and juices. She has had this business for six years. 

Jocelyn is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Jocelyn  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell such as candies, snacks, and juices.

loans.name: Mikocheni Group

texts.en: Helena is a single wO. in her early 20s. Last year, she opened a small hair-weaving business. Helena works from midday to 9 p.m. each day and earns a fair monthly profit. This is Helena's first loan with Tujijenge. With this loan, she hopes to buy more threads for her hair-weaving business and also begin selling sarongs. In the future, Helena dreams of opening a full-service salon. She will share this loan with her borrower group, Mikocheni. Mikocheni has 17 members and they hold each other accountable for paying back loans.

loans.use: to buy more threads for her hair-weaving business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a farmer and father of nine children, six of whom are of school going age. He is aged 50 and has 20 years of experience in mixed farming in the Litein area of South Rift Kenya. His farm currently produces milk,maize and beans which he sells locally.

Francis has requested for a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will improve his farming income which he will use to meet his family basic needs especially the education of the children.

He adds that sources of farming capital are limited, but the intervention by Juhudi Kilimo through the farming loans is a great help to farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 44 year old business man. He is married to Elizabeth, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged eight and six years respectively. He has been in the welding business for the past ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. Stephen is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Stephen will use the loan to buy scrap metal for his business. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife, so that they can help each other provide for their family's needs.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal for his business.

loans.name: Byambaa

texts.en: Byambaa is 54 years old and lives with her grandson, a monk, in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Byambaa started her garment sewing business in 1990. Her service is well known and she's a trusted supplier to many shops. Her products are very stylish and of high quality. Now that winter is here, Byambaa is getting a lot of orders; therefore, she is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to buy supplies. Byambaa is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "It is hard to replace his late mother. I have to work hard in order to support my grandson."

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame sells plastic bowls and baskets at Besease. She is married to a farmer and has 2 children. Maame has been selling this since 6 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in the raising of their children. Maame will use her loan to purchase more plastic bowls and basket for sale.  Maame will expand her business with the profit.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls and baskets

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié polygame à deux épouses.Il est père de 9 enfants dont les 4 sont des élèves.Il exerce le métier de chauffeur de camion dans un chantier d'exploitation de sable et de béton blanc , non loin de son village.En plus, il a un taxi de transport interurbain qui génère des revenus supplémentaires lui permettant de mieux prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille.Il sollicite auprés de UIMCEC un pret de 250000f pour repeindre entièrement son taxi afin de le rendre plus attractif pour la clientèle.Son ambition est de terminer son bâtiment en construction pour y loger sa famille.
texts.en:
Ibrahima is a married polygamous man who has two spouses. He's the father of nine children, out of whom four attend school. He's a truck driver for a company that extracts sand and white concrete, not far from his village.

In addition, he has a taxi and offers interurban transportation services, which earns him an extra income and enables him to better provide for his family's needs.

He's seeking a loan of XOF 250'000 from Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, in order to entirely repaint his taxi and make it more attractive to customers. He ambitions to complete the house he is building for his family.

loans.use: to entirely repaint his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bovine cattle.

loans.name: Sarait

texts.en: Sarait, 35, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over three years, earning approximately US $2.5 per day. Her husband is a mechanic who earns approximately US $3 per day. In order to develop her family's economy, Sarait is requesting a loan of US $350 to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband to sell as well as to repair motorbikes for his clients. By doing so, her husband will be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her husband's business

loans.name: Munkhbaatar

texts.en:
Munkhbaatar is a married man who lives with his spouse and son in an apartment. He is a teacher at a university and his wife is a receptionist at another university while his son attends university. Munkhbaatar has a seven-room dormitory and now four of them are empty. The other three have residents. 

He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to set up a heating system in his dormitory. Since the weather is very changeable, if he sets up a heating system the dormitory will be more comfortable for his residents. In the future, he wants to have long-term trusted residents.

loans.use: to set up a heating system in his dormitory.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos started his business shortly after coming from the Dominican Republic in 2004. Back home he worked as an accountant but after he came to the United States he decided to consider being his own boss and manage his own time by opening a electronics store. The $1000 that was provided to Carlos will be used to buy cellphones and chargers to resell in his store and attract more costumers.
texts.en:
Carlos started his business shortly after coming from the Dominican Republic in 2004. 

He studied accounting in his native country and decided to continue in this line of work, but this time he considered being his own boss and managing his own time. 

Carlos wanted to attract more customers to his business and so he decided that he needed to add a differentiating factor to his store. The $1,000 that was provided to Carlos will be used to buy cellphones and chargers to resell in his store and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es: Sandra de 30 años es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Al ver que el dinero no alcanzaba para hacer frente a los gastos de su hogar decidió poner un tienda en un espacio de su casa. Su deseo mas grande es tener su propia casa con su tienda.El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería de abarrotes al por mayor porque asi le sale mas barato y tener mejores ganancias. Pertenecer al banquito "Virgen de Fatima" le ha ayudado a tener una mejor calidad de vida. Se siente muy agradecida con las personas de Kiva por ayudar a cumplir sus metas. Sandra es la primera del lado derecho con chaleco rojo y gorra roja.
texts.en:
Sandra is 30 years old and has a partner and 2 minor children. Upon seeing that they were not making enough money to cover household costs, she decided to set up a store in part of her house. Her biggest desire is to have her own house with her store.

She invested the loan in the purchase of wholesale groceries because it is cheaper to buy them this way and have better profits. 

Belonging to the communal bank "Virgen de Fatima" has helped Sandra to have a better quality of life. She feels very thankful to Kiva for helping her achieve her goals. Sandra is the first person on the left with the red vest and the red hat.

loans.use: to purchase groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Nerma

texts.en: Nerma is a resident of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has six children. Among these six, only one child is still dependent on them, aged 16 years old. For the past years, her husband raised them all through fishing; thus, her husband is a fisherman while Nerma sells imported used clothes known as “ukay-ukay”. She has been doing this for more than 30 years to earn and helps her husband in providing the needs of their children. Nerma wants to operate this business continuously. With this, she is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy imported used clothes to sell. In this way, she will be able to enhance her livelihood and augment her profit.

loans.use: to buy imported used clothes (ukay-ukay)

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta has done this business, Unity Grocery, for a very long time. She has managed to make this business succeed even while she is a married woman with eight children.

Modesta was given her first chance to be a great entrepreneur when she received a donation of 100 dollars from Village Enterprise Fund in the year 2000.

She has attended business training three times. All these trainings are organised by Village Enterprise Fund. At the trainings, she learned many valuable business skills and ideas.

She is capable of handling the loan money very well, and she has proven this with how she has run Unity Grocery up until this day.

300 Dollars may not sound like very much for a grocery store but Modesta plans to expand the products she offers her customers by buying a higher quality and greater amounts of grocery items like tomatoes, cabbages, onions, green vegetables of different varieties, Irish potatoes etc.

loans.use: Increasing stock and variety in grocery store, Unity Grocery

loans.name: Ligia María

texts.en:
Ligia is the mother of 3 kids (17, 19, and 14 years old), and she lives in Mérida, Yucatán. She started out fixing her neighbors’ clothes in order to have an income, since she had to support her kids when she became a widow, and did not receive a pension from her husband’s job. Ligia learned the trade of making up clothes when she was very young, since that’s what her mother did for a living, and taught Ligia. It has not been easy to get ahead on her own with her kids, but she has done it thanks to her integrity and courage.

She is requesting support to be able to get supplies to make up clothes. She needs to invest US$150, which she plans to pay back in 3 months. You have the chance to help Ligia, don’t hesitate any longer. She and her kids need you and thank you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Ligia es madre de 3 hijos de 17, 19 y 14 años de edad y vive en la localidad de Mérida Yucatán. Ella empezó arreglando ropa de sus vecinos para poder tener ingresos, ya que ella tuvo que ocuparse del gasto de sus hijos porque ella enviudó y en el trabajó de sus esposo no la pensionaron. Ligia aprendió el oficio de la confección desde muy pequeña, pues su madre, quien se dedicaba a esto, la enseñó. No ha sido fácil salir adelante sola con sus hijos, pero lo ha logrado gracias a su entereza y fortaleza.

Ella pide apoyo para poder tener material para confección. Por lo cual necesita invertir por la cantidad de $ 150 DLLS, misma que planea regresar en un plazo de 3 meses. Tu tienes la posibilidad de ayudar a Ligia, no lo dudes más, ella y sus hijos te necesitan y te lo agradecen.

loans.use: PURCHASE EQUIPMENT

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Mama Alice sells cracked stones to construction firms through her business, Alice's Stone Quarry. She is a client of the Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH programme. She is seeking a loan of $850.00 from Kiva for working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying wholesale goods  for retail sale

loans.name: Sok-Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok-lim N. was married in 1979 and has 5 children. She has had a rice farming business since 1981. She also sells soft drinks from her home. She is the sole support for all of her children. Her son has a transportation service in the village. He uses his van to transport villagers who work in the factory.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice. Now she is asking for a loan from of $300 to repair her son's van.

loans.use: Repairing the van

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, apart from being the owner of a business, is also a homemaker, a devoted mother, and a dedicated wife. She and her husband have two children, whom they have tried to help get ahead in life. Both children are currently in primary school.

Six years ago, Concepción had to give up being solely a homemaker and start her business in the EL BISNE market in Chinandega.

She began with $30.00 of capital and sold small things. She decided to start her business due to the necessity of defraying expenses and covering the needs that her husband’s salary couldn’t. Concepción now grosses approximately $80.00 per day. Thanks to CEPRODEL, she has been able to expand her store and buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Concepción es además de propietaria de su negocio, ama de casa, madre incondicional y esposa dedicada. Tiene dos hijos fruto de su matrimonio a los que en conjunto con su esposo han tratado de sacar adelante. Ambos hijos están cursando educación primaria.

Hace seis años Concepción tuvo que abandonar la vida únicamente de ama de casa e iniciar su negocio en el mercado EL BISNE en Chinandega.

Comenzó con un capital de U$30.00 vendiendo pequeñas cositas, la idea de poner su negocio surge debido a la necesidad de sufragar gastos y cubrir necesidades que el salario devengado por su esposo no cubría. Hoy en día Concepción vende aproximadamente U$80.00 diarios, gracias a CEPRODEL ha podido ampliar la infraestructura de su local y comprar mas mercadería.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and udate her inventory

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
Twenty years ago she started with a griddle, 10kg. of barbacoa (slow-cooked beef meat), and all the enthusiasm in the world, to sell barbacoa to support her young daughter who is now 20 years old and other daughters who are still studying. After much hard work to get a place in her neighborhood, she started selling menudo to have more variety in her business.

However, the battle to support her two youngest daughters is still ongoing, and that is why she is requesting a loan for US $925 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy more merchandise to make more barbacoa and menudo and increase her sales. With your help, Maria will be able to support her daughters and give them the education that they need so much to become good people.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Hace 20 años comenzó con una parilla y 10kg de barbacoa y todas las ganas del mundo, a vender barbacoa para poder sacar adelante a su pequeña hija quien ahora ya tiene 20 años, y las otras mas chicas siguen estudiando. Después de seguir luchando por posicionarse en su colonia comenzó a vender menudo para tener más variedad en su negocio.

Sin embargo la lucha por sacar a sus dos pequeñas hijas adelante sigue en pie, y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar más mercancía para hacer más barbacoa y Menudo y así incrementar las ventas. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a sus hijas y les podrá dar estudio que tanto necesitan para ser unas personas de bien.

loans.use: Buying raw ingredients for her business. (Comprar materia prima para su negocio)

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: I am Nasreen B. from a city, Multan, in Pakistan. I am a mother of seven. My husband operates a furniture business. He has expertise at his work and a great aesthetic sense. He wishes to expand his business for which he requires a loan of $200.  He plans to produce high quality furniture and buy good timber. This way our income will be doubled.

loans.use: Buy wood for the business

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a young entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine. She has a small women’s shoe sales business at a very good location near the center of the large central market in Melitopol. Svetlana has been in business for about seven years. With the help and advice of relatives and loans from Nadiya Ukaine, her business has done well. In the future, Svetlana would like to expand her business by opening another sales location. Svetlana currently lives with her parents and is able to help them financially as well.

Svetlana has requested a loan of $400 to help purchase a new supply of spring shoe styles for her business. This loan will help increase her profits and help her be prepared for the upcoming change of seasons.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Muhofah North F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ruth M.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Ruth is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist. She has 5 children, all of whom go to school. Each week, Ruth makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest more.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Margret N., Harriet N., Sylvia T. and Betty M.. Margret N. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to expand to bulk selling. Harriet N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to add more stock. Sylvia T. operates a tailoring business and wants to purchase a sewing machine. Betty M. has a cosmetic's shop and intends to increase stock.

loans.use: To expand charcoal business

loans.name: Edita's Group

texts.en:
Edita U., N. Jeremia, Elizabeth N. and Victoria S. make up the AGAPE group. They are all residents of Tabata in the city of Dar Es Salaam.

For the past three years, Edita U. has run a stationery shop. She and her other group members are all requesting a loan to help them expand their business.

loans.use: Expand the stationery shop

loans.name: Delia Dalila

texts.en:
Delia Dalila V. F. has a business selling a variety of plastic goods. She lives in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region, but sells her products at different markets all over the La Libertad area. She started her business with the sales of plastic bowls and now has over 20 products to offer her many loyal clients.

Delia is 42 years old, happily married, and has 2 children. With the support of her husband, Delia works hard to make sure her children will have more opportunities in life than she had. One day, she would like to have her own store and send her children to a university.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Valerosas II, Delia is requesting a loan of 500 PEN ($200) to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her supply of best selling products.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her supply of best selling plastic products.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna A. is a 28-year-old businesswoman. She is single and independent. She is the owner and operator of a hardware shop and sells items like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates, cutlery sets, etc in the local market. Anna is an achiever, and her focus is to expand her business to make more income. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stocks of plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She is a member of the community group called Trust and Obey Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of plastic materials and kitchen sets

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
More than four years ago, Noemí's mother helped her open a shop selling electric devices in the Túpac Amaru market in Juliaca. Noemí began her business with very little merchandise, but with a talent for the business and help from her mother, she increased the size of her shop. Thanks to her earnings, Noemí can cover her university tuition. While this diligent girl works toward her goals, her beloved mother helps her by minding the store. Mother and daughter work together to increase their earnings through improvements to the store, but in order to realize these improvements they must first finance them. They are sure that your collaboration will help them realize their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace más de 4 años. Noemí con apoyo de su madre decidió dedicarse a la venta de artefactos dentro del mercado Túpac Amaru de la ciudad de Juliaca. Ella inició su negocio con poca mercadería pero con la predisposición y la importante colaboración de su querida madre logró ampliar e implementar su espacio de ventas.Gracias a los ingresos económicos que obtiene con este negocio, Noemí, puede cubrir los gastos que le demandan sus estudios superiores y mientras ésta diligente muchacha va en busca de sus objetivos su querida madre la apoya con la atención de su negocio y juntas tratan de mejorar sus ingresos económicos.Tiene muchos proyectos con su negocio y para concretarlos requiere de financiamiento, está segura que recibiendo vuestra colaboración cristalizará gran parte de sus anhelos.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve her supply of electrical goods.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
The F. family requests a loan of $525 in order to finish building up their house. They bought the land and started building one part of the house with their own savings. They will use their savings and Kiva’s loan to finish the construction.

The five members of the family (mother, father, and three children) are looking forward to living in a more spacious home. Their third son was born this year and they want to complete the finishes on their new house as soon as possible. Mr F. works as an operator at a boilers factory, and will use this income to pay back the Kiva loan. (He was not able to be present for the photograph because he was at work.)

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La familia F. esta solicitando un préstamo a Kiva de $525 para terminar la construcción de su casa. Ellos ya compraron un terreno ya construyeron la primera parte de la casa con sus propios ahorros. Van a disponer del préstamo de Kiva junto con sus propios ahorros para terminar los acabados de la casa. Su tercer hijo nació en este año y quieren cambiarse a su nueva casa lo más pronto posible. El Sr. F. trabaja como operario en una fabrica de elaboración de boilers.

loans.use: To finish building up their house

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is single. She lives with her parents in Melitopol. Yelena runs a small business selling women's outerwear in the central marketplace. She has had this small business for six years. It has now become the main source of income for her family. 

Yelena is a cheerful, hard worker despite the difficulties she faces. She has repaid all loans from Nadiya Ukraine, and these have helped create stability for her business. Currently, Yelena has about $1,600 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to $600. Yelena is requesting a loan for 4000 Grivnas to resupply her inventory before the school season. In pursuit of her goal, Yelena plans to invest her extra profits into the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To resupply inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of lumber and purchase equipment

loans.name: Aura De Jesús

texts.es: Inició su negocio con su esposo elaborando calzado de niños y damas, comercializando en la zona norte del país, donde actualmente descubrió nuevo mercado con la elaboración de botas vaqueras, las que vende por docenas a las tiendas de calzado, los que al día de hoy son clientes fijos,  los fines de semana  doña Aura se dedica  a la venta de comida en su casa de habitación y en los juegos de baseball, este es otro ingreso extra que ellos perciben. Tiene 2 hijos, la mayor estudia en la universidad y el menor en escuela de secundaria, con mucho esfuerzo ellos han logrado tener su casa propia; y el taller lo tiene en la parte delantera de la casa, su mayor propósito es tener un tramo propio en el mercado de Masaya para ser vendedores directos de sus calzados.
texts.en:
She started her business with her husband making footwear for children and women which is then sold in the northern zone of the country. Recently, she found a new market for the making of cowboy boots which she sells by the dozen to shoe stores that, today, are established clients of hers. On the weekends, Doña Aura sells food in her home and at baseball games. This is other extra income that they receive. She has two children, the oldest is studying at the university and the youngest is in high school. With much effort, they have succeeded in having their own home and the shop is located in the back part of the house. Her main goal is to have a section in the Masaya market so they can be direct sellers of their footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 64 años, es divorciada, actualmente vive con una D. sus hijas, quien la acompaña. Hace 12 años se divorció, desD. ese momento empezó a trabajar en chacras D. diferentes personas, pero hace 7 años, con el apoyo D. su hija, decidieron a sembrar frutos cítricos en su propio terreno. Y 10 años atrás, instaló una pequeña bodega, también con el apoyo D. su hija, porque Lucia  es analfabeta, es por ello que cuando no está su hija, tiene que pedir favor a la gente para que le saque la cuenta, ahora gracias al programa D. alfabetización del gobierno, ya pueD. firmar. Lo que más le agrada, es el contacto constante con la gente, es por ello que en su bodega está muy contenta, aun el no saber sumar, no es dificultad para su crecimiento. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero piensa incrementar la mercadería D. su bodega, además D. adicionar a su negocio la venta D. utensilios para el hogar.
texts.en:
Lucia is 64 years old, divorced and currently lives with one of her daughters. She divorced 12 years ago and at that moment started to work on different people's farms. But seven years ago, with the support of her daughter, she decided to grow citric fruits on her own land. And 10 years ago she opened a small store, also with her daughter's help, because Lucia is illiterate. For that reason, when her daughter is not around, she has to ask other people to help her with the accounting. Now, thanks to the government's illiteracy program, she can sign her name. What she enjoys the most is the constant contact with people and it's for that reason that she is very happy in her store. She still doesn't know how to add but it's not a hindrance for her growth. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan from MFP. With the money she plans to increase the amount of merchandise in her store in addition to adding the sale of utensils for the home to her offering.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of merchandise offered in a general store

loans.name: Akouvi Apeafan

texts.fr:
Madame V. Akouvi Apeafan est née le 26 décembre 1985 à Lomé, le capital du Togo. Cette jeune fille est célibataire et elle n’a pas d’enfant.  Elle a pour activité la vente de chaussures et bijoux qu’elle achète à la grande marche de Lomé et qu’elle revend à la marche d’Agoè, un quartier au nord de la ville.  
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES et a bien remboursé.
Ce deuxième crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 25 pairs de chaussures et 20 chaines complets. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouvi Apeafan V. was born on December 26, 1985 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. This young woman is still single and has no children. Her business is selling shoes and costume jewelry that she buys in the big open-air market in Lomé and re-sells in the market in Agoè, a neighborhood north of the city.

She has already had one loan from WAGES and she reimbursed it correctly. This second loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 25 pairs of shoes and 20 necklaces. With this new stock she will be able to make more sales and make a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes and costume jewelry

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama G., 52 ans, mariée, 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Peyrissac depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter  du poisson séché et des légumes pour renforcer son  petit commerce. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariama G., age 52, is married and has five children to look after. She has been a member of the village association of Boucotte Peyrissac for six years. She wants to buy dried fish and some vegetables to boost her modest business. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables and dried fish

loans.name: Guaracal Group

texts.es: Las  socias quienes conforman el grupo "Guaracal" son personas que se conocen ya que residen en el mismos barrio, están representados por la señora Marcela, todos ellos comprometidos en sus pagos y para con los integrantes del grupo. Este grupo se encuentra cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando honradez y responsabiliza con sus pagos, por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios. En general los socios se dedican a actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos como ser: venta D. ropa, cosmético, comida, arrotes en tiendas D. barrios, frutas, servicio D. transporte y servicio D. cocina. Como en todo rubro D. comercio siempre existe la demanda D. productos pero los socios cuentan con experiencia para enfrentar cualquier adversidad y sacar a flote su pequeño negocio ya que representa el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. insumos y materiales D. mejor calidad para proporcionar a sus productos un mejor acabado y una mejor calidad.
texts.en:
The members of the “Guaracal” group are people who know each other given that they resiD. in the same neighborhood. They are represented by Marcela, are all committed to making their payments, and are also committed to each other as members of the group. This group is in its second cycle, demonstrating honesty and responsibility with their payments given that they rely on their experience in solidarity groups. In general the members dedicate themselves to the sale of products such as: sale of clothing, make-up, food, groceries in neighborhood stores, fruit, transportation services, and kitchen services. Like in any industry there always exists the demand for products but the members rely on experience to confront any adversity and to keep afloat their small businesses given that they represent the means of supporting their families. The loan will be used to purchase supplies and higher quality materials to proviD. their products a better finish and a better quality.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and higher quality materials.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37ans et 5 enfants. Excepté deux qui n’ont pas de coépouses, elles vivent toutes dans les  familles traditionnelles polygames  à TDJILA chef lieu de commune dans la commune de WATENI situé dans la sous préfecture de NIENA de la 3ème région administrative du Mali.
 Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat – vente de céréales, de soumala, de canaris et  la restauration.
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle ; elles sont à leur premier prêt (prêt solidaire) 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 10sacs de 100kg de céréales, 60 canaris, 150 kilogrammes de grains de Néré pour le soumbala et des condiments alimentaires pour la restauration. Elles s’approvisionnement  au marché de NIENA, de BOUGOULABA et de TDJILA. Les marchandises sont vendues marché de NIENA, de BOUGOULABA, de TDJILA et BAMAKO (soumbala); en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 7.625 FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Benkadi group are all married and are on average 37 years old with 5 children. Except for two who do not have co-wives, they all live in traditional polygamous families in Tdjila, the administrative centre in the commune of Wateni, situated in the sub-prefecture of Niena in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They run various businesses, which include, among others, food preparation and the purchase and resale of cereals, soumbala (a type of condiment made from fermented néré seeds), and clay jars. They work together with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers; they are seeking their first group loan. With this loan, they intend to buy ten 100-kg bags of cereals, 60 jars, 150 kilograms of néré seeds to make soumbala, and other condiments for food preparation. They supply themselves at the markets in Niena, Bougoulaba, and Tdjila. Their goods are sold at the markets in Niena, Bougoulaba, Tdjila, and Bamako (the soumbala), at retail in cash to a clientele composed of men and women. They each foresee generating an average monthly profit of 7,625 FCFA, of which one portion will be used for their families' needs and the rest invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell cereals, soumbala (a West African condiment), clay jars, and other condiments

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Claudia es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Claudia junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal, para la cual cuenta con un horno artesanal, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de peones. Además Claudia tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda.
Claudia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, arroz y fideo.
Los sueños de Claudia son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, aumentar con mas productos su negocio y tener otro horno.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Community Bank “Los Ladrilleros de Compañía” (the brick-makers of Compañía). She lives in the town of Compañía, located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Claudia is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. Together with her husband, she earns a living by making artisan bricks, which she makes with an artisan oven and the help of day laborers. She also has a small grocery store in her home. Claudia needs a loan of 1500 soles that she will use to purchase firewood, rice and noodles. Her dreams are to give her children a good education, increase the merchandise in her store, and to have another oven [to make bricks].

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Firewood, rice, noodles

loans.name: Hilola

texts.ru: Хилола кредитуется на КИВА во второй раз. Ее бизнес заметно расширился и ассортимент товаров увеличен. Хилола ответственный и пунктуальный бизнесмен, показала себя с хорошей стороны. Хилола планирует увеличить ассортимент детской одежды, она знает какой товар сейчас наиболее востребован на рынке. Для реализации своих планов она просит займ на КИВА.
texts.en:
Hilola is taking out a loan at Kiva for the second time. Her business has noticeably expanded and assortment of goods has increased. Hilola is a responsible and punctual businesswoman and has shown at her best. Hilola plans to increase the assortment of children's clothing. She knows which merchandise is most in demand on the market right now. To realize her plans she is asking for a loan from Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spring assortment of clothing

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo, quien es policía, y ambos son padres de una hija de 8 años, que cursa estudios primarios, la casa que habitan es propia. Ella es propietaria de cinco motocarros, los mismos que son manejados por chóferes particulares que contrata para realizar transporte de pasajeros (taxi). Estos vehículos los tiene hace 4 años, los mismos que trabajan de lunes a sábado en un horario de 5 de la mañana hasta 9 de la noche. Dina es la encargada de administrar las ganancias de sus motocarros, verificar su estado y llevarlos a hacerles mantenimiento o reparar si tienen algunas fallas. Dina está muy contenta, porque hasta el momento este negocio le está resultando muy rentable. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y todavía no sabe como es el trabajo en su banco comunal, pero ya ha notado que son personas unidas y muy comunicativas. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un garaje seguro, ya que sus motocarros, en la actualidad, se guardan en un espacio fuera de su casa, a la intemperie corriendo el riesgo de robo.
texts.en:
Dina is 41 years old and lives with her husband who is a policeman. Both are parents of an 8-year-old daughter who is in primary school. They own the house where they live. She is the owner of five three-wheeled light vans with private drivers she hires to transport passengers (taxi). She has had these vehicles for 4 years and they run from Monday thru Saturday from 5 in the morning until 9 at night. Dina is in charge of administering the profits from her vehicles, verifying their condition and taking them for maintenance work or repairs if they have any problems. Dina is very happy because this business has been very profitable up to now. It is the first time she has had a loan with MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma). She doesn’t know how the community bank works yet, but she has already noticed that the people are united and very communicative. She will have a safe garage built with the money she applied for since she currently keeps her vehicles in a space outside her home, unprotected and running the risk of theft.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a garage for her vehicles

loans.name: Tes

texts.en: Tes T., 46, is married and resides with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. To earn a living, she sells mangoes and typically makes US$4 of profit per day. Her husband is a taxi driver and earns US$3 per day. Mrs. Tes T. would like to take out a loan to purchase mangoes from growers to sell at the market.

loans.use: Buy mangoes to sell

loans.name: Jannett

texts.es:
Jannett es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Jannett es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres, Jannett junto a su hermano tienen una cerrajería que esta en su casa, la producción es de acuerdo a pedidos de sus clientes, Yaneth se encarga de la administración del negocio.
Jannett necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros.
Los sueños de Jannett son ampliar su negocio y comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Jannett is a member of the community bank of Tulipanes. She is 21, unmarried, and lives with her parents. She runs a locksmith shop with her brother out of their house, and their production is in accordance with the wishes of their clients. Yaneth is in charge of the administrative side of the business. Jannett needs a loan of 1050 soles which she will invest in the purchase of iron. Her dreams are to expand the business and buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of iron

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
V. Trần Thị (244970692) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, V. owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. V. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. V. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 12th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business

loans.use: used to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es: Don Rolando Antonio E. tiene la edad de 53 años, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, ella ayuda en la panadería en el cual llevan diez años trabajando para sobresalir adelante, el inicio estos prestamos con prestamos que Afodenic otorgo este es su noveno crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar. Levadura, manteca y otros productos para elaborar el pan que día, a día hacen para vender a los diferentes barrios de la capital. Sus planes es poder contratar dos panaderos para que eleven la producción y venta del pan, a si como comprar otra camioneta para hacer fácil el traslado.
texts.en:
Don Rolando Antonio E. is 53 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in Managua, capital city of Nicaragua. He and his wife have two children who are students. His wife helps him in the bakery where they have been working for 10 years, trying to get ahead financially. Don Rolando began accepting loans granted through Kiva partner Afodenic. This is his ninth loan, which will be invested in the purchase of flour, sugar, yeast, butter and other products used to make bread to be sold daily in different neighborhoods in the city. His plans are to be able to hire two bakers to increase the production and sales of bread. He also wants to buy another truck to facilitate transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, yeast and other products for making bread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase a larger amount of used clothes to sell in her neighborhood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more material such as vitenge and kanga

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
La señora Fabiana es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 53 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 01 hijo, estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Asunción Jr. Asunción 419.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió comprando golosinas. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de galletas, dulces, yogures, chisitios, gaseosas, etc., para venderlo en su tienda.

Su deseo es mejorar y surtir mejor su tienda.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los pagos.

loans.use: Para la compra de galletas, dulces, yogures, chisitios, gaseosas, etc.,

loans.name: Juan Ventura

texts.es: El Señor Juan Ventura C. Sapón cuenta con 54 años de edad casado se dedica al comercio desde hace diez años a esta actividad vende en  diferentes partes de la ciudad por lo que sus números de clientes cada día va en aumento también la demanda de sus clientes son muy buenas por lo que acudió a la Asociación Asdir con el objetivo de adquirir un préstamo ayudando así a su negocio generando mas empleo a las personas que le entregan su mercadería como también un buen crecimiento de capital de trabajo así poder cubrir aun mas puntos de la ciudad  para el crecimiento y la variedad de su mercadería obteniendo  mejores ingresos mensuales y mercadería innovadora.

loans.use: Comercio (ampliacion de capital)

loans.name: Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Creciendo Juntas” esta representada por la señora Ana Maria y conformada por 13 miembros bastante responsables y dinámicas siempre puntuales en sus pagos la mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedican a la venta D. comida Nexus propios restoranes o puestos ambulantes, el resto D. los miembros se dedica a la elaboración D. pan y a la venta D. cosméticos por catálogos. La competencia dentro D. su rubro es alta pero las socias del grupo ya trabajan años y cuentan con clientela fiel y experiencia en el negocio por lo que no le preocupa mucho la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y materiales que ayuden a generar mayor rentabilidad para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando un ciclo mas dentro D. la institución demostrando siempre puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos ya que D. ello depenD. no solo el pago D. su obligación si no también el sustento y futuro D. toda su familia.
texts.en:
The "Creciendo Juntas" (Growing Together) Communal Bank is represented by Ana Maria and composed of 13 very responsible and dynamic members who are always on time with their payments. The majority of the group members sell food, either in their own restaurants or from traveling carts. The rest of the members make bread and sell cosmetics from catalogs. The members are highly competent in their trades and have worked for years, gaining loyal clientele and business experience, so their capability is not in question. The purpose of the financing is the acquisition of merchandise, supplies and materials that will help to improve profitability and proviD. a better quality of life for their families. As for credit history, the members are completing another cycle within the institution and consistently demonstrate punctuality and responsibility with their payments, since not only the fulfillment of their obligation but also the support and future of their families depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: La señora Alaba Luz  C.  de 39 años de edad, se dedica a la venta ropa y venta de fritanga desde hace 14 años el cual ha logrado mantenerlo muchas veces con ventas bajas, y se vende bastante por la temporada, reside en Villa Reconciliación junto a su esposo e hijos procreo cuatro  dos trabajan y dos estudian, su esposo es mecánico muy trabajador y buen padre, el cual la apoyado no solo en la educación si no hacer una mujer independiente, el cual he apoyado a mis hijos para que logren sus sueños de un futuro mejor. Desde horas tempranas se levanta para preparar los alimentos para la venta ya que en horas de la mañana es el movimiento de los desayunos y por las tardes esta descansa ya que es cansado al preparar los alimentos. Con este préstamo comprara alimentos para vender su rica fritanga a si como comprar zapatos y poder atrae clientes nuevos con nuevos productos es su noveno ciclo el cual agradece por el apoyo con los financiamientos que por la tasa baja de los intereses y los plazo ha logrado crecer.
texts.en:
Alba is 39 years old and for 14 years she has sold clothing and food cooked over a grill. This has maintained her, though sales have sometimes been low and seasonal. She lives in Villa Reconciliación with her husband and 4 children, 2 of whom work while 2 are students. Her husband is a hard working mechanic and a very good father. He has helped her, not only educationally but to become an independent woman, which has helped her children to achieve their dreams of a better future.

From the early hours of the morning Alba is up preparing food to sell, since breakfast is her main product. In the afternoon, she rests, weary from the labors of preparing meals all morning.

With this loan she will buy food to sell from her tasty grill and to buy shoes, in order to attract new customers with new products. This is her 9th loan cycle and she is grateful for the financial help. The low interest rate and longer repayment periods have enabled her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MEAT, VEGETABLES, BASIC GRAINS, AND SHOES TO SELL

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia ELIZABETH, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos dos varones y una mujer. Ella por las mañanas trabaja como profesora del nivel secundaria en el colegio “Comercio 41” del Cusco y por las tardes ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de castaña que le traen de la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado (Madre de Dios, Perú). La hija estudia la carrera profesional de Medicina Humana en la Universidad Nacional del país de Bolivia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de castaña y la educación de su hija.        .
  
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the Amauta communal bank. She is from the city of Cusco. She is 52, married, and she has three children. She has two boys and a girl. In the mornings she works as a teacher at the Comercio 41 High School in Cusco. In the afternoons she alternates her activities between the home and her business of selling chestnuts, which she gets from the city of Puerto Maldonado (Mardre de Dios, Perú). Her daughter is studying for a professional career in medicine at the National University in Bolivia. Elizabeth needs a loan to increase her chestnut sales and for her daughter’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chestnuts and pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Edzon

texts.es:
Edzon es un joven soltero de 26 años, actualmente vive en una casa alquilada.
Su lugar de origen es una comunidad nativa donde no hay exceso al transporte, por ello en busca de un porvenir diferente, hace aproximadamente 2 años llegó al pueblo en crecimiento donde ahora vive, donde fue acogido brindándole un trabajo. Edzon ya se acostumbró a este lugar y ahora quiere sembrar sus propios cultivos de café y plátanos en chacras alquiladas. Él está muy convencido de que le irá bien, ya que en todo este tiempo de jornalero ha ganado la experiencia y destreza para el buen cuidado y desarrollo de estos cultivos, pues estos trabajos no le parecen nada pesados, manifiesta; culminado con su frase: “es cuestión de maña”. 
Los anhelos de Edzon son de comprarse sus propias chacras en este lugar y por ello trabajará duramente.

Este su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que está muy contento con la oportunidad de crédito, ya que para él “es una bendición”, pues ahora podrá sembrar. Con el dinero solicitado alquilará un terreno y comprará plantitas de plátanos para iniciarse con ese cultivo.
texts.en:
Edzon is a single young man who is 26 years of age. He currently lives in a rented house. Since his native community had limited access to transportation, he decided to leave in search of a different life. It has been two years since he arrived in the village that provided him a job and he now calls home. Edzon has grown accustomed to the place and now wants to rent a piece of land to begin growing his own coffee and banana crops. He is convinced that he will do well in this endeavor because of the time he spent as a field laborer. Through this job, he acquired experience in developing and caring for these types of crops. Edzon does not find the work difficult and says, “It is a matter of skill.” He hopes to continue working hard and eventually buy his own farm.

This is his first loan with MFP. Edzon is pleased to have this opportunity and says “it is a blessing” because the planting season has started. The money requested will be used to pay the rent on his farmland and buy banana seedlings to start his first crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase banana seedlings & pay the rent on a piece of farmland

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda A. is from the village of Binuanagan, in Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old.  Benilda is married and has 1 adult children. To make a living, Benilda owns & operates a sari-sari (general) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling food & essentials in the local community. Benilda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Benilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Benilda is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Benilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Neyaz Mohammad

texts.en:
The man in the picture is Neyaz M., the son of G. M.. He lives in district 8th of Kabul Afghanistan. He is 50, married, and has six children. As in Afghanistan, it is wintertime and the weather is getting colder. All the people prepare for this season. 

Neyaz M., who lives in a small house having three rooms and a kitchen, wants to repair most of his house. During the rain and snow in winter, he and his family members face lots of problems. So, he came to AFS and requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to buy the required construction materials to start the repairs to his house. 

Neyaz M. is glad that these kinds of processes exist in Afghanistan for the support of those who are in need of money. He would like to thank the Kiva lenders so much.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Paulette Isabelle

texts.fr: Paulette Isabelle C. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle tient un étal au marché ou elle commercialise divers produits alimentaires. Son objectif est de participer à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Paulette Isabelle C. is 42 years old, married and mother of two children. She runs a stall in the market where she sells various food products. Her objective is to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail of various food products

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: A. Julienne réside depuis environs 40 ans au quartier Sainte Cécile à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Julienne est mariée à DJOTCHOU Nounangnon, un pêcheur, et est mère de six enfants. Seulement quatre des enfants restent encore à la charge du couple. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. N'ayant jamais été à l'école, pour assurer ses différentes charges, Julienne vend du poisson frit et de l'akassa (aliment local préparé à base d'amidon de maïs) dans son quartier à Sainte Cécile. De façon secondaire, Julienne vend également des crabes, ce qui lui permet d'avoir une autre source de revenu. Julienne s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de l'institution, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. La clientèle de Julienne s'accroît au jour le jour ; mais Julienne n'arrive plus à satisfaire toute la demande, compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose. Julienne sollicite à cet effet, un quatrième crédit afin de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
A. Julienne has lived for about forty years in the Sainte Cécile neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Julienne is married to DJOTCHOU Nounangnon, a fisherman, and is the mother of six children. Only four children are still supported by the couple. Some of the children are in school. The couple supports the family together. Never having been to school, in order to pay various expenses, Julienne sells fried fish and akassa (local food prepared from cornstarch) in her neighborhood in Sainte Cécile. Secondarily, Julienne also sells crabs, which allows her to have another source of income. Julienne gets her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. She is already an ALIDé client, having previously received three loans from the institution, loans which she has fully repaid. Julienne's clientele grows from day to day, but Julienne is not able to satisfy all the demand, given her limited financial means. For this reason Julienne is seeking a fourth loan in order to build up her business and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and fresh fish

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet P. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old, is married and has four school-aged children. Juliet owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene I. is 33 years old. He owns 1½ hectares of rice fields, where he closely monitors the growth of his rice plants. Aside from rice, he also raises chickens. The income really helps him to be able to afford the basic needs for his home.

He would like to apply a loan of PHP 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow his harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Tamaraneh Ii Group

texts.en:
Saffie J. is the leader of this group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Saffie and her colleague are seeking a loan of SLL 2,600,000 from Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they can expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their standard of living. The 41-year-old Saffie sells market-food – Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, sugar, etc. She has been in this business for many years now. 

Saffie is married with five children. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy Maggi cubes, salt, sugar, etc. to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Pampahasi 2 Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal PAMPAHASI 2 está conformado por 9 clientes, todas mujeres, que están ubicados por los alrededores D. la oficina Emprender y por Alto Pampahasi subiendo por SAMAPA,. se dedican a la venta D. comida, venta D. verduras, cosméticos, elaboración y venta D. salteñas ventas en abarrotes y otros, pese a tener actividades muy distintas se conocen muy bien entre sí asistieron a todas las charlas y escucharon con atención porque la mayoría ingreso por primera vez a un banco comunal.

La Sra. Nely Representa a su banco en  el cargo D. Presidenta del banco se dedica a la confecccion D. todo tipo D. ropa, segun pedido D. los clientes, cuenta con esta actividad hace 10 años, el préstamo será destinado a la compra D. insumos (tela por rollo, esponja, algodón, store). Vive en la zona Escobar Uría con sus familiares, no tiene esposo pero tiene una hija producto D. una relación espontánea.
Ha sido elegida por su gran capacidad D. manejo D. personas y D. conocer a todas sus compañeras, responsable y dinámica desD. el inicio en las capacitaciones brindando su apoyo a todas sus compañeras coordinando en la conformación del banco 

La Sra. Eliza,  Socia que asume el cargo D. Tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta D. comida y refrescos  a pedidos para las instituciones públicas y privadas se dedica a esta actividad hace 5 años en su propio domicilio el préstamo esta destinado a la compra D. víveres por mayor  para sus pedidos. 

La Sra. July, Ha sido elegido como Secretaria, por su desenvolvimiento en la redacción, dinámica para la redacción y coordinación, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos por mayor también realiza viajes a Cochabamba y a Santa cruz el préstamo esta destinado para la compra D. productos D. belleza que se encuentran en promosion, tiene dos hijos menores D. 12 años y ella sola mantiene el hogar.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Pampahasi 2 Communal Bank is maD. up of nine customers, all women, who live near the Emprender office in Alto Pampahasi just past the SAMAPA water company. They work in food sales, vegetable sales, cosmetics, preparation and sale of salteñas (Bolivian empanadas), grocery sales and other businesses. Despite their very different business activities, the members know each other very well. They attended all the training talks and listened attentively because the majority of them were becoming members of a communal bank for the first time. Nely is the president of the bank. She works making all types of clothes to fill customers' orders. She has been doing this for ten years. The loan will be used to purchase supplies (rolls of fabric, sponges, cotton, etc.). She lives in the Escobar Uría zone with her relatives. She is not married but has a daughter from a previous relationship. She has been chosen as president for her great ability to manage people and her knowledge and understanding of her companions. She has been responsible and dynamic since the beginning, lending her support to all her companions during the formation of the bank. Eliza, the treasurer of the bank, sells food and drinks on order to public and private institutions. She has been doing this for five years in her own home. The loan will be used to buy foods wholesale for her orders. July has been chosen as secretary because of her writing ability. She sells cosmetics wholesale and also makes trips to Cochabamba and Santa Cruz. The loan will be used to purchase beauty products on sale. She has two children under the age of 12, and she supports the family alone. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in them with the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia Soledad; pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR JUSTO JUEZ”, Nuestra socia es vive en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia del Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 57 años de edad ella es casada, tiene 3 hijos, 30, 27, 21 años de edad  Nuestra socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes pero desde hace unos meses atrás decidió dedicarse paralelamente a esto a vender zapatos por catálogo, la socia tiene unas 3 revistas que las ofrece a todas las entidades y deja los zapatos para que se le pague en dos partes, la primera que es la mitad del costo se paga al entregar los zapatos que pidieron y la segunda exactamente al mes siguiente, vende carteras y todo tipo de zapatos y zapatillas, A nuestra socia le gustaría poner en un futuro cercano su propia tienda de zapatos, ella es una persona muy carismática y muy optimista, nos comenta que ella hace el pago total del producto por anticipado, pero a fin de que sus clientes le compren ella les deja a dos partidas de pago. Nuestra socia desea el préstamo para pagar el pedido que está haciendo a Lima.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de la deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the Señor Justo Juez village bank. She lives in the district of Huanchac, in the department of Cusco. Soledad is 57 years old. She is married and has 3 children, 30, 27, and 21 years old. She has a grocery store but a few months ago decided to also sell shoes by catalog. She offers three catalogs and allows people to pay her in two payments. She collects the first half when she delivers the shoes and the second the following month. She sells handbags and all kinds of shoes and sneakers. In the future, she would like to set up her own shoe store. She is a very charismatic, optimistic person. She tells us that she pays for all her merchandise in advance, but that to encourage her clients to purchase from her, she allows them to make two payments instead of one. She would like to have this loan to pay for the orders she making from Lima. Soledad is very grateful for the loan and is committed to paying off her debt in full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for merchandise orders

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy R. is 44 years old and is married to Eddie R.. The couple has two children, both of whom are college students. She and her husband have worked hard but they had a very small income, and they didn't have enough capital to start up a business. 

In 1997, Nancy heard about the Kiva field partner, ASHI, and began dreaming of having a stable life, a stable home and of starting a business. When she received her first and succeeding loans from ASHI, Nancy started her own business of selling fish in the local community. She has had this business for many years. Fish selling has been a great help to her family. As a busy entrepreneur, Nancy also embarked on a tricycle transport business (motorcycle with sidecar). Her husband, Eddie, manages this business.

However, the demands of her family grow as years go by. She wants to have more businesses that can add to her present income so she will have bigger profits and savings. She had the idea of operating a sari-sari (variety) store. It has been great! Nancy is earning a good income and she wants to make a larger investment in it. On her 11th loan, she is proposing a new loan amounting 45,000 PHP to expand her growing variety store business.

With this kind of business, Nancy can still manage her previous business of fish selling, because either her children or her husband can operate their sari-sari (variety) store at home when she's away selling fish. Someday, as her income increases, she dreams of funding her children’s education until they complete college degrees and have professional jobs. Her greatest dreams are to get out from the downward spiral of poverty and to have a happy life.

loans.use: To expand her variety store by purchasing more groceries.

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Me Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey M. is the village bank president of a group loan consisting of ten people who live in Peam Reang Leu village in Kandal province. She was selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Morn Bork, are farmers who own 3.5-hectares of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. Their problem is that their corn field is ready to be planted but they do not have enough money to get it done. So to improve production, Mrs. Srey M. is applying for a loan to hire farm laborers. Mrs. Srey M. is the mother of five children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To hire farm laborers to grow corn

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings who are still too young to start helping with the family expenses. He and his father collaborate to provide for the family. In 2006, he opened his own car repair shop specialized in selling and repairing vehicle’s body. He has been involved in this occupation for the past 10 years, having begun to work at a very young age.
He is now requesting for a $1,200 loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l to purchase used car parts in order to expand his business in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase used car parts

loans.name: Gabriel Moises

texts.pt:
Gabriel Moisés M. nasceu no Distrito de Homoine, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 2 e 3 anos de idade, ainda não vão a escola. Fez nível médio não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa de aluguer com a sua família e sustenta a sobrinha que vive com ele e seus pais enviando dinheiro para despesas domesticas. 
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo afim de continuar com estudos, mais conseguiu um emprego nos serviços Distritais de Educação e Tecnologia de Boane. Trabalha ha mais de 4 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 5.586.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, ferro e outos) para aplicar na construção da sua casa. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para continuar com a construção da sua casa e sair na casa de aluguer.
texts.en:
Gabriel Moisés M. was born in the District of Homoine, Province of Inhambane, southern Mozambique, a married father of two children of 2 and 3 years old, who are not attending school, yet. He finished middle school but did not continue due to lack of financial resources. He lives in a rented house with his family and supports a niece who lives with him and his parents sending them money for household expenses. He left Inhambane to live in Maputo in order to continue with his education, but he got a job in the District Services of Education and Technology in Boane. He’s worked there for over four years and has no employees. He earns 5,586.00mt a month, which he uses for household expenses, and he even saves some money in his bank account. He never requested for any loans in other banks. He came to Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is his first loan for 20.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase construction material (concrete, stone, sand, iron and others) to apply in the construction of his home. He is committed to repay this loan in time in order to access to others. In the future he plans to request for additional loans to continue with the construction of his home and to leave the house rental.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material (concrete, stone, sand, iron and others)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is 18 and is single with no children. She is starting a business venture selling baked goods in the local community. Victoria needs a loan of WST 1,000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or approximately USD 136 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Victoria joined SPBD and this is her first loan with them. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Inmar

texts.en: Inmar is a 31-year-old man from Lebanon. He has been the owner of an amusement center since 2008, with 8 years of experience in this field of work. This is Inmar’s fourth time to request a loan from Al Majmoua, and he has a perfect loan repayment schedule. This time Inmar is requesting a loan in order to add new equipment to his business and do the necessary maintenance to the other machines. His clients are his neighbors, teenagers and foreigners. He started his business with the money he borrowed from a friend, and from his work he was capable of paying back the money to his friend and add extra equipment to his business.

loans.use: To add new equipment to his business and do the necessary maintenance to the other game machines

loans.name: Ddembe Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en: Fifty-four-year-old Robinah N. always takes stock of her business dealings at the end of every operating day. This, the married mother of six says, has helped her give a good account of not only her business, but herself, too. Five years of operating a food sales business at a stall in Buikwe market-Lugazi has kept her well grounded. Prior to running this business, she was a housewife. Much encouragement from a friend helped her take root. In a week, she makes profits that total up to 320,000 shillings. With this loan, she wants to purchase more maize flour, rice, cassava, potatoes and beans for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more food for resale

loans.name: Maria Narciza De Jesus

texts.es:
