María de 52 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes),  vive en una zona periurbana rodeada de un estero salado. 

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares ella comenzó a vender productos de uso personal y cosméticos, aunque no tenia experiencia decidió comenzar por el bienestar de su familia, vendiendo por catalogo. Desde que comenzó a incrementado su clientela y trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener mas variedad en sus productos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cosméticos y perfumes para tener mas ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener una papelería.
texts.en:
María, 52, sells Yambal brand products (a company that offers enterprising women the opportunity to be independent salespersons). She lives in a periurban area surrounded by a salty estuary. To help meet household expenses she started selling personal use items and cosmetics. Despite having no experience she decided to go ahead with catalogue sales for her family’s wellbeing. Since she started she has increased her customer base and works from 7am until 8pm every day. In order to stock a wider variety of products to increase her income she wants to use the loan to buy cosmetics and perfumes. In the future, she’d like to have a stationery shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio T. J.. is from the village of Sandiat West. He is 31 years old, married and has 1 infant. Antonio owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Antonio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida B. lives in the town of Banga. She is 55 years old and has a 16-year-old child. She has made a living as a rice farmer for many years, and works hard because she wants to give her child a bright future. 

Leonida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy additional seeds and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long K. is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. She earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Long K. grows different kinds of crops, such as cabbages and cucumbers, which she harvests when they are ripe. Recently, her crop did not grow well because it was ravaged by insects. Because of that obstacle, she is seeking a loan to use for purchasing fertilizers to protect her crop.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to protect her crop

loans.name: Safokhudja

texts.en:
Safokhudja is married with two children. He owns an auto accessories store in his hometown. His little vending place is located right in the center of Isfara, which makes it a popular stop for car owners. He sells tires, acoustic systems, and car parts. Safokhudja started this business 13 years ago. Safokhudja is hoping to invest this loan of $2,000 USD in the purchase of more goods to sell. He believes a diversified assortment of merchandise will help meet clients’ demands. Safokhudja has proved to be a responsible borrower, having a repaid previous loan without any late payments. One of his long-term plans is to start a second venture and open a grocery store some day. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for cars in order to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Meam's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people located in Thmei village, Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Meam L., 58-years-old, as the group leader. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purpose.
 
Mrs. Meam L. works as an assistant at the commune where she can receive a little salary to support her family. With her job, she needs a computer, but she does not have enough money to buy it. So, she would like getting a loan to buy a computer to support her job activities.  Her husband, Mr. Long Siphann, stays at home. This couple has two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and another is employed in the casino club.

loans.use: To buy a computer to support her job activities.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 49 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eloy de 49 años y sus 2 hijos menores William de 19 y Janeth de 13 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En la ciudad de San Francisco, si uno desea comprar unos zapatos o sandalias muy bonitos y a la moda, tiene que visitar la tienda de María, sus novedosos modelos traídos por ella misma desde la ciudad de Lima, marcan una gran diferencia con la mercadería de la competencia, lo cual ha hecho que su negocio sea muy concurrido por los clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los zapatos o sandalias que mejor les quedan, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda en espera de clientes. Con el tiempo, desea poner otro negocio, esta vez incursionaría en la comida, ya que ha visto que es una buena fuente de ingresos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más zapatos y sandalias de la ciudad de Lima, para mejorar el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old.  She is a very happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband, 49 year-old Eloy, and her two dependent children, William who is 19 and Janeth who is 13, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.  In the town of San Francisco, if you want to buy some very nice, fashionable shoes or sandals, you have to visit María's store.  She brings her new styles from the city of Lima herself.  They are very different from the merchandise provided by the competition which has made her business very popular with her customers.

What María most likes about her work is advising her customers on which shoes or sandals suit them best.  She has been in this business for 7 years and she considers the most difficult aspect of her work to be having to stay in her store all day waiting for customers.  Over time, she would like to set up another business.  She would like to break into the food business as she has seen that it is a good source of income.

This is María's fifth loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual with her repayments and she hopes to continue to be.  In her community bank she is very well liked by the rest of the members.  She would like to use her loan for 2,000 nuevos soles to buy more shoes and sandals in the city of Lima to improve her store's stock.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and sandals to stock her business

loans.name: Iván

texts.es:
Iván tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene carga familiar, reside en casa de sus familiares, ubicada en el sector 9 de Octubre, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El reside en el lugar desde hace  3 años y durante este tiempo ha logrado instalar un pequeño taller, en donde suele confeccionar mochilas. El estudió confección y luego trabajó en Lima para una empresa especializada en el rubro, con el tiempo decidió independizarse y abrir su propia empresa, actualmente su  negocio viene desarrollándose favorablemente. 

Iván desea ampliar su producción adquiriendo  materiales (como cierres, telas, moldes , entre otros)  con las cuales piensa satisfacer la cantidad de pedidos con la que actualmente cuenta ya que durante la campaña navideña la demanda por sus productos suele aumentar.
texts.en:
Iván, 27, is single and doesn't have any family responsibilities.  He lives with relatives in their home, located in sector 9 de Octubre, an urban zone on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

He has lived there for the past 3 years and during this time has succeded in setting up a small workhop where he  makes satchels.  He studied sewing and then worked in Lima for a business specializing in that area.  He soon decided to go out on his own and open a business which currently  is developing well.

Iván would like to increase his production with supplies (such as zippers, fabric, patterns, etc) and that is how he plans to fill the orders that he currently has.  He is counting on the Christmas season when the demand for his products usually grows.

loans.use: To purchase supplies so that he can increase his sewing business and the sales of satchels

loans.name: Sister

texts.en: Sister A. is single and sells foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava and cocoyam. She has been in this trade for five years. Sister is requesting the loan in order to buy more and varied types of food, as requested by her customers. With the new profit from her expanded business, she plans to buy land.

loans.use: Sister is going to use the loan to buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Future In Our Hands Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Future In Our Hands” group. They are small-scale business people in the northern city of Makeni. This is not their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and increased profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve.

John C., left, is the leader of this group. Born in Makeni, he is thirty-five and married with two children who are attending primary and secondary school respectively. John has been selling used bags for twelve years and with his share of this loan, will buy bales of used bags to add to his business.

loans.use: Buy bales of used bags to add to his business

loans.name: Adjoa Essoun Felicia

texts.en: Adjoa Essoun Felicia C. sells underwear, dresses, rice, soaps and other goods in Elmina. Adjoa has gone to a senior-high level of education. She is married and takes care of three children. Her husband is a fisherman. She has been in this trade for four years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more underwear and dressses to increase the quantity of goods sold. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more underwear and dresses to increase the quantity of  goods sold.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who are located in Preaek Hour Kaeut village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Pheap S. was born in 1988 and is a married woman. She is the group leader. She was selected as the group leader by the other members. She is a grocery seller in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business. Her husband, Mr. Sum Chanthou, is a truck driver who owns a truck to transport soil. With their careers, they are able to earn some income to support their family. 

This couple has a child who is only three years old.

loans.use: To buy more groceries.

loans.name: Karren  Atieno

texts.en:
Karren is 47 years old and married to John. They have four children, all of whom attend school. Karren owns a retail shop that she has been operating for the past ten years. She earns 18,000 KES in monthly profit. 

A friend who is a KADET client introduced Karren to KADET LTD. She is applying for her first loan to purchase shop inventory such as sugar, wheat flour, and cigarettes to sell.

Karren is a very hard-working lady. She plans to use her additional income to provide for the basic needs of her family, pay school fees, and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as cigarettes, wheat flour, and sugar

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal “Los Solidarios” D. la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Marcelina, tiene 55 años D. edad y tiene nueve hijos, ella nació en la ciudad D. Urubamba del departamento del cusco y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad. 

Marcelina se dedica a la venta D. flores. Ya son 2 años que se dedica a este negocio  y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor.  Marcelina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.
texts.en:
Marcelina belongs to the communal bank "Los Solidarios" in the Asociación Arariwa.  She is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

Marcelina is 55 years old and has 9 children.  She was born in the city of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, and that is also where she currently lives.

Marcelina has a business selling flowers.  She has had this business for 2 years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  Marcelina needs a loan now to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Buhara Group United

texts.en: Joseph is 46 years old and lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.He is a farmer and also has a retail shop which has facilitated him in providing for a family of 12 members.He has a hardship of price fluctuation; his desire is to become a wholesale trader. Joseph is requesting a loan to buy salt, cassava flour, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To purchase salt, cassava flour, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa, de 27 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Jesús de 27 y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Cuando era pequeña, aprendió las técnicas agrícolas necesarias, y en la actualidad siembra habas y arvejas, junto a su esposo. Dice que le gusta mucho la labor agrícola pues con las ganancias que obtiene de la cosecha puede brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Cada día junto a su esposo se levanta al amanecer para empezar  a cuidar sus cultivos que están ubicados algo lejos de su casa. De esta manera los vigila a diario, contra las plagas y los factores climáticos que muchas veces son adversos para la buena producción, eso es lo arriesgado de la agricultura manifiesta porque no se sabe si todo lo sembrado rendirá en la cosecha, pero sabe que el esfuerzo se ve recompensado cuando vende su producción a los mayoristas. En adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y variar un poco en la producción sembrada. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además dice que se mantiene puntual en el pago de sus cuotas pues quiere seguir trabajando con su grupo de manera responsable. Elisa tiene pensado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de semillas de habas y arvejas, además de insecticidas que necesita para asegurar su siembra para  la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Elisa is 27 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 27 year-old Jesús.  What she most desires is to work very hard so that she can excel in life.

Elisa learned how to farm when she was a young girl and she currently grows beans and peas together with her husband.  She says that she really enjoys her farm work because she can use the profits she makes from each harvest to provide her children with the best.  Every day, Elisa and her husband get up at dawn to start caring for their crops which are located quite a long way from their home.  They take care of their crops every day, protecting them from pest infestations and changes in the weather which are very often not favorable to a good production.  She says that this is the risky part of farming.  You don't know if all the crops you sowed will make it to harvest time.  However, she knows that the effort is rewarded when she sells her produce to the wholesalers.  In the future, Elisa plans to grow her crops in larger quantities and vary them a little.

This is Elisa's third loan from MFP and she is grateful to everybody who made her loan possible as it will allow her to continue working.  She also says that she will remain punctual in making her repayments as she would like to continue working responsibly with her group.  Elisa plans to invest the loan she has requested in buying bean and pea seeds as well as insecticides that she needs in order to protect her plantings for the next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy bean and pea seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda vende perfumes, cremas, maquillajes por catalogo desde hace 8 años, ella esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para comprar varios productos que vende en el catalogo para tener en existencia, Yolanda esta casada con el señor Juan el cual es chofer, ellos viven solos ya que sus hijos son casados y viven aparte. Comenta Yolanda que emprendió este tipo de negocio porque es una persona muy activa y le gusta el comercio y emprendió este negocio, también comenta que vende colchas, sabanas por catalogo y surte sus productos en una distribuidor autorizado en la población de Zitacuaro, la meta que tiene doña Yolanda es ser distribuidor autorizado y tener mas clientas ya que nada mas les vende a personas que conoce que sabe que le van a pagar por que muchas clientas le han quedado mal.
texts.en:
Yolanda has been selling perfume, creams and makeup through catalogs for 8 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy several products that she sells through her catalogs so that she has some in stock.  Yolanda is married to Juan who is a driver.  They live alone as their children are married and live in their own homes.  Yolanda tells us that she started this type of business because she is a very active person and she likes selling things.  She also tells us that she sells bedspreads and sheets through catalogs.  She stocks up with products from an authorized distributor in the town of Zitacuaro.

Yolanda's goal is to become an authorized distributor and to gain more customers since she only sells to people that she knows, who she knows will pay, because many customers have let her down.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams and perfumes through catalogs

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 35 years old and a member of Mapema group in Faulu Kenya. He does stone quarrying to earn a living. He has been in the business for nine years and has five employees. He was previously employed and he decided to leave his job and go into business so that he would earn enough income to support his wife and two children. He is looking forward to owning a lorry for transporting stones. He has requested for 80,000 Kes to buy sand and ballast.

loans.use: to buy sand and ballast.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer and also operates a clothes shop in Ndunyu Njeru town. She has operated her clothes shop for the last two years. She is 53 years old and a single mother of one child.
Mary was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of her friends and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 12,000 KES well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes for resale. In the future, she hopes to expand her clothes shop into a bigger boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chicas Dulces Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama  Chicas Dulces  y se ubica en el Estado de Puebla. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes y es la quinta vez que solicitan un prestamo. Martha es la presidenta del grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior que inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar ropa interior. Ella tiene 44 años, estudio hasta 4to año de primaria, ella vive en union libre y tiene en total 3 hijos. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada por la oportunidad que le brindan de invertir en su negocio y tener mayor mercancia para su venta. Quiere este credito para comprar mercancia que ya tiene comprometida y con esto tener mas clientes y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia. También quiere ahorrar un parte de sus ganancias para brindarles educación a sus hijos, ya que su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos con una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Chicas Dulces' (Sweet Girls) and is located in the State of Puebla.  The group has nine members and this is the fifth time that they have requested a loan.

Martha is the group's president.  She has a business selling underwear which she started three years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy underwear.  Martha is 44 years old and studied up to the fourth year of elementary school.  She has a common-law marriage and three children.  At the time of requesting this loan, she feels excited by the opportunity that she is being given to invest in her business and have more merchandise to sell.  She would like this loan to buy merchandise that she has already promised to customers.  She thereby hopes to gain more customers and provide her family with a better quality of life.  She would also like to save part of her profits so that she can provide for her children's education since her biggest dream is to see her children gain professional degrees.

loans.use: to buy underwear for her business

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana forma parte del banco comunal “Mi banco Mi amigo 2” perteneciente a la comuna de Pudahuel, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 15 años, trabaja junto a su marido y venden diferentes artículos de temporada, sobre todo aquellos que se puedan vender rápido y a bajo costo. Viviana instala su puesto en una feria persa libre los días jueves, sábados, domingos y festivos de 8ºº a 15ºº horas. Viviana comenta que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y que las temporadas altas de venta son los días 15 y 30 de cada mes, sin embargo el resto de los días también le va bien. 
Con el crédito comprará pantalón de buzos polares y parlantes de automóvil.
Gracias a su negocio Viviana ha podido concretar algunos de sus sueños como cancelar el total de su casa propia, pagar sus estudios de Técnico en químico farmacéutico y ser el sustento económico de su hogar.
Sus metas son comprar una camioneta para trasladar su mercadería. 
Viviana vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 27 y 23 años de edad, ambos trabajan, pero le ayudan en su negocio los fines de semana, de ésta manera la familia se ha unido más en sus relaciones. Uno de sus hijos está casado, por lo tanto también vive junto a su nuera y sus dos nietos de 7 años y 6 meses de edad. Sus motivaciones y sueños son continuar con su negocio, para que le permita seguir concretando sus proyectos. 
Viviana está muy contenta y agradecida de Fondo Esperanza ya que le ha dado la oportunidad de contar con un capital para invertir en su negocio. Respecto a la relación con las socias del grupo del banco comunal, ésta ha sido muy buena, ya que existe confianza y solidaridad entre ellas. También considera que es muy importante aprender e incorporar nuevos conocimientos a su propio negocio. En general Viviana se encuentra muy contenta por sus logros.
Pudahuel es una comuna del sector poniente de Santiago (capital de Chile), región Metropolitana. Es un vocablo del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) que se traduce como “lugar donde se juntan las aguas” o “lugar de charcos”, debido a que posee una variada red fluvial compuesta por el río Mapocho y los esteros Lampa, Carén y Las Cruces, lo que favorece sus suelos para la producción agrícola por la existencia de abundante agua subterránea.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the “Mi Banco Mi Amigo 2” (My Bank My Friend 2) which belongs to Pudahuel Commune, city of Santiago.

She has been a merchant for the last 15 years.  She works alongside her husband selling various seasonal items, especially those they can sell quickly and at low prices.

Viviana sets up her stand in a bazaar on Thursdays, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays from 8am to 3pm.  Viviana comments that she’s done very well in business and that the days with the best sales are the 15th and 30th of each month; however, she does well the rest of the days too.  She will use the loan to buy sweatpants and car speakers.

Thanks to the business Viviana has been able to make some of her dreams a reality like, paying off her house, paying for her Pharmacy Technician training and supporting her home’s economy.  Her goal is to buy a pickup truck to transport her merchandise.

Viviana lives with her husband and two children who are 27 and 23 years of age and who both work but who help her with her business on weekends.  This has led to more family togetherness.

One of her sons is married so her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren who are 7 and 6 years of age also live with her.  Her motivation and dreams are to continue in business so that she can continue to carry out her projects.

Viviana is very happy and grateful to Fondo Esperanza because it’s given her the opportunity to have investment capital for her business.  With respect to the relationship with the other communal bank group members, it has been very good because trust and mutual support exists among them.  She also considers that it’s very important to learn new things to apply to her own business.  In general, Viviana is very happy about her accomplishments.

Pudahuel is a commune in western Santiago (capital of Chile) Metropolitan District.  The word comes from Mapudungun (Mapuche language) that means “place where the waters come together” or “place of puddles” because it has a varied network of streams composed of the Mapocho River and the Lampa, Carén and Las Cruces creeks which make the soil favorable for farming due to the abundant subterranean water.

loans.use: to buy sweat pants and car speakers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics like perfumes, creams, and makeup.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam works in preparing mouneh requested by loyal customers. "Mouneh is an old food tradition still produced in rural Lebanon involving the annual processing of fruits, vegetables, herbs, flowers, and animal by-products. It is done naturally according to availability during each season. The foods are later stored away in the pantry or "oodet el mouneh" – which translates to the mouneh room and these preserves are consequently consumed all year long." Hiyam is a 40-year-old married woman, the mother of four children, who works hard to provide them with the best living conditions. She works hard to help her husband increase their income and cover most of their expenses. In addition to preparing mouneh, Hiyam is going to help her son fix his garage that was in a fire, so he can continue his work fixing motorcycles. She hopes to improve her business more and more through expanding her mouneh varieties. . .

loans.use: to start preparing her mouneh requests.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 39-year-old married man and father of five children. He raises cows on his own farm and takes good care of them in order to ensure they give him the best milk to sell, and benefit from the milk's selling income. He is a well-known man, with a good reputation.  He is a hard worker and seeks perfection in his work and for his family members. He hopes to provide his children with the best education.

It has been three years since Husein started his dairy business; he provides the best fresh milk ever. To ensure improvements in production, he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He will use the loan to buy wooden logs to fix up the farm with a good fence and to clean the farm more, which will keep it healthy and comfortable for the cows and thus increase their productivity. He hopes to improve his business more and more in the future by expanding his farm and increasing the number of cows he owns.

loans.use: To buy wooden logs to fix up the farm with a fence and to better clean the farm

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia cuenta con 58 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella es originaria de una localidad donde todavía sus raíces las tienen muy bien arraigadas donde la gente todavía habla y visten el mazahua. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de artesanías de Ocoshal el cual la materia prima la obtienen del los árboles de encino. Doña Amelia es viuda y tubo 5 hijos pero ella vive sola, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías de Ocoshal las cuales las vende a personas que van a su localidad a comprar ese tipo de artesanias para revenderlas y abeces sale a venderlas a la ciudad de Mexico y ahorita esta emprendiendo un negocio de cultivo de aguacate ya que ella ve que si es un buen negocio, esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material para hacer sus artesanías como agujas, hilo, una tina grande, plantas de aguacate y fertilizantes orgánicos para no maltratar la tierra. Doña Amelia esta muy contenta por el préstamo que le están haciendo ya que así podrá tener otra fuente de empleo y tal vez más adelante emplear a la gente de su población para que le ayuden con el cultivo de los árboles de aguacate.la meta que tiene es tener su huerta de aguacate y mas adelante sembrar durazno.
texts.en: Amelia, 58, is a hard-working, enterprising woman.  She is from a place which still has very strong roots and the people still speak and dress in the Mazahua tradition.  Her main activity is selling Ocoshal crafts which are made from shrub pine wood.  Doña Amelia is a widow with five children, but she lives alone.  She makes and sells Ocoshal crafts to people in her village who buy it for resale.  Sometimes she travels to Mexico City to sell her products.  She also grows avocados since she sees this is a good business.  She is requesting a loan to buy material for her crafts such as needles, thread and a large tub, as well as avocado plants and organic fertilizer that won't hurt the land.  Amelia is grateful for the loan which will allow her to have another source of income.  Perhaps in the future she will hire someone from the village to help her with the avocado crop.  Her goal is to have an avocado plantation and in the future begin to grow peaches.

loans.use: To grow avocados and make Ocoshal crafts.

loans.name: Glenda Giomar

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso que se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Glenda, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad pero aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Garden y de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y productos naturales. Esta 6 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio creciendo dia a dia.
texts.en:
The Bienestar y Progreso ["Well-Being and Progress"] Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado, in the Montecristi canton. This region is known nationally and internationally for its rich pre-colonial culture and artistry. It is the home of the famous straw hats.

Here we meet Mrs. Glenda. She is 50, married, and has three children. They are all grown but still live with her. Her husband is a professionnal driver.
She is a housewife who, in order to make her own income, sells Garden natural products and Yanbal products (beauty products: cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She sells door-to-door. She works three days a week. She leaves her products on credit and charges every fifteen days. She has done this for six years and started it with her first loan, which she took out from a bank.

This loan is to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and natural products. She has been in the Communal Bank for 6 years, and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dreams are to continue moving forward with her business, growing every day.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and natural products.

loans.name: Pun

texts.en: Pun (pictured here), 47, is a widow. She lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Pun asked for a Kiva loan to lay bricks and plaster the ceiling and walls in order to visually enhance them. She is in the process of doing so and is asking for another loan of $600 to make the finishes.

loans.use: To lay bricks and plaster the ceiling and walls in order to visually enhance them

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa  es socia del banco comunal los Manguitos. Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 54 años de edad, casada, 6 hijos mayores con sus respectivas familias.
Hace muy poco tiempo que está trabajando  con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, la buena distribución  de su dinero está haciendo que su negocio este mejorando. 
Cuenta con un pequeño negocio  en su casa, que uno de sus hijos se encarga de administrarlo  cuando tiene que viajar para vender  sus  productos por los caseríos, de esa manera puede generar más ganancias.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 paquetes de gaseosa, 1 paquete de sal, 10 casilleros de huevo, 2 paquetes de fideos, azúcar.
Su esposo es comerciante y es el que mantiene el hogar, está feliz porque tiene la ayuda de su esposa que también da su pequeño pero significativo aporte  económico, que les sirve para poder cubrir otros gastos.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos pueden decir que su vida está cambiando para bien, y todo lo ha logrado con mucho trabajo y dedicacion.
texts.en:
Rosa, 54, is a member of the “Los Manguitos” (The Little Mangoes) communal bank in Yarinacocha District, Ucayali Department.  She’s married and has six adult children who have their respective families.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for just a short time and the good distribution of her money is causing her business to improve.  She has a small, home-based business that one of her children runs whenever she has to travel to sell her products among the settlements; this way she’s able to earn more profits.

She will use her new, 1200 new sol, loan to buy five packets of soft-drinks, one packet of salt, 10 flats of eggs, 2 packets of noodles and sugar.

Her husband’s a merchant and he supports the home.  He’s happy because he can count on his wife’s support for her economic contribution may be small but it’s significant in that it helps them cover other expenses.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos they can say that their life is changing for the better and they’ve accomplished everything they have with much work and dedication.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Delwendekonkilye Group

texts.fr:
Mme Sophie est la représentante du groupe DELWENDEKONKILYE. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans le moins âgé a 12ans.04 vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend une boutique et des légumes depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionnement dans un magasin à larlé en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, enfants et les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 10 bidons d’huile de 5 litre, 05 cartons spaghetti, 01 sac de choux et 01 sac d’aubergines.

Mme économise pour agrandir sa boutique. Elle ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants, s’occuper de ses parents devenus vieux et aussi ouvrir d’autre point de vente.
texts.en:
Sophie is the DELWENDEKONKILYE group´s representative. She is married and the mother of 4 children aged between 12 and 15 years, all of whom attend school. She has 5 dependents in all and has been selling food and vegetables from her own shop for the past 10 years. She gets her supplies in the town of Larlé and sells her products to all types of people. She will use the loan to buy 10 5-liter cans of oil, 5 boxes of spaghetti, 1 sac of cauliflower and 1 sac of aubergines.

Sophie is building up her savings so that she can enlarge her store. She would also like to be able to cover her children´s educational expenses, support her aged parents and eventually open another store.

loans.use: to buy 10 5-liter cans of oil, 5 boxes of spaghetti, 1 sac of cauliflower and 1 sac of aubergines.

loans.name: Fredesvinda Felicitas

texts.es:
Fredesvinda D. 49 años D. edad. Vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos en su casa propia, cuentan con servicio D. agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito D. Pacasmayo que pertenece al departamento D. La Libertad.  Esta zona se dedica a la pesca, agricultura y turismo.

DesD. hace varios años, cuenta con su propio negocio que lo a colocado en las afueras del mercado en donD. ofrece a sus clientes todo lo que es productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. Cuenta con una clientela establecida, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar susobligaciones familiares.

Fredesvinda observa que su negocio va creciendo favorablemente desD. un principio. Desea seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra D. más mercadería como productos D. consumo diario y abarrotes en general.  Va a comprar sus productos en grandes cantidades lo que ayuda en bajar el precio que paga. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2,000 nuevos soles. Fredesvinda es muy trabajadora y responsable, desea lograr mayores ingresos para seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Fredesvinda is 49 years old.  She lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home, which has electric and water. It is located in the Pacasmayo district in the La Libertad department. This area is devoted to fishing, farming and tourism. 

For a number of years she had her own business which she ran in the market. There she offered her customers groceries and all of the products of prime necessity. Due to her established clientele and her earnings she will be able to cover her family expenses.

Fredesvinda notices that her business has been growing favorably since it began.  She wants to continue growing her business and to buy more merchandise such as staple products and general groceries.  She is going to buy these products in large quantities which will help her in lowing the price that she pays. 

This is why she is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Fredesvinda is a very hard worker and responsible.  She hopes to obtain a greater income in order to continue advancing her family.

loans.use: to buy more staple products and general groceries for her business.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia is 27 years old. She is married and has two children. 

Eusebia has a retail store which sells green bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy more green bananas and coconuts.

Eusebia joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and green bananas to sell

loans.name: Njua

texts.en:
She is 51 years old. She is married and has five children with just one of them below fifteen years old. She lives in a five bedroom apartment with her family in mile Two Nkwen, Bamenda, Mezam Division, North west Region of Cameroon. The death of her two grand children and the theft of her goods are the major challenges she has faced in her life.

She joint GHAPE in 2000 and has received and successfully repaid Empowerment Credit several times. She invested her past loans in the sale of cloth and used the profit to feed and educate her children. Given a loan, she will stock men, women and children’s dresses which she will carry to rural areas for sale. She believes that this business will be a great success because she has many years of experience in this line of business and also because it is very profitable. The business activity will be of help to the community in that people in the rural areas will easily have dresses without having to go to town to buy dresses.

With the profit from this loan, she will increase her house in size. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the interest rate in moderate, the install mental method of repayment is convenient to her

loans.use: to purchase of clothing for men, women and children to sell in rural communities.

loans.name: Safi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Safi Group in Western Kenya! Pamela is the facilitator of the Safi group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Pamela takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Pamela had an excellent maize yield harvesting 41 1/2 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest 1 1/2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Pamela will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Safi Group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows three members: two women and one man. The field officer appears at the far left of the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is a single mother of two children living in Hioma, Uganda. She has owned a textile business for five years. She started as a farmer and then saved money to start the textile business. She faces a challenge of the business being seasonal. Her personal goal is to build a house and her business goal is to expand her business to new markets. Dinah intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sokkhoeun's Group

texts.en:
Sokkhoeun is a 39-year-old widowed mother with three children who are still in school. She is a farmer who has been farming for ten years. For the past three years she has supplemented her income by working at an ice factory. In addition, she raises poultry including chickens and ducks. She is currently able to earn about three U.S. dollars a day to feed her children.

Sokkhoeun leads a group made up of three females. She and one of her group have been with VisionFund since 2010 while the third member has just joined VisionFund. Her first loan from VisionFund helped her to have regular income, to purchase some basic household necessities and send her children to school. 

She is requesting a loan partly to pay for harvesting and partly to purchase feed for her chicken and ducks. The loan will allow her to finish harvesting her rice and also feed her chicken and ducks enough so that they will become fat. This will enable her to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting and buy feed for her poultry.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married to a farmer and has seven dependents. Ekua sells hair creams, footwear, bags, and also prepares banku (a Ghanian cassava dish) for sale at Besease. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in paying the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more bags, hair creams, and footwear to sell.  Ekua plans to open a shop to sell her goods with the new profits she will get.

loans.use: to purchase more bags, hair creams, and footwear to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells maize and beans.

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize and beans for resale, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and improving her business structure. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Susana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Susana es una mujer soltera de 34 años que vive en "Santo Domingo" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre la región Sierra y Costa del Ecuador. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Susana tiene una tienda de víveres en  la parroquia de ”Alluriquin” del cantón donde reside. Inició hace 4 años por iniciativa propia y desde ese entonces esta tienda le ha servido como único sustento. Ella desea dar un salto más y quiere invertir en estanterías y productos para su local. De esta manera ella quiere retener mayor clientela y con ello tener mejores ingresos.


El alza de precios en el país ha sido un gran obstáculo para Susana sin embargo ella está muy optimista con su crédito ya que su negocio está bien ubicado. Fundación Alternativa que es la institución que intermediará su crédito y la que le brindará capacitación y asesoramiento, ha determinado que Susana es un buen cliente y con un bajo riesgo de morosidad. Esperamos que esta emprendedora pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y pueda cumplir sus metas y anhelos.
texts.en:
Susana is a single, 34-year-old woman who lives in Santo Domingo, which is one of the newest cities in Ecuador.  It is set up at the meeting point between the mountainous and coastal regions of Ecuador.  Is it an exceptional spot, not just because of its ethnic richness, but also because of the scenery that can be found as soon as you enter this beautiful city.  Santo Domingo de los Colorados is part of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which was only recently formed.  The main holiday in Santo Domingo is celebrated with a huge wave of visitors and cultural and commercial exchanges.  There is a huge fair at the Rancher's Association's facilities where they show and compete the best specimens of breeds and crossbreeds that are bred in the area's ranches.

Susana has a grocery store in the Alluriquin neighborhood of her canton.  She started it on her own initiative four years ago and since then the store has been her only means of support.  She wants to take the next step and invest in shelves and products for her store.  By doing this she will maintain a larger clientele and thus generate more income.

The rise in prices in her country has been a huge obstacle for Susana, but she is very optimistic about her loan because her business has a great location.  Fundación Alternativa, which is the institution that will act as the intermediary for her loan and that will provide her with training and advice, has determined that Susana is a good customer with a low risk of defaulting.  We hope that this entrepreneur will be able to have a better quality of life and achieve her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to buy shelves and products for her store

loans.name: Clara Marisol

texts.es:
Clara Marisol tiene 38 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y los hijos de 1 y 11 años de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Clara se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Las compras y las ventanas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para el cultivo de maíz compra de abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá  comprar los abonos sin ninguna dificultad por el dinero.

El sueño es poder comprar terrenos. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Clara Marisol, 38, is married and has 2 children.  She lives with her husband and her two children, aged 1 and 11, in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios.  

She is a member of the communal bank "La Union," which is located in Recinto Aguas Frias in the canton of Ventanas.  The members of this communal bank are farmers who specialize in short-cycle agriculture, cultivating corn, rice and beans.

Clara is a farmer who cultivates corn.  She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan for her corn crops.  She will use the loan to buy manure and other fertilizers.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizers without having money problems.

Her dream is to be able to buy some land.  In her spare time, she enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy manure and other fertilizers for her corn crops

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 45 years old, married and has five children. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cristina has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Meru

texts.en:
This description was written by Richard Mazengo, a staff member for Village Enterprise Fund in Tanzania. He is also a partner representative for Kiva.

Meru C. is married with six Children and two in school. The business started 2001 after receiving grant from VEF of Tsh. 80,000.00. Currently, the business value is Tsh. 400,000. Currently, one US dollar is worth 1,174.90 Tanzanian Shillings. Thus, the value of this business is now over $300 US. Maintaining cash in a business is important for future purchasing. A loan will highly accelerate the possibilities for this group. Meru has a small staff and it has been observed that they are a very successful team and that is why they now qualify for this loan from Kiva.

The used clothing business is very successful in Tanzania, as it is in all of East Africa. Many East Africans have found great use for used clothing from Europe and America. It is less expensive than African clothing and of pretty high quality. Thus, you can see many Tanzanias walking around wearing t-shirts displaying American brands, schools, regions, performers and sports teams. This is just a reality here.

The loan will expand the business by openning a small shop for selling more clothes also she will be able to go to Dar-es-salaam to buy stock for the business and the business. The ability to travel this far will set them apart here in Dodoma, for most locals do not have the opportunity to make such a long voyage for business. This will allow them to buy the clothes as they come straight into the country from foreign lands.

loans.use: To buy bells of used clothing

loans.name: José Isaías

texts.en:
Isaías has been selling barbecue for the last 20 years. His is a two-generations business, since his parents and grandparents also worked in this type of activity. At first, he used to sell his product to other businesses, and later he decided to open his own store, which is frequently visited and very respected up to this day. He has struggled a lot to grow, and to provide his 3 children with a better quality of life and quality education.

Currently, Isaías needs a loan in the amount of US$475, because he needs to buy advertisement material and a counter for his business. Don’t hesitate any longer, your generosity can mean a great help for him and his family.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Isaías tiene ya 20 años de dedicarse a la venta de barbacoa, siendo este un negocio de dos generaciones, pues sus padres y abuelos también se dedicaron a esta actividad en su momento. Inicialmente vendía su producto a otros negocios y establecimientos, pero tiempo después decidió poner su propio negocio establecido y hasta la fecha es un negocio muy visitado y ampliamente acreditado. El ha luchado mucho por crecer y por brindarles a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de calidad.

En este momento Isaías necesita de un crédito de 475 DLLS, pues requiere comprar material publicitario y un mostrador para su negocio. No lo dudes más, tu generosidad puede ser de gran ayuda para el y su familia.

loans.use: purchase equipment

loans.name: Xavier

texts.en:
Xavier P., 45 years old, native of Montepuez, province of Cabo Delgado, grew up with his parents until he turned 20. His family's situation did not provide him the opportunity to study. He only reached 5th grade. In 1980, he was in the military and was demobilized in 1994, having opted to start his own commercial business.

He currently has a clothing sales shop, where he is the only worker.

With a loan of 10,500.00 mt, he plans to increase the volume of merchandise which will result in the increase of revenue and provide a better quality service to his customers.

His activity has a greater impact on the community because in addition to providing a job for himself, this allows him to earn income to support his family's basic expenses, put clothing articles on sale at competitive prices closer to customers who are residents of District 1 in Boane.

Translated from Portuguse by Naomi Baer, Kiva volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 01 - Boane Cliente: Xavier P. Sector de actividade : Comercio Valor de empréstimo: 10.500,00 MT (420.00 US$) Aplicação de montante: Venda de Roupa Inicio: 02/04/2007 Fim: 31/03/2007 Xavier P. de 45 anos de idade, natural de Montepuez, província de Cabo Delgado, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais ate atingir 20 anos, a situação financeira da família não lhe proporcionou oportunidades para estudar fez apenas 5@ classe. Em 1980 esteve na vida militar e foi desmobilizado em 1994, tendo de seguida optado por iniciar seu próprio negocio de actividade comercial. Actualmente conta com uma banca de venda de roupa, onde ele é o único trabalhador. Com empréstimo de 10.500,00 mt pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria o que vai resultar no aumento dos rendimentos e proporcionar um serviço de qualidade para seus clientes. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque alem de providenciar emprego para ele próprio o que lhe permite obter rendimentos para suportar despesas básicas da família, coloca artigos de vestuário apreços competitivos mais perto dos clientes residentes no bairro 1 de Boane.

loans.use: To increase the stock of used clothing in his shop

loans.name: Anver

texts.en: G. Anver Osman oglu is a teacher in Varkhankend village of the Saatli region. This income is not sufficient for his big family, consisting of 7 members. He has one cow and now he wants to extend his animal husbandry business. He has requested 1000 USD for purchasing a cow and fodder for animals.

loans.use: Going to purchase 1 cow and fodder

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao S. is 26 years old and married with two children. She earns $5 a day selling traditional Khmer cake. Her husband would like to set up a motor-taxi business to increase the overall income of the household, but does not have the money to cover the start-up costs. Mao S. is therefore going to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for him. They estimate that this will increase their household earnings by $5 a day.

loans.use: Mrs. Saem would like to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia lives in Batey, the migrant camps which house immigrant Haitian sugar-cane workers and their families. She lives with her family in one of the Batey company houses, barracks owned by the nationalized sugar-cane industry. She is 29 years old, unmarried and raises her children on her own. She has two children, ages 11 and 15.

Her Colmado, a small grocery store, provides food and small convenience goods to her community (i.e. rice, cooking, oil, soap). She buys her products in El Seybo and sells them to her community.

This is her third loan from Esperanza. She successfully paid back her first two loans of 300 USD and 330 USD respectively. Her profits allow her to buy food for her family and keep sending her children to school. She moved to the Dominican Republic from Haiti 8 years ago.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Talitai

texts.en: Talitai is a 49-year-old woman with three children. She is divorced, raising her children on her own, and has come to us for a loan to buy the tools and chemicals she needs to run her plantation. She supports her family by selling her crops at the local market, mostly on weekends, and nets a profit of 320 Tala (or $128 US) per week. In recent years, her business has grown, thanks to the help she is now getting from her oldest son. This increased income has helped her family a lot, and she hopes to do even better in the future, thanks to financial assistance such as this loan.

loans.use: To buy tools and chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Apélété

texts.fr:
Mr. A. Apélété is 25 years old and is single. He has just finished his apprenticeship as a shoemaker and is asking for a loan of $1,000 to open a shoemakers shop and to purchase materials and equipment. His plan is to make shoes and handbags of leather and synthetic that could be commercialized for a larger market. The realization of this dream will contribute to improving his economic and social conditions.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Apélété, âgé de 25 ans est célibataire. Sortie tout fraîchement de son apprentissage de cordonnerie, il demande par le biais de ce projet un financement de $1000 pour l’ouverture d’un atelier et l’acquisition de matériels et fournitures de la cordonnerie. Son programme est de fabriquer des chaussures et sacs en cuir et synthétique qui seront destinés à la commercialisation afin de gagner une marche bénéficiaire pour subvenir à ses besoins. La réalisation de ce rêve contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions économiques et sociales de sa personnalité.

loans.use: Opening of shoemakers shop and the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura lives at home with her mother on Pioneros de Rochadle street in the Alto San Pedro area of La Paz. She makes pieces of artwork made of plaster and sells the finished products at the Alasitas market, but also to bookstores. The loan she is asking for is to buy material to be able to produce more artwork to take advantage of the Alasitas fair which begins January 24 and ends at the end of February. She has not worked with Impro in the past but she qualifies to apply for a loan as a microentrepreneur with experience in her field.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Laura vive en casa de su madre en la calle Pioneros de Rochadle de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz con su mamá; la actividad que realiza es la elaboración de artesanía en yeso y vende estos productos terminados en la feria de Alasitas, pero también acomoda en las librerías. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de material y poder elaborar en mayor cantidad y aprovechar la feria de Alasitas, que comienza el 24 de Enero y termina a fin de Febrero. No tiene antecedente con Impro pero califica para acceder a un crédito en su condición de microempresaria con experiencia en su ramo.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her plaster crafts

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto E. is a very courageous man that is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising livestock and agriculture in the district of Villanueva in Chinandega. He's the father of three children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need.

In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, he has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of animals to breed them on his property.

His greatest goal nowawadys is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that he comes to Ceprodel for loans for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Alberto E. es un caballero muy esforzado que se ha caracterizado por realizar fuertes trabajos de crianza de ganado y agricultura en el municipio de Villanueva del departamento de Chinandega. Es padre de tres hijos y con la responsabilidad de mantener su familia y brindarle todo lo que necesiten.

A pesar de su difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio por medio de la compra de los animales para reproducirlos en su sector de habitación.

Su mayor anhelo hoy en día es mejorar su situación económica y así brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos utilizados en la compra de los animales y de igual manera en la crianza de estos mismos.

loans.use: Raising and Breeding of Livestock

loans.name: Okouromi

texts.en: Okouromi I.is 45 years old, married and has a kid. He resides in Benin-City, Nigeria. He uses motorcycle to move people from place to place. He needs a loan of $625 to enable him replace his old motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr:
The aim of this micro project is to convert palm nuts into red palm oil. It was created by Rosalie K., well-known in her area for palm nut processing. She has operated this business since 1985 in Agadon, in the Akpro-Misserete township, in collaboration with several other women whom she deems active and experienced in the field. This is not Mrs K.’s first experience of loans, as she has previously benefitted from some MFI-qualified NGO loans. This has enabled her to attain an acceptable level of activity but she feels it is insufficient, hence the request for financing in order to boost her economic activity and especially to contribute to the development of her nation.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ce micro projet a pour objectif de procéder à la transformation des noix de palme en huile rouge. Il a été concocté par K. Rosalie reconnue dans sa localité dans la transformation des noix de palme. Cette dernière mène cette activité depuis 1985 à AGADON dans la commune D’AKPRO –MISSERETE avec la collaboration de quelques femmes qu’elle juge activent et expérimentées dans le domaine. Dame K. Rosalie n’est pas à sa première expérience de prêt car elle en a bénéficié dans certaines ONG à vocation IMF. Ceci lui a permis d’atteindre un niveau acceptable mais qu’elle juge insuffisant d’où la recherche du financement pour rehausser son activité économique et surtout pour contribuer au développement de sa nation.

loans.use: To buy 3 metric tons of palm nuts

loans.name: Yves Ekoué

texts.fr:
Born in Cotonou in BENIN, Mr. Yves Ekoué M. is 28 years old. A computer services technician, he is married and is the father of two children, with three other people in his care. Given the quality and speed of his work, the size of his clientele continues to grow. Thus, he is able to partly satisfy his family's needs.

With the hope of increasing his income, he wanted to open a workshop to repair electronic equipment. However, due to a lack of financial means, he has never been able to achieve his goal. Currently, having decided to realize his dream, he is asking for a loan. This will help him increase his income and allow his family to flourish.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né à Cotonou au BENIN, monsieur Yves Ekoué M. est âgé de 28 ans. Maintenancier Informatique, il est marié et père de deux enfants avec trois autres personnes à charge. Vu la qualité et la rapidité dans ses prestations, le nombre de sa clientèle ne cesse d’augmenter. Ainsi, il arrive à satisfaire en partie les besoins de sa famille.

Dans le souci d’augmenter son revenu, il voulait ouvrir un atelier de réparation d’appareils électroniques. Mais par manque de moyens financiers, il n’est jamais arrivé à atteindre son objectif. Aujourd’hui, décidé à réaliser son rêve, il vient solliciter un crédit. Ceci l’aidera à augmenter son revenu source de l’épanouissement de sa famille

loans.use: To open an electronics repair workshop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana left her hometown of Desaguadero, Peru with dreams of forming a home filled with love alongside the father of her son. However, a few months after moving to the city of Juliaca the two decided to separate. While this event caused Juana extreme disappointment at first, she put herself to work in a business selling a variety of products (candles, combs, batteries, etc.) as a walking vendor. Through much hard work and strong will, she was able to grow her business little by little. Thanks to these long years of sacrifice and dedication she currently has the satisfaction of providing a roof and an education for her beloved son Oscar, who is 10 years old. Juana still has many plans for her business and she is certain that with your help she will be able to put her projects into action.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana, salió de su ciudad natal, Desaguadero, con muchas ilusiones de formar un hogar lleno de amor al lado del padre de su hijo, pero a pocos meses de radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca decidieron separarse, luego de este hecho que en un principio le causo decepción se dispuso a dedicarse al negocio de venta de chiflerías (velas, peines, pilas, etc) en forma ambulatoria, pero Juana con voluntad y mucho empeño logro poco a poco ampliar su negocio, gracias a estos largos años de sacrificio y dedicación en este negocio actualmente tiene la satisfacción de ofrecerle un techo propio y sobre todo educación a su amado hijo Oscar de 10 años de edad.Juana aún tiene muchos planes con su negocio y está segura que recibiendo tu apoyo podrá encaminar sus proyectos.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to improve her inventory and sales.

loans.name: Agathe

texts.fr:
Born around 1976 in Aguegue in the valley of the Ouémé in the southeast of Benin, Mrs. Agathe Agoussou is married and the mother of four children: Marie (16) is an apprentice seamstress; Mahugnon (14) is an apprentice mason; Roger (11) is in 7th grade, and Mireille (9) is in 4th grade.

Mrs. Agathe Agoussou prepares porridge made out of corn in the mornings and also distributes sacks of corn. Since she has financial difficulties, she is requesting her second loan to bolster her business and also to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers les années 1976 à AGUEGUE dans la vallée de l'Ouémé au Sud-est du Bénin, dame A. Agathe est mariée et mère de 4 enfants: Marie 16 ans apprentie couturière, Mahugnon 14 ans apprenti maçon, Roger 11 ans en classe de Sixième au cours secondaire et Mireille 9 ans en classe de CE2.

Dame A. Agathe prépare la bouillie à base de maïs les matins et fait aussi la distribution des sacs de maïs. En difficultés financières, elle sollicite son deuxième crédit pour renforcer l'activité et aussi pour satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 4 sacks of corn

Achat de 4 sacs de maïs

loans.name: Guillermo Willy

texts.es:
Wily is a very hardworking person. He manages a small restaurant with his wife where they serve both national and international dishes. They have sacrificed to get where they are in life, working from early in the morning until late at night. They have three children, all of which are now studying at inexpensive private schools. His children also work in the restaurant cleaning and waiting tables to earn tips.

Translated by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Staff

Don Wily es una persona muy trabajadora, junto con su esposa atienden un pequeño restaurante, en el, se sirven platos nacionales e internacionales; llevan una vida sacrificada, ya que atienden desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche. Tiene tres hijos, los cuales se estudian en colegios particulares,con mensualidades bajas, sus hijos tambien trabajan el el restaurante atendiendo las mesas, llevandose para ellos la propinas.

loans.use: Capitalización de su negocio

loans.name: Saidbek

texts.ru: Файзов Саидбек житель Явана. Работает таксистом. Имеет собственный автомобиль. Работает по маршруту Душанбе – Яван. Деятельность приносит доход. Но для того , чтобы увеличить доход и уменьшить стоимость проезда Саидбек хочет установить газовое оборудование. Для этого он должен получить кредит  , срокм на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ривлечь клиентов , которым будет дешевле ездить на его машине. Кроме того он сможет сделать больше рейсов и заработать больше. Таким образом он обеспечит свою семью лучше. Он женат и имеет четверых детей.
texts.en:
Saidbek F. resides in Yavan, and is a taxi driver with his own automobile. He works the route between Dushanbe and Yavan. This business brings in income, but to increase his earning and reduce the cost of each trip Saidbek wants to install equipment to reduce gasoline consumption. To do so, he must take out a 12-month loan. This would attract clients whose ride in his taxi would be less expensive. In addition, he would be able to make more runs, earn more, and better support his family. He is married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Automobile Repair

loans.name: Francisco Rene

texts.es:
El señor Francisco M., es un cliente que tiene 63 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos a su cargo ya que son mayores, no tiene compañera de vida, la actividad eocnomica de este señor es una pequeña pulperia la cual logro poner como producto de su liquidacion como trabajador, teniendo cinco años de dedicarse a este pequeño negocio, su sueño es poder mantener este pequeño negocio, ya que a su edad dificilmente va encontrar empleo, por lo que su unica fuente de ingresos es esta pequeña ventecita que es muy pequeña, pero con el apoyo nuestro tiene el deseo de poder ir invirtiendo mas y fortalecer su inventario actual, para ello solita un credito con leon 2000.
En la actualidad con el credito pretende adquirir productos como gaseosas, bisuteria que es lo que mas comercializa, no da al credito, ya que su negocio no se lo permite. Sus hijos le ayudan en lo que pueden pero cada uno ya tiene su familia establecida. Por lo que espera contar con nuestro apoyo en el fortalecimiento de su ideas de negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco M. is 63 years old and is single, his children are all grown up and he has a small grocery store that he was able to start with the money he got when he was laid off. He started his business 5 years ago. His dream is to be able to keep on his little business because at his age is difficult to find a job, and his little store is his only source of income. With our help he will be able to increase his business. With the current loan he is looking to get products like sodas, women’s jewelry, which sells very well, although he doesn’t, has lay away, at this time. His children help him on everything they can, but each one has their own family. This is why he hopes to get our support to strengthen his business.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén ubicado en el Jr. 7 de Junio s/n, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincial de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años de edad , es madre de 9 hijos, 8 de ellos mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio, trabaja de Lunes a Domingo en el patio de su vivienda desde las 3 hasta las 10 p.m. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 6 kilos de arroz, 8 pollos, 5 cabezas de cerdo, 10 kilos de pescado, 3 kilos de cecina, etc.

Gracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha crecido y también agradece a Dios y a todas las personas que la apoyan.
texts.en:
Señora Elsa belongs to the New Paradise Communal Bank located in the 7th of June neighborhood, district of Yarinacocha, provincial of Colonel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 56 years old and a mother of 9 children; 8 of them of legal age and one that still depends on her. She is married and her husband is dedicated to the extraction of wood. With the first loan that she received of Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in the sale of food.

Currently she relies on the same business. She works from Monday to Sunday on the patio of her dwelling from 3 to 10 p.m.

With this loan of 2,000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 6 kilograms of rice, 8 chickens, 5 hogsheads, 10 kilograms of fish, 3 kilograms of jerky, etc.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos her business has grown and also thanks to God and to all the people that support her.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 kilograms of rice, 8 chickens, 5 hogsheads, 10 kilograms of fish, 3 kilograms of jerky, etc.  for her food business

loans.name: Fizétou

texts.fr:
Madame A. Fizétou est née en 1962 et réside dans le quartier d’Agoè dénakpoè situé dans la ville de Lomé (Togo), elle a trois (03) enfants et est divorcé de son mari Mr OURO BOUTCHO Tagba, officier de police. Elle fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2004 dans son quartier où elle a ouvert une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Avec ce premier crédit de 450000F qu’elle sollicite, elle complètera son stock de marchandises avec dix (10) sacs de riz, dix (10) sacs d’huile, six (6) cartons de tomates et sept cartons de spaghettis. 
L’expansion de son commerce lui permettra de couvrir les charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Fizétou A., born in 1962, resides in the Agoè Dénakpoè disrict, located in the city of Lomé (Togo). She has three children and is divorced from her husband Mr. Tagba OURO BOUTCHO, a police officer. She has been trading in grocery items since 2004 in the district where she opened a shop. Her supplies come out of Lomé. With this initial loan of 450,000 francs CFA she is requesting, she will round out her inventory of merchandise with 10 sacks of rice, 10 containers of oil, 6 boxes of tomatoes, and 7 boxes of spaghetti. The expansion of her commerce will enable her to cover her family's expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Viviana Benítez es peluquera, tiene 23 años, es separada, tiene 1 hijo de 6 años de edad, vive con su madre.
 
Viviana abrió su propia peluquería hace más de dos años, luego de mucho sacrificio.
