Precisa del crédito para la compra de productos para peluquería tales como cremas para el cabello, agua oxigenada , tinturas y así poder tener completa su peluquería, ya que sus clientes piden a diario mayores atenciones.
texts.en:
Viviana Benítez is a hairdresser. She is 23 years old, separated, and has a 6-year old son. She lives with her mother. Viviana opened her own hair salon over 2 years ago, after much sacrifice. She says the loan will be used to buy products for her salon such as hair creams, hydrogen peroxide, and dyes so that her hair salon will be well stocked, as her customers are more exacting every day.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dyes, hydrogen peroxide, and hair creams.

loans.name: Brenda Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Brenda Lucia Torrez M. tiene la edad de 28 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Brenda tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes un varón de 5 años de edad y cursa el tercer nivel de primaria su otro hijo tiene la edad de 4 meses y recientemente no estudia, sus propósitos son de seguir colaborando con la ayuda económica que ella aporta através de su negocio, sus deseos son que la actividad económica del país mejore y que por consiguiente mejore su negocio para lograr los objetivos propuestos sus sueños que Dios le de mas vida para lograr educar a sus nietos para ver que estos se preparen de forma profesional y además sepan enfrentar las difíciles situaciones que se le presenten para el día de mañana ya que quiere salir adelante y dejar de vender ambulante por las calles y realizar esta actividad en su vivienda.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de vigoron, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo de poseer el negocio es de 2 años, Doña Brenda inicio este negocio por cuenta propia ya que con el dinero que su esposo ganaba no le ajustaba lo suficiente para los gastos de su casa y todo inicio con el apoyo de su familia quienes le ayudaron con este negocio ya que su hijo mayor le ayudaba con a cargar con los productos por lo que no tenia un medio de transporte para la venta de sus productos y ambos recorrían las calles en busca de clientes que pudieran apreciar el delicioso vigoron que ofrecía en las calles por lo que mas tarde decide conseguirse un carretón para que su hijo descansara de transportar esta carga pesada todos los días por lo que ahora le ayuda a llevar el carretón y es una manera mucho mas fácil, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar la compra de su materia prima como: yuca, chingaste, frito, queso, charrasca y repollo por lo que todos los días ofrece el vigoron a sus clientes y dice estar muy contenta de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas a quienes les importa el progreso de las personas y del país.
texts.en:
Brenda Lucia Torrez M. is 28 years old and married. She has 2 sons. Her eldest son is 5 years old and is in his third year of primary school. Her younger son is 4 months old. Recently, Brenda stopped her studies. Her intention is to be able to continue to provide for her family, which she is able to do thanks to the income from her business. She wishes for her country's economy to improve, and hopes that this improvement would in turn improve her business so that she may achieve the success she needs. Her dream is for God to grant her a long life so that she may be able to educate her grandchildren and see that they grow up knowing how to succeed professionally and how to handle the difficult situations that they may encounter in their lives. In the more immediate future, Brenda wishes to move forward with her business, to no longer have sell her food as a street vendor, and to be able to sell her food from her home. Brenda's business is selling the traditional food vigoron. She sells it on the street, and has run her business for 2 years. Brenda began her business on her own because the money that her husband earned was not sufficient to cover their household expenses. Everything relied on the support of her family, who helped her with the business. Her eldest son helped her to carry her food because she did not have anything that she could use to carry it when she went out to sell. She and her son would walk the streets looking for customers who would appreciate her delicious vigoron. Eventually she decided to get a cart to carry her food, because her son was growing tired from carrying it around every day. Now they carry the cart around together, and it is much easier for them to work. The loan will provide capital for her business, with which she will buy raw materials such as yucca, pinol sediment, cheese, cabbage, and a knife, so that she may continue to make and sell vigoron every day to her customers. Brenda says that she is very happy to work with Fundación León 2000 and with the friendly organizations who are concerned with the progress of the people and of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat is married with a 10-year-old daughter. His family lives in Kherson. Marat is a private entrepreneur selling sports footwear in the central city market. Marat is very disciplined. One of his strong characteristics is his ability to listen and persuade, which helps him in his work with customers. Marat has been in the market for 10 years. Today he has about 60,000 Grivnas invested in his business. 

Marat‘s main goal is to provide his family with a decent life and stable future. He has always tried to achieve financial and economic independence and make a career. Marat is hoping to see his business flourish and succeed. He believes this loan of 9,000 Grivnas will be one of the steps towards this goal. Marat has repaid 15 loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Abla  Sepegna

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’ agoè nyevé, un quartier nord de la ville de lomé, elle a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale  qu’elle fait depuis 2001, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. actuellement son stock de marchandises est pratiquement épuisé, elle demande à wages un prêt pour acheter 08 paquets de tomates en boîte, 06 cartons de patte alimentaire, 02 sacs de riz, 04 cartons de couscous, 08 cartons de vin. Elle est celibataire et aide certains membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a women who lives in Agoè Nyevé, a northern district of the city of Lomé. Her income-generating work involves commerce in grocery items and is something she has been doing since 2001. She supplies herself at the grand marketplace of Lomé. Right now, her stock of merchandise is practically exhausted. She is asking WAGES for a loan to buy eight lots of canned tomatoes, six boxes of pasta, two sacks of rice, four boxes of couscous, eight boxes of wine. She is unmarried and assists certain members of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general grocery items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Since 1996, Elizabeth T. has sold various provisions and cosmetics such as powder, perfumes and bomo in Kotokraba near Cape Coast.  She is single with 2 children and has received her senior high school degree.  She is responsible for paying light and water bills. Her loan will be used to buy provisions and cosmetics to help fill up her store with more merchandise. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy provisions and cosmetics to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
For four years, Hagar A. has sold secondhand clothing and also prepares kenkey (a cooked, fermented white maize food) for sale at Siwdo. She is married with one child and received an education through junior high school. Hagar’s husband also works as a trader.

Hagar is responsible for helping to pay for various household expenses such as food for the family. Her loan will be used to add more capital to her business of selling used clothing and also to buy carn and plantain leaves for the preparation of the kenkey. She plans to reinvest her profits to further increase her success.

loans.use: To invest in used clothing business and to buy carn and plantain leaves for the preparation of kenkey

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Duong N., 50, sells fruits in the market of Kampong Cham province. She typically makes US$5 per day. Her husband is the village chief and earns US$5 per day as well. The couple has three married children. Duong would like to take out a loan to reinvest in her fruit store.

loans.use: Reinvest in her fruit store

loans.name: Tatasu Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu K., Isatu K. and Isatu B.. They called their group Tatasu. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town twenty miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of SLL 500,000. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently they can make better profit and improves on their standards of living. 

Kadiatu (middle) is the leader of this group. She is thirty-five years of age. She was born in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a plumber and they have four children. All of their children are in secondary schools. Kadiatu sells market food: palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), pepper, rice and many more in Waterloo market. She has been a businesswoman for four years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (1311020214) is a 44-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has seven school-aged children.

T. owns and operates a business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over seventeen years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month.

In 2002, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa,  vive en el Barrio Revolución.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 02 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra golosinas y gaseosas. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, comprará caramelos, galletas, gaseosas, chocolates, etc.

Su deseo es comprarse un carro. A ella le gustan los ahorros ylas charlas que dan en el  Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth belongs to the “Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa (The Powerful Women of Saint Rose)” Communal Bank which is located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, in the region of Puno. She is 38 years old, has a civil marriage, is the mother of three children, and completed elementary school. She lives in Barrio Revolucion (Revolution neighborhood). She has worked with the Manuela R. movement for two years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN and was used to purchase candies and sodas. With this loan of 500 PEN she will purchase caramels, cookies, sodas, chocolates, etc. Her desire is to buy herself a car. She likes the savings and the chats that they give at the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of caramels, cookies, sodas, chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Dios Nos Guia Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Dios Nos Guía está conformado por Nora Yessenia Anaya Z., María Concepción López y Ángela Mercedes Ríos López. Sus actividades económicas son diferentes, pero esto no les impide desarrollar una amistad y lograr sacar adelante a sus familias y negocios. Nora se dedica a la venta de verduras, la ubicación de su negocio es las afueras del mercado, en cambio María se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es su única fuente de ingresos para su familia. La actividad económica de Ángela es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ángela inicio con mucho sacrificio este medio de vida porque tenía que salir adelante con su familia. Por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y así comprar materia prima. María Concepción es la otra integrante de este grupo. Ella se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a su actividad. Ella proporciona a sus clientes lo necesario para así que siempre satisfacer la demanda. Es por eso que las 3 deciden realizar este financiamiento con el fin de seguir adelante con sus actividades.
texts.en:
The Dios Nos Guía Solidarity Group is comprised of 3 members: Nora Yessenia Anaya Z. María Concepción López Ángela Mercedes Ríos López

They operate different businesses, but this does not prevent them from developing a friendship and sharing a common goal of moving their families and businesses forward. Nora sells vegetables from a vending location outside the local market. María runs a small grocery store, which is the only source of income for her family. She has been in business for 7 years and always tries to satisfy her customers with what they need. Angela is a clothing retailer who has been in business for 5 years. She made sacrifices to start her business because it was the only way for her to improve her family’s living situation.

Their loan will be used as working capital to buy materials for their respective businesses. They decided to pursue financing so that they could keep their businesses in operation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2000, son ancienneté dans ce commerce lui a permis d’avoir une grande clientèle. Son stock actuel de produits d’alimentation générale a connu une baisse, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 4 bidons d’huile, 4 boîtes de conserves, 1 carton de lait  et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns an income from selling grocery items.  She has been in this business since 2000.  Her seniority in this commence has enabled her to have many customers.  Her current stock of grocery items has experienced a drop.  She wants to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES for 4 drums of oil, 4 boxes of canned food, 1 box of milk, and various food items.  She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items to sell

loans.name: Robinah's Group

texts.en: Robinah N. is the leader of her lending group in Lugasa. She is 49 years old and married with 10 children ages 11-25.  Her oldest child is attending University. She also cares for orphans, taking them to school and feeding them just like her own children. Robinah is a fishmonger in Buwoya town.  She started out selling matooke but changed after realizing that she could earn more selling fish, and now she has been doing so for 15 years. She is grateful for the loans because it allows her to buy enough stock without running out. She requests a new loan to buy more fish so she can earn more profits and pay for her children to attend school next term.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Lisette

texts.es:
Lisette tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace varios años atrás se dedica a la elaboración y venta de panes. Para ello, usa el honro de un familiar y se instala en la esquina de su casa para su comercialización. Adicionalmente, al terminar la venta de sus panes, el resto del día se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, estos productos los ofrece a sus vecinas y amistades a través de un catálogo, para luego acordar una fecha de pago (al crédito) según la necesidad de su cliente. Con estos negocios Lisette sostiene la economía familiar y su deseo es continuar dedicándose al comercio, pero ir incrementando sus ventas.   
Esta es la cuarta oportunidad que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se siente muy comprometida en ser una integrante de su banco comunal puntual en sus pagos, también está decidida a ser una persona proactiva. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de cosméticos, al por mayor. Además, también adquirirá harina, manteca y levadura; ingredientes primordiales para la elaboración de sus panes.

loans.use: Incremento de su mercadería y compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes

loans.name: Emanuel Ii Group

texts.es:
ESTELA A. D., A QUIEN VEMOS SENTADA EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA, TIENE 48 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE 5 HIJOS, 3 ADULTOS, INDPEPENDIENTES Y 2 MENORES DE EDAD QUE AÚN ESTAN A SU CARGO. ELLA ES SOCIA DEL  GRUPO “EMANUEL II”, INTEGRADO POR 10 PERSONAS MUY EMPRENDEDORAS.

LA SRA. ESTELA, ES MUY ENTUSIASTA, ALEGRE, JOVIAL Y SOBRETODO MUY TRABAJADORA. Y COMO ELLA MISMA MANIFIESTA ES MIL OFICIOS, PORQUE VENDE TODO TIPO DE MANUALIDADES. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ARTESANÍA, OFRECIENDO A DOMICILIO A SUS AMIGOS Y CONOCIDOS SUS PRODUCTOS SOBRETODO ARTICULOS EN TEJIDO. ÉSTE TRABAJO LE HA PERMITIDO VIAJAR, Y HACER LLEGAR SUS PRODUCTOS A PROVINCIAS.

HACE 1O AÑOS, INICIÓ EN ÉSTE NEGOCIO, LUEGO DE HABER ESTUDIADO, MANUALIDADES, TEJIDOS Y OTROS CURSOS MAS. 

LE GUSTA MUCHO SU TRABAJO, PORQUE LE PERMITE TENER UN INGRESO ECONÓMICO, LA RELAJA, CONOCE GENTE Y SOBRETODO PORQUE PUEDE APOYAR ECONÓMICAMENTE A SU ESPOSO EN LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.

CON SU TRABAJO, HA CONSEGUIDO TENER UNA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA, VIVIR CON TRANQUILIDAD, SATISFACER GUSTOS Y NECESIDADES DE SUS HIJOS.

LE GUSTARÍA MUCHO, ALQUILAR UN LOCAL AMPLIO, DONDE PUEDA OFRECER SUS PRODUCTOS.

EL DINERO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ CON EL APOYO DE SU PAREJA, EN LA COMPRA DE UN MOTOTAXI, Y ASI TENER OTRO TIPO DE NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Estela A. D., who we see seated in the photo, is 48 and has five children. Three are adults, and two are minors she is still raising. She is a member of the Emanuel II Group, which is comprised of ten very enterprising people. Estela is very enthusiastic, happy, jovial, and, above all, hard-working. She is a “jack-of-all-trades” because she sells all types of handicrafts. She sells door to door to her friends and acquaintances. Her products are woven articles. This work has allowed her to travel to take her products to the provinces. It has been ten years since she started in this business after studying handicrafts, weavings, and other courses. She really likes her work because it allows her to have an income, it relaxes her, she gets to know people, and, above all, it helps her husband with the household expenses. With her work she has obtained economic stability, she lives more peacefully, and she can meet the needs and wants of her children. She would really like to rent an ample location where she can sell her products. The money she is asking for is to buy, with help from her husband, a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized cart) so that she can have another type of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a "mototaxi"

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa es una persona colaboradora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa  provincia D. Coronel Portillo, tiene 60 años y es madre D. tres hijos mayores D. edad, se dedica al alquiler D. motocarro que le permite recibir ingresos diario, ella es separada hace muchos años. Es parte del  Banco Comunal “Bellavista” desD. hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en golosinas para vender en un tablero en la vereda D. su casa, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 1300 soles que le permitirá invertir en la compra D. otro motocarro y  D. esta manera aumentar sus ingresos. La meta D. Tomasa es tener un negocio D. abarrotes en general.

loans.use: Iinvertirá en la compra de otro motocarro

loans.name: Juliana Dorotea

texts.en:
Juliana has been running her 'pulperia', the Nicaraguan equivalent to a corner store, for the last 12 years. She is requesting this loan to buy products to stock her store. Though she has had a 'pulperia' for years, the loans she has received from CEPRODEL have helped her expand the number and type of products she offers her customers. Now her 'pulpería' is well-stocked and she has a display case and a freezer.

Juliana has been working with CEPRODEL for 5 years now. This is her 29th loan. She originally started her 'pulpería', however, with a loan from a different micro-finance agency. Loans have helped her expand her business and offer better products, she said.

loans.use: To buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells colorful sarongs and shoes at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is a hard-working woman and she works long hours to ensure that she meets the needs of her family. She is 46 years old and married. She and her husband have 3 children. Her husband sells building materials to support the home. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all her kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: K. Afiavi est née le 11 Novembre 1966 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Afiavi est une veuve et mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Afiavi vit à Ahito à Allada depuis 24 ans. Afiavi supporte seule les charges de la famille. Afiavi n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Afiavi mène comme activité, la vente de nourriture (riz, haricot, accompagné de sauce). A côté de cela, Afiavi vend des produits vivriers (riz, haricot, etc.) à son domicile à Allada. C’est à Bohicon dans le Zou au Bénin que Afiavi s’approvisionne. Afiavi mène cette activité depuis environs 40 ans. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afiavi compte augmenter davantage la taille de son activité en cette période de préparation des fêtes, afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de la clientèle. C’est pourquoi, Afiavi sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Afiavi K. was born on November 11, 1966, in Allada, in the Atlantic Department of Bénin. Afiavi is a widow with 5 children, all of whom educated. She still supports 3 of them financially. She never attended school. Afiavi has lived in Ahito, in Allada, for 24 years. She is the sole provider for her family. Her business is sale of food, such as rice and beans with sauce, as well as animal feed. She sells from her home. Afiavi purchases her ingredients and grains in Bohicon in the Zou in Bénin. She has been doing this work for nearly 40 years. A long-time client of ALIDé, she has always repaid her loans without problem. She requests this loan to increase the amount of product available to sell during this pre-festival period, to satisfy client demand.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 3 bags of beans, 3 bags of rice, and 2 containers of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en: Svay H. is an older woman and the widowed mother of three children. Two of them are married and they all have jobs. Svay H. sells a few groceries to her neighbors and also takes time to braid traditional mats to sell. Svay H. needs a loan to increase the inventory of her grocery business.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her grocery business

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en: N. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two young sons in a house in the Tuv province of Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver and N. operates a meat retail business in her town. She began her business in 2004, and since then, has earned enough to buy the home where her family currently lives. She is already planning for her children’s education, even though they are very young. She says, “All I want is to be able to afford a good education for my children in order for them to have happy, productive lives.” N. is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan in order to purchase a large amount of meat, which she will sell this winter when prices rise.

loans.use: Purchase raw meat

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 33 years old and is married with one child. Her husband works as a prison officer in Benin City.

Rosemary sells groceries and drinks and loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a world class supermarket in the future.

Rosemary needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Rosemary is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, de 47 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en su casa propia y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sobre salir en la vida.

Su tienda de abarrotes es una de las más visitadas en su barrio, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus clientes lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y está dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 20 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. 
Con el tiempo, espera ampliar su bodega y abastecerla de más mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Beatriz con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 47, is a very happy and sincere woman. She lives in her own house, and she is prepared to work very hard to succeed in life. Her grocery store is one of the busiest in her neighborhood. She opens her store very early in the morning, waiting for her customers to come and buy the things they need. She is a very happy and attentive salesperson. She always receives her customers with a smile and is ready to help them with their purchases. What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers. She has been in this business for 20 years. The most difficult part is having to stay in her store all day without being able to leave. In time she hopes to expand her convenience store and stock it with more merchandise to offer her customers a better variety of products. This is Beatriz’s eighth loan with MFP. She is prepared to make all of her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank. She is much loved by her colleagues in her communal bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is requesting to buy more products to better set up her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa, 35, is a married woman with two children. Her oldest child is only 14 years old. Both of her children go to school. She works hard to sustain their education and her family’s needs. She manages a rice field, which she said had a good harvest the last time. In order to have an even bigger harvest she has applied to CEVI for financial assistance. She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 to fund her farm. With this amount, she will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
Madeleine, de 21 años, vive con sus padres y aunque es joven, cada día se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la confección de ropa, al principio ayudaba a su primo y veía cómo trabajaba él en su taller ubicado en la ciudad, pero tiempo después aprendió y empezó a trabajar sola. Le gusta mucho la costura, debido a que es un trabajo tranquilo, además obtiene buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ahorrar para estudiar diseño de modas que es lo que más le interesa ahora. Esta joven emprendedora tiene muchas metas por cumplir y piensa concretarlas a corto plazo. En adelante, planea instalar un pequeño taller de confección, además le entusiasma mucho la idea de darles trabajo a otros jóvenes como ella que quieran progresar con su trabajo.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que acceda al crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando en lo que tanto le gusta. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de varios fardos de telas, ya que quiere cumplir con un pedido de uniformes que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Madeleine, 21 years old, lives with her parents and although she is young, every day she tries very hard to succeed.

For 2 years, she has worked making clothing. At first, she was helping her cousin and she saw how he worked in his studio, located in the city. However, later she learned and started to work on her own. She likes sewing a lot, since it is a calm job. In addition, she earns a good income, which allows her to save money so that she can study fashion design, which is what she is most interested in now. This young enterprising woman has many goals to achieve and she thinks they will be a reality in the short term. She plans to set up a small sewing workshop; in addition, she is excited about the idea of offering work to other young people like herself who want to make progress with their work.

This is the first loan she has had with MFP and she is very grateful for all the people that make her loan possible, since she will be able to continue working in what she likes so much. The requested money will be invested in the purchase of various bundles of fabric, now that she wants to fulfill a pending order of uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Calavi au Bénin, Y. Antoinette est mariée à MASSENON Patrice, un agent de transit. Il y a environs 38 ans que Antoinette vit à Enagnon Est, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Antoinette est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Antoinette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Antoinette vend de la nourriture (riz, "atassi" : mélange de riz et du haricot) dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Antoinette vend des produits vivriers. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Antoinette s'approvisionne. Antoinette exerce cette activité depuis son jeune âge, et a déjà bénéficié de six crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Antoinette souhaite augmenter son stock de produits et mieux répondre à la demande des clients ; ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de profit. C'est ce qui amène Antoinette à solliciter un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Calavi in Benin, Y. Antoinette is married to Massenon Patrice, who is an import/ export professional. For about 38 years Antoinette has lived in Enagnon Est, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Antoinette is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are attending school. Antoinette lives with her children and her husband. Together the couple takes care of the family's needs. Antoinette sells food (rice and "atassi" (a mixture of rice and beans) in her neighborhood. As a secondary business, Antoinette also sells a variety of food products. She supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Antoinette has been in this business since a young age and she has received 6 loans, all of which were properly repaid. In order to handle the requests of her increasingly growing clientele, Antoinette would like to increase her stock of products and better respond to client's requests; this will enable her to increase her profits. It is for this reason that Antoinette is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For food products (e.g. beans, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Cleotilde Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Cleotilde G. se ha destacado como excelente comerciante desde hace 25 años vendiendo diferentes frutas y en especial deliciosas papayas que son ofertadas por ella misma en su localidad.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de las papayas para continuar con la venta y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Clotilde G. has stood out as an excellent merchant for over 25 years selling assorted fruits, especially papayas, in Managua's Mayoreo market; she tends to her stall herself. She is requesting funds to buy papayas in order to continue selling them thus earning income to support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy papayas.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: La Sra. M. V. Octavia, vive en el Caserío de San Antonio perteneciente al distrito de Santiago, junto a su esposo y sus 3  hijas. Trabaja como obrera de campo en el fundo del Sr. Martinez desde hace 5 años. Solicita  financiamiento para  terminar la construcción de su casa que fue afectada por el terremoto en el año 2007. Su sueño es poder terminar de construir su casa y que cada uno de sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida. La Sra. Octavia M. V.  agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a travez de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sra. M. V. Octavia lives in the settlement of San Antonio, located in the Santiago district, together with her husband and three children. For 5 years, she has worked as a field laborer on the farm of Sr. Martinez.

She is applying for a loan in order to finish work on her house, which was damaged in the 2007 earthquake. Her dreams are to finish constructing her house and that each one of her children will have a better quality of life. Sra. Octavia M. V. is grateful for the support she has been offered through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to her home.

loans.name: Delgertuya

texts.en:
Delgertuya is 39 years old and a widow who lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. She operates a grocery store in her yard. Delgertuya has been operating this business since 2006 and has built a stable operation over the past four years.

However, her husband passed away and she was left to raise her two children. At that time it was hard for her to continue her work, but she has since worked diligently to grow her business to its current successful position. Her grocery store is in a good location and her business is stable. Delgertuya has been planning to purchase large amounts of products for her store to increase her sales. She is a very hard-working person and says, “I would like to expand my grocery store and to open a supermarket in future.” She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a 33-year-old businessman. He sells used clothes especially ladies' wear in Nairobi. He has been in this business for six years and terms it competitive. His customers are mainly ladies and he employs one person.

Eliud has requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 to increase his stock of ladies' clothes for sale. He hopes to diversify into other businesses and to own a supermarket in the future. In five years, he plans to have bought a house, employed more people and have children. He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: To increase his stock of ladies' clothes

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Yanet es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo de 3 años, de profesión profesora y trabaja en un colegio, Yanet tiene proyectado casarse este año y terminar de construir su casa en el terreno que se compro con sus ahorros..
Yanet vende ropa, zapatos, colonias de acuerdo a pedidos, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayoría de sus ventas son al crédito.
Yanet pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Vida y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones que recibe y el incentivo a ser responsable. Yanet necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de casacas, botines y ropa de niños.
Los sueños de Yanet es terminar de construir su casa, comprar un departamento de Lima y un carro para alquilar a empresas.
texts.en:
Yanet has a partner, is 25 years old, has a 3-year old son, and works in a school as a teacher. Yanet plans to get married this year, and to finish the construction of her house on a plot of land she bought with her savings. Yanet sells clothes, shoes, and colognes based on demand, offering her products to friends and relatives. Most of her sales are done on credit. Yanet belongs to the Nueva Vida Cooperative Bank, where she appreciates the resources has access to and the incentive to be responsible. Yanet needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles, funds that she will use to invest in the purchase of masks, boots and children’s clothing. Yanet’s dreams include to finish building her house and to buy a car to rent out to various enterprises.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy masks, boots, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Girasoles Group

texts.es:
El grupo Girasoles está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas. El coordinador es el señor Dismar de Jesús C. H. quien es comerciante de ropa desde hace cuatro años e invertirá en mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería como blusas, camisas, pantalones, jeans, faldas...etc.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Patricia del Carmen García quien vende ropa usada y Ana Cristina Torre quien vende ropa y cosméticos en los cuales invertirá el crédito.
texts.en:
The group Girasoles [Sunflowers] is made up of three diligent, hard-working and decisive people. The coordinator is Mr. Dismar de Jesús C. H. who is a clothing merchant for four years now. He will invest in a greater quantity and variety of merchandise such as blouses, shirts, pants, jeans, skirts, etc. His co-members in the group are Patricia del Carmen García who sells used clothing and Ana Cristina Torre who sells clothing and cosmetics, more of which she will purchase using the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Resplandor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Resplandor inicia su quinto ciclo con 19 socias.
Diana es presidenta del Banco Comunal y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitación en temas D. salud y el incentivo en el ahorro.
Diana es soltera y tiene 1 hijas D. 4 años, Diana es natural D. la provincia D. Victor Fajardo y vive en Ayacucho hace 8 años en una casa alquilada, Diana tiene un puesto en el mercado D. las Americas en donD. venD. mercería como ganchos, aretes, tambien artículos D. limpieza y escritorio, actividad que realiza todos los días, su negocio lo inicio hace 3 años. Sus sueños D. Diana son estudiar una carrera D. corte y confección, tener una tienda granD. y una casa propia donD. brinD. comodidades a su hija.
Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. peluches y ganchos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Resplandor” (Brightness) is in its fifth loan cycle with 19 members.

Diana is the Communal Bank President. What she likes most are the health seminars and having the incentive to save. She is single and has a four year old daughter. Diana is a native of Victor Fajardo Province and has lived in Ayacucho for eight years in a rented house. She has a vending post at the Market of the Americas where she sells sewing supplies such as hooks and studs as well as cleaning supplies and stationery. Diana started her business three years ago and works every day. Her dreams incluD. studying for a degree in fashion design, having a large stO., and owning a house so that her daughter can live comfortably. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of plush toys and sewing hooks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plush toys & sewing hooks

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita A. is from the village of Gappal, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 59 years old. Angelita is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Angelita owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing tailoring in the local community. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Angelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Angelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand the tailoring service

loans.name: Eduardo Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Eduardo Carlos S. Vásquez es una persona joven y dedicada a su trabajo, él desde muy temprana edad tuvo que trabajar porque su padre era una persona dedicada a la bebida es por esta razón que desde muy pequeño se dedico a trabajar como ayudante en un taller mecánico.

Al pasar los años el se independizo y actualmente trabaja en el sindicato de moto taxis “COPACABANA”, se levanta por la mañana para empezar su cotidiana labor, Eduardo tiene muchas ganas de auto superarse y así para en un futuro no muy lejano el este capacitado para formar un hogar con las comodidades que él no pudo gozar en su niñez y adolescencia.

El señor Eduardo Carlos S. Vásquez se apersono a CIDRE por el comentario de sus compañeros y los directivos del sindicato para poder solicitar un crédito destinado  para la compra de un vehículo (motocicleta) para así poder facilitar la vida que lleva y así poder mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
Eduardo Carlos S. Vásquez is a young person who is devoted to his work. He had to work at a very young age because his father drank a lot. That is why he started working as an assistant in a mechanic’s shop when he was very young. As the years passed he became independent. He currently works in the Copacabana “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) syndicate. He gets up in the morning to start his daily work. Eduardo has a great desire to improve himself. In the near future he will be prepared to set up his house with the comforts he was not able to enjoy in his childhood. Eduardo Carlos S. Vásquez came to CIDRE to request a loan because of what his colleagues and the board of directors of the syndicate told him. He will use the loan to by a vehicle (motorcycle) that would help simplify his life. That way he will be able to improve financially.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Betty Edilma

texts.es:
Betty de 28 años, vende ropa y sandalias desde hace año para poder mantener a sus hijas ya que su esposo vende frutas. Ellos viven en una casa de caña y solo cuentan con agua como servicio básico. 

Inicio vendiendo sandalias poco a poco como le fue bien, con los ahorros que tenia comenzó a vender ropa. Ahora ella trabaja dese las 08h00am recorriendo las calles de tierra de su sector. Aunque ya le han robado la mercadería ella sigue trabajando para darle una mejor vida a sus hijas. 

Para poder incrementar sus ingresos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa, en el futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento y tener un local de ropa.
texts.en:
Betty, 28, has been selling clothes and sandals for a year in order to take care of her daughters because her husband sells fruit. They live in a house made of reeds and their only basic service is water. Betty started selling sandals. Gradually, this went well for her. With the savings she had, she started to sell clothes. Now she works from 8:00 AM travelling the dirt roads in her area. Although some of her merchandise has been stolen, Betty continues working to give her daughters a better life. In order to increase their income Betty would like to buy clothing with the loan. In the future she wants to built a cement house and have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Clothing

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine A. is from the village of Tigbao. She is 25 years old. Catherine is engaged. To make a living, Catherine owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Catherine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Catherine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catherine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and to increase her working capital. Catherine is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template which allows Field Partners to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Fuerza Del Mañana (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Fuerza del Mañana está formado por 10 socias amigas que laboran en diferentes actividades con un fin común que es mejorar sus economías y así salir adelante junto a sus familias. Viven por diferentes parroquias que pertenecen a la ciudad de Cuenca, en donde su mayor actividad es la agricultura y cría de animales.

La Señora Piedad U. vive en la comunidad de Susudel que pertenece al cantón de Oña, tiene 53 años, es divorciada hace 28 años, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad que son casados y viven independientemente. Esta orgullosa que gracias su esfuerzo y trabajo tiene su casa propia. 
Doña Piedad se dedica a trabajar en un comedor que es de su propiedad, en el cual labora desde las 5 de la mañana en la preparación de sus platos y trabaja hasta las 9 de la noche cuando termina de vender sus productos, también se dedica a la cría de animales como cuyes y cerdos que los vende en su propia comunidad. Este es el primer crédito que realiza en este banco comunal ya anteriormente ha sido socia de otro banco comunal en el cual fue miembro activo un año y medio. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres como un quintal de arroz, azúcar y más productos para la elaboración de sus platos.

Su meta es  aprender a conducir para poder trasladarse con más facilidad a su hogar.

La Señora Carmita C. vive en la comunidad de Misicata que  pertenece a la parroquia de Baños. Este es  su primer crédito, fue invitada por una amiga quien le ha incentivado a que forme parte de este hermoso grupo de mujeres. Se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal hace 4 años y vende solo en sus tiempos libres. También se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras y ya cuenta con clientes a los cuales les  entrega sus productos  y el sobrante lo vende en el mercado de la feria libre, esta actividad  la realiza hace 15 años.
Doña Carmita tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 20, 18, 13 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y su sueldo es para sus gastos personales, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo  estudia el último grado de la escuela. Su esposo es chofer y labora conduciendo su propio bus, gracias al trabajo conyugal cuentan con su  casa propia. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos como perfumes, cremas etc., de la marca Yanbal y también en semillas para sus cultivos.

Su meta es  comprarse un vehiculo para llevar sus verduras y vender con mas facilidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank Fuerza del Mañana is made up of 10 members who are friends. They work in different activities with a common purpose which is to improve their finances and thus get ahead with their families. They live in different parishes that belong to the city of Cuenca, where the main activity is agriculture and raising animals.   

Mrs. Piedad U. lives in the community of Susudel which belongs to the Oña canton. She is 53 years old and has been divorced for 28 years. She has 4 grown children who are married and live on their own. She is proud that thanks to her hard work she owns her own house.  

Piedad works in a restaurant that she owns. She works there from 5 in the morning preparing the food and works until 9 at night when she finishes selling her products. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and pigs that she sells in her own community. This is the first loan that she has taken out with this community bank since previously she was an active member of another community bank for a year and a half. She will invest her loan in buying groceries such as a a 100 pound sack of rice, sugar, and other products to make her dishes.    

Her goal is to learn to drive to be able to get around more easily. 

Mrs. Carmita C. lives in the community of Misicata, which belongs to the Baños parish. This is her first loan. She was invited by a friend who encouraged her to join this beautiful group of women. She has sold Yanbal products for 4 years and she only sells in her free time. She also is a farmer; she plants vegetables and she has customers whom she delivers her products to and she sells what's left over in the free market. She has been doing this for 15 years.

Carmita is 38 years old. She is married and has 4 children, aged 20, 18, 13 y 11. Her two oldest children work and their wages are for personal expenses. Her third child goes to high school and the youngest is in the last grade of elementary school. Her husband is a driver and he works driving his own bus. Thanks to the couple's work, they own their own home. She is going to invest her loan in purchasing Yanbal cosmetics,  such as perfumes, creams, etc. as well seeds for her crops. 

Her goal is to buy herself a vehicle to transport her vehicles more easily.

loans.use: To buy a 100 pound sack of rice, sugar and groceries; cosmetics, creams, perfumes; seeds.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. is married and has two children. She has received junior high education. Adjoa sells canned tomatoes and smoked fish at Abura. Adjoa will use the loan to acquire extra fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to help her husband educate their children.

loans.use: acquire extra fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold J. is 53 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The couple lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. They have one daughter who lives on her own. 

Ganbold works as a taxi driver after operating a small grocery shop. Also, he repairs people's automobiles to supplement his income. He is planning on trading his car in for a new car. Since opening his business, he has been able to improve his family's quality of life, and his earnings have enabled him to purchase a new plot of land where he has been building a new house and fence for his family. 

Ganbold is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase necessary parts for his car

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes U., a 50-year-old single woman who lives in the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province in the Philippines, is a woman of courage who maintains hope in her ability to rise above poverty.

Lourdes joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2009, and during her membership, she has been noted for her exemplary performance in meeting her obligations in the organization. Her previous loans were carefully used as rolling capital for her sari-sari (variety) store business. Because this venture allows her to earn just enough income for her needs, she recently ventured into operating a food stall, an enterprise that will bring her enough profit to save for the future.

Now requesting her third loan of 15,000 pesos to purchase more grocery inventory and to support her food stall business, Lourdes is hopeful that the trust and opportunity given by ASHI and KIVA, coupled with hard work, will allow her to reach her dreams of expanding her business, sending her nephew to school until he finishes college, and building a new and more spacious house.

Lourdes is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for helping her to reach her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery inventory and support her market stall

loans.name: Luna Radiante Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Luna Radiante” inicia su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana es un grupo muy animado que se ha reunido para  continuar con el trabajo en Pro Mujer, recibiendo los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Además, ellas comentan que es un espacio en el que pueden compartir y aprovechar de la compañía de sus compañeras, reír y olvidar los problemas. Está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  Los negocios son diversos:  venta de ropa interior, venta de pan, panadería –venta de llauchas, costura, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de juguetes, venta de jugo de quinua.

La presidenta de la banca comunal, señora María René es una mujer joven de 28 años, madre de 4 niños,  ingresó a formar parte de la banca comunal porque necesitaba capitalizarse para llevar adelante su negocio de venta de ropa deportiva.  La señora María René vende en su puesto de la zona 16 de Julio, en la feria de los días jueves y domingo.   Aprendió a vender hace algunos años, cuando era vendedora en una tienda de la ciudad de La Paz, luego decidió independizarse y contar con su propio negocio.  El préstamo que ha solicitado es por Bs.800.- y será invertido en la compra de una docena de deportivos.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta la reunión que se tiene en el centro focal y en particular su grupo porque es muy unido.
texts.en:
The “Luna Radiante” (Radiant Moon) communal bank is starting its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Focal Center.  It is a very lively group that has come together to continue working with Pro Mujer receiving credit services, training and health services.  In addition, they comment that this is a place where they can share and enjoy the company of their fellow members, to laugh and forget their problems.  It has nine members with various businesses like: underwear sales, bread sales, bakery, llaucha (cheese turnovers) sales, sewing, perfume sales, sportswear sales, toy sales, quinoa juice sales.

The President of the communal bank, María René, is a young, 28-year-old mother of four children.  She joined the communal bank because she needed training to run her sportswear selling business.  She has a stand in the 16 de Julio neighborhood’s Thursday and Sunday markets.  She learned to sell some years ago when she was a salesperson in a store in the city of La Paz.  She later decided to become independent and open her own business.  She has requested a Bs.800 loan to buy a dozen sports outfits.

When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she commented that she likes the meetings that take place in the focal center especially because the group is very united.

loans.use: To buy sportswear.

loans.name: Kenzhebubu

texts.en:
Kenzhebubu T. is a 57-years-old widow with four children.  Her family has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 15 years, which is the only mean of subsistence for them. They started this business with the initial capital of 30,000 Kyrgyz Soms and managed to earn 6,000 Kyrgyz Soms monthly. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, Kenzhebubu pastures her livestock in the mountainous areas with native grasses. Also, she works as a sorter of beans in the seasonal periods at the local processing plant. 

Now Kenzhebubu is applying for a loan of 70,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy bull calves for fattening and reselling. With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business by means of breeding. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To buy bull calves for fattening and breeding

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr: Elle est mariée est  et a 2 enfants en charge. Elle  est  âgée  de 49 ans. Elle fait la vente de pagnes, des ustensiles de cuisine et un peu de produits d’alimentation.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend dans une boutique à son domicile. Elle demande un prêt   pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: This lady is married and has two children in her care. She is 49 years old. She sells "pagnes" (pieces of colourful West African fabric), kitchen utensils and a few food products. She gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé and resells them in a shop in her home. She is requesting a loan in order to face ever increasing customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes" and food products

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, D. 43 años, vive con su esposo  Alejandro (45) y  juntos tienen tres hijos menores que  habitan en su casa que es  propia y esta  ubicada en el distrito D. Quimbiri.Isabel, es muy querida por los habitantes D. su vecindario; desD. muy pequeña quería salir adelante y tenia el sueño D. poseer negocio propio. En otros tiempos  apoyaba a su esposo en las labores cotidianas D. su chacra, así aprovecho los ingresos que le brindaba su parcela y gracias a esto  pudo instalar  su propio negocio. En la carnicería que tiene en la actualidad ofrece variedad D. carnes D. res, así  trabaja hace cinco años y le gusta mucho su labor; porque obtiene jugosas ganancias y sabe administrar bien su puesto. Además  tiene mucha demanda y  trabaja con varios restaurantes D. la zona y provee D. alimentos  para diferentes actividades como: fiestas D. promoción y festejos D. todo tipo. Su negocio  se sitúa en el mercado central D. su distrito y en la atención cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo e hijos, además para el futuro  tiene planeado comprar más ganado y  D. esta manera quiere satisfacer con los pedidos.Es el  tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones D. pago puntualmente.Isabel tiene planeado invertir los tres mil soles en la compra D. ganado en su viaje que realizara a la sierra del Perú.
texts.en: Isabel is 43 years old, she lives with her husband Alejandro, 45, and they have three young children together. They live in their own house located in the district of Quimbiri. Isabel is well liked by her neighbors. Since she was very young she has wanted to come out ahead and to have a business of her own. In a previous time she used to help her husband with agricultural activities in their field. She took advantage of the income that she was earning and thanks to that she was able to set up her own business. In the butcher shop that she now has, she sells a variety of beef meats. She has had the business for five years and she very much enjoys her work. She sees excellent earnings and she knows how to properly manage her business.  She also sees a great demand and she works with various restaurants in the region that cater to various special occasions, such as: promotions and all types of celebrations.  Her business is located in the central market of her district and she gets help with the store from her husband and children. In the future she plans on purchasing more livestock in order to satisfy client demand. This is her third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she is committed to her repayment obligations. Isabel plans to invest the three thousand soles in the purchase of beef cattle while on her trip to Peru.

loans.use: To purchase beef cattle.

loans.name: Nueva Generacion Group

texts.es:
el grupo Nueva Generacion esta integrado por 3 mujeres las cuales viven en EL Matazano Jamastran, son mujeres que tienen tiempos de concerse y son muy amigas, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Reina Isabel Cáceres se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular y granos básicos, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su pulperia opera bajo el nombre de pulperia "ENID". lo atiende personalmente por lo tanto es bien administrado y se nota que lo a manejado muy bien dicho negocio esta ubicado entre la intersección de las aldeas de la zona montañosa del valle de jamastran.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.

la sra. Orfilia Escoto López se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de productos agropecuarios, papelería y fotocopiado de todo tipo de documentos denominado “Agropecuaria Matazano” cuenta con mas de 2 años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad comercial, nos comentaba que le a ido muy bien ya que se encuentra en una zona netamente agrícola y ganadera, lugares aptos para este tipo de negocio. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de productos agricolas, papeleria en general.

la sra. Yeny Lizzeth Cáceres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace mas de 2 años, durante ese tiempo le a ido muy bien, ya que con los ingresos que percibe de las ventas apoya a su esposo en los gastos familiares y a la vez no descuida sus oficios domésticos y a su familia.el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cosmeticos.
texts.en:
The Nueva Generacion ["New Generation"] group is made up of 3 women who live in El Matazano Jamastran. They have known each other for a long time and are good friends. The following is a description of their businesses:

Mrs. Reina Isabel C. sells common consumer products and basic grains. She has a small general store in her home. Her store operates under the name "Enid". She works in it herself, and it is clear that it is well-managed. Her business is located at the intersection of the neighbourhoods in the mountainous zone of the Valle de Jamastran. 
She will use her loan for the purchase of merchandise to stock her store.

Mrs. Orfilia Escoto López is a merchant. She mainly sells agricultural products and stationery, and provides photocopying for all types of documents. Her store is called “Agropecuaria Matazano”. She has more than 2 years' experience in this kind of business. She told us that it has gone very well for her since she is located in a strictly agricultural area, a prime location for this type of business.
She will use her loan for the purchase of agricultural products and general stationery.

Mrs. Yeny Lizzeth Cáceres has sold cosmetics for over 2 years, during which time things have gone very well for her, since she uses her income to help her husband with the household costs without having to ignore her domestic responsibilities and her family.
She will use her loan for the purchase of cosmetics.

loans.use: the purchase of beans, rice, corn, sugar, coffee, cosmetics, general stationery and agricultural items

loans.name: Honey Fe

texts.en:
Honey Fe G. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 41 years old. Honey Fe is married and has 4 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Honey Fe owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetics and beauty products from NATASHA & AVON  in the local community. Honey Fe has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Honey Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Honey Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Honey Fe is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as cosmetics & colognes. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Honey Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics products to resell

loans.name: Dometila

texts.en:
Dometila is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a restaurant business for the past five years, her potential customers being travelers and neighbors. Dometila faces the major challenge of seasonality. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

With the 80,000 KES loan she wants to purchase a supply of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She decided to work with Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
Eliza, tiene 55 años D. edad y tiene seis hijos, ella vive en la ciudad D. Zurite provincia D. Anta del departamento del Cusco. Eliza es mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella es comerciante y se dedica a la preparación y venta D. queso. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Eliza en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar queso y necesita leche y sal. 

Eliza pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé D. las Casas” D. la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Eliza is 55 years old and has six children.  She lives in the city of Zurite in Anta Province in the department of Cusco.  Eliza is a hard-working, enterprising woman who provides for her family.  She is a merchant and sells the cheese that she makes.  She has been involved in this business for several years and has been successful at it thanks to all her effort.

Eliza needs this loan to buy ingredients such as milk and salt to make cheese.  She is a member of the "San Bartolomé D. las Casas" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as milk and salt to make cheese

loans.name: Hope To God Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Hope To God II” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are small-business people who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 4,000,000 for the entire group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Ishmail K.. Ishmail was born in the village of Yoni, 47 years ago. He is married and has 6 children. His wife is a businesswoman and 5 of his children attending primary and secondary school. Ishmail sells books, soaps, tooth-pastes, batteries, milk, etc. and has been running this business for 10 years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy books, soaps, tooth-pastes, batteries, milk, etc. in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy books, soaps, tooth-paste, batteries, milk, etc., in large quantity to add to his business

loans.name: Manos Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Alcancía Comunal "MANOS TRABAJADORAS"

Alcancía Comunal "MANOS TRABAJADORAS" trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD desde mas de 5 años y han demostrado ser mujeres con mucha fortaleza, gracias a los prestamos obtenidos ellas han podido mejorar su negocio e incluso incursionado a negocios mejores, logrando asi sus metas a corto plazo, tambien cabe mencionar que son personas unidas y aun con muchas metas por lograr.
Elizabeth es una de las socias de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, a clientes ya conocidos, ella planea usar el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería, a su vez desea comprar al por mayor para tener un stock de las prendas mas comerciales, en su grupo ella es la presidenta seleccionada por ser emprendedora y de caracter firme.
texts.en:
"MANOS TRABAJADORAS" [Working hands] Community Bank

The "MANOS TRABAJADORAS" community bank has worked with  EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for more than 5 years. They have shown themselves to be women of great strength. Thanks to the loans they have obtained, they have been able to improve their business and even gone into better businesses. They have been able meet their short term goals. It is also worth mentioning that they are united and have a lot of goals to achieve.  

Elizabeth is one of the members of the group. She sells clothing through orders to customers and acquaintances. She plans on using the loan to buy more merchandise. She also wants to buy wholesale to have stock of the more commercial pieces of clothing. In her group, she is the president, chosen because she is enterprising and has a solid character.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 3 Group

texts.en:
This is Carmencita´s 4th loan with Esperanza International after she successfully repaid her previous loans, which each gave her one step toward improving her business. She will invest this loan to increase her sales. She has had her business for over two years, starting when Esperanza gave her the first loan. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to build her house.

Carmencita lives in Hato Mayor, one of the country’s more rural cities whose economy depends on agriculture. Carmencita and her group of five members are taking loans for their businesses. Most of them sell clothing and miscellaneous products. This group is named Fe y Accion 3 (Faith and Action).

She requires a loan to buy more underwear and clothing to sell. She runs a small store in her house where she sells those products to her neighbors. By walking door to door she could assist new clients in other places and companies. 

She says that her favorite dream is to study to be a beautician, and she wants to have a Beauty Salon in the future. Carmencita and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy underwear and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is 51 years old and is a single mother of three children.  She sells curios and African attires to earn income.  She has been operating her  business for three years.  Previously, Lydiah ran a retail shop to earn a living.  Her marketing skills have helped her to attract more customers to her business.  Through Faulu Kenya,  Lydiah has increased her business stock.  She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy beads, African design fabric and sisal fibre.

loans.use: To buy beads, African design fabric and sisal fibre

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is married and has two school-aged children. She lives in Yerevan with her husband who works in construction.

Hasmik sells women’s clothing. She would like to develop her business by selling more clothes. With the help of a loan she will increase her income, which will help to cover daily costs, as well as grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Andrés

texts.es:
En el departamento de Managua el señor Oscar Andrés se ha caracteriza  por ser un hombre trabajador, para poder darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia y así salir adelante.

En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó a solicitar crédito él señor Oscar Andrés para invertir en su negocio en la venta de perecedero, este crédito lo utilizara para compra verdura como papa, yuca, aguacate, naranja, limón agrio, mango ctc.
texts.en:
Oscar Andrés, from Managua department is known as a hard-working man who wants to be able to give his family a better quality of life and thus to get ahead.   

Oscar Andrés came to the Ceproduel office to request a loan for his perishibles business to buy vegetables such as potatoes, yucca, avocados, oranges, limes, mangos, etc.

loans.use: to buy perishables (vegetables)

loans.name: María Virgelina

texts.es:
A pesar de su edad, María Virgelina es una emprendedora a todo dar, pues con el fin de cubrir sus gastos, desde algún tiempo se dedica a la confección de implementos para el hogar como tendidos, colchas, cortinas, así como ropa sobremedida, sus clientes vecinos y conocidos la prefieren porque hace muy bien su trabajo, así lo expresa esta luchadora de 68 años de edad con gran entusiasmo. 
 
Para continuar con su negocio, María Virgelina necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos propios de su oficio como hilos, telas y demás implementos que le permitan realizar mayor producción en menos tiempo y así mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Despite her age, María Virgelina is a complete entrepreneur because, aiming to cover expenses, she’s been sewing household items like bedclothes, comforters, drapes and made to order clothes, for quite some time.  Her customers, neighbors and acquaintances prefer her because she does her work very well.  This is how this 68-year-old fighter states it with great enthusiasm.

To stay in business, María Virgelina needs a loan to buy more supplies typical of her line of work like thread, fabric and other supplies that will allow her to increase production in a shorter time to improve income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 44-year-old married woman with seven children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a produce business selling ground nuts [peanuts] and popping corn for 20 years. Before that, Grace used to sell tomatoes in the markets. Her hardships are price fluctuations and high transport costs. Her vision is to become a wholesale dealer of dry foods.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts and popping corn to sell.

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.fr: La cliente Moseka, leader du groupe d’affaire « Nuru »,est entrepreneur, âgée de 33 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse de viande en détail. Son mari est aussi boucher, sociétaire d’une boucherie. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché sectoriel Afia Bora. Il y a 12 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  4  cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 cartiers de vache (bœuf).  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une moto, une voiture jeep et une parcelle dans les quartiers résidentiel de VIP.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Nuru» est majoritairement féminins.Une des clientes, porte joyeusement son bébé en main.
texts.en:
Moseka is a client and the leader of the business group "Nuru". She is 33 years old, an entrepreneur, married, and the mother of seven children, who are all in school. She sells meat retail. Her husband is also a butcher and a partner in a butcher shop. Moseka sets up her merchandise at the sector market Afia Bora. She has been in this business for twelve years. Yet, she just completed four loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan must serve her to stock up on two quarters of beef. Her ambition is to educate her children and to buy a motorbike, a jeep, and a plot of land in the VIP residential district. 

This client is thankful for Hekima for its actions favoring poor women who are excluded from traditional banking. It is appropriate to note that the business group "Nuru" is composed mostly of women. One of the clients is happily holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy 2 quarters of beef

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Melissa Del Carmen

texts.es: Melissa se dedica a la venta de víveres licores, y mercancía variada, en un negocio que está ubicado en su propia casa donde vive con sus hijos en las edades de 3 a 9 años.
