Melissa inició su negocio después de que su pareja no continuó en esta actividad, pues desde muy joven había aprendido a administrar cuando vivía en casa de sus padres y esta experiencia le sirvió para sostenerlo y generar ingresos para su hogar. En su tienda-miscelanea, Melissa vende de contado, aunque maneja con sus mejores clientes  créditos a corto plazo; su clientela está estructurada principalmente por amas de casa, que le compran diariamente los productos de la canasta familiar que en su tienda vende al detalle, los hombres que se inclinan por los licores, especialmente los fines de semana  y los jóvenes que se compran  los productos de misceláneas como accesorios, detalles, útiles escolares y de papelería. Su sueño es convertir su tienda en una gran distribuidora que abastezca a los negocios más pequeños, porque sabe que esta es una gran necesidad que ahorraría transporte a los propietarios de estos y también tiempo y espacio en su local. Mientras todo esto ocurre, Mellissa continua trabajando fuertemente para cumplir sus sueños y manejando una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menores del 17,92%, una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 2 días, y de inventarios de 24.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará, ranchos, víveres y refrescos, para surtir su negocio con los productos de mayor rotación y ganar descuentos por las compras en mayor volumen y de contado. Su gran desafío es ofrecerles una educación de calidad a sus hijos, lograr que sean personas de buenos principios morales y logren alcanzar su éxito.
texts.en:
Melissa sells foodstuffs, liquor and assorted merchandise in a store located in her house where she lives with her children whose ages range from 3 to 9 years.

Melissa started her own business when her partner stopped doing this activity because she’d learned how to run a store since she was very little and still living with her parents.  That experience helped her stay in business and earn income for her home.

Melissa sells for cash in her general store although she does give short-term credit to her best customers.  Her clientele is composed primarily of housewives that buy from her daily items needed for basic food preparation that she sells at retail in her store.  Men tend to buy the liquor, especially on weekends, and youngsters buy the miscellaneous items like accessories, school supplies, and stationery items.

Her dream is to turn her store into a big supplier of smaller stores because she knows that this is much needed for it will save store owners transportation costs as well as time and space in their locales.

While all this occurs, Melissa continues working hard to reach her goals and currently has a profit margin of no less than 17.92%, a two-day accounts receivable turnover rate and 24-day stock inventory turnovers.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy snacks, foodstuffs and soft-drinks to stock her store with the items that sell out most quickly and to earn discounts on her purchases for volume and for paying cash.  Her great challenge is to provide her children with a quality education and to see that they become people with good moral principles and attain success.

loans.use: to buy snacks, foodstuffs and soft-drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Jeanny

texts.en:
Jeanny is 29 years old and from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a single lady who has been able to manage corn production. It was hard for Jeanny at first to cope with it, but by and by, she got to love it.  Now she is interested in doing the job assigned. She has been told by her parents to manage the agricultural business of the family in order to practice and enhance her skills in running a business.   A successful entrepreneur starts small. Every month, she gets an estimated total of PHP 10,000.

Earlier this year, Jeanny joined GDMPC to be able to use financial services. Her first loan of PHP 12,000 will be used to compensate labor costs for weeding and for the purchase of some fertilizers. She expects to reap a good harvest and will invest in business expansion from the expected revenue to be generated.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs for weeding and to buy some fertilizers.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny is a security guard, while his wife is a weaver. They live on an island of the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children. Vanny is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.  

Photo: Vanny and his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina nació en la provincia de Urubamba en la comunidad de Racchi y tiene 41 años de edad,  ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Saturnina vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella después de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la venta de granos secos como por ejemplo papa, cebada, avena, maíz, trigo y otras más.  

Saturnina requiere el micro crédito para comprar abono y fertilizantes.
 
El Banco Comunal “Qorihuayrachina” se reúne cada treinta en la comunidad de Racchi de la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Saturnina was born in Urubamba Province in the community of Racchi.  She’s 41 years old, married and has three children.

Currently, Saturnina lives in the same community where she was born and where she carries out her economic activities.  After doing her household chores she sells dry grains like, for example, potatoes, barley, oats, corn, wheat and others.  Saturnina needs the micro loan to buy manure and fertilizer.

The “Qorihuayrachina” communal bank meets monthly in the community of Racchi in Urubamba Province, Cusco Department (Perú).  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials such as wood, paints, and brushes.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Tessie has a retail shop that sells spices & vegetables like okra, eggplant & squash. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

Tessie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 22-year-old married woman with four school-going children. Her husband Kaulu is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. They have a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Mary's greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of theft where sometimes some of her items are stolen. She dreams of owning a wholesale shop in the future.

With this 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap for her shop. She decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu, for easier access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has 6 children. She is readying the plantain leaves she will be using to rap the dough for the kenkey she sells in Elmina, which she has done for 6 years. Her husband is a farmer. She supports her husband in educating her children. Aba will use the loan to purchase maize to prepare kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase maize to prepare kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is aged 34 and married with five children. The first four are already in school. She has been in farming for the last four years and currently employs one farmhand who helps her produce milk, maize, beans and vegetables in her home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. She is also in a motorcycle transport business.

Frida has requested for a loan of 100,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to construct a greenhouse where she will grow tomatoes for commercial purposes. She adds the greenhouse will make her production possible in all seasons and benefit her especially during the dry season when the supply is poor in the market.

She is grateful for Juhudi Kilimo's support and reiterates that the loans will economically empower smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Mabrouk

texts.en: Mabrouk, a 25-year-old taxi driver with a low income, also raises sheep to increase his earnings in order to improve his living conditions. Mabrouk is now requesting a loan from FATEN to purchase more fodder for his sheep.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for the sheep he is raising.

loans.name: Nurinsa

texts.ru:
Нуринсе  48 лет, воспитывает  двоих детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, 10 лет назад Нуринса начала свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота, использовав стартовую сумму в 2,000 сом (KGS).   
Благодаря упорному труду Нуринсы, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает четыре дойные коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нуринса обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Нуринса планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает построить новый дом для семьи.
texts.en: Nurinsa is 48 years old and is raising two children. Her husband is located abroad working in Russia. In searching for a source of funding for her family, Nurinsa started her business in cattle fattening and resale ten years ago, using a starting amount of 2,000 som (KGS). Through the hard work of Nurinsa, her household today has four milking cows. In order to further develop her business, Nurinsa asked the company «Bai-Tushum and Partners» for a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional livestock. With her profits, Nurinsa plans to invest further in livestock and in the future hopes to build a new home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Porfirio Antonio

texts.es: Porfirio nuevamente necesita un credikiva, pues es su fondo de efectivo con el cual aumenta su capital de trabajo y con ello su productividad, sobre todo en esta època de buen movimiento comercial,  donde se levantan las ventas de estos productos. Con su credito anterior le fue muy bien y hasta logrò reinvertir sus utilidades, su negocio cada vez crece un poco mas y él se siente muy orgullosos de su trabajo. Su mensaje a los fianciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Muchas gracias por el apoyo financiero", él ha logrado, aumentar su capital de trabajo, su liquidèz y sus ventas crecen constantemente; en la actualidad, debido a su gran mejoramiento y con la ayuda de sus familiares planea comprar su vivienda y esto lo hace muy felìz.
texts.en: Porfirio needs again a Kiva loan, because it is the source of cash which he uses to build up his working capital and with it his productivity, especially in this period when his products have a high turnover. He did very well with his previous loan and even managed to reinvest his profit. His business continues to expand step by step and he is very proud of his work. Porfirio has this message for the Kiva lenders: "Thank you very much for the financial support." He managed to increase his working capital; his liquidity and his sales are growing steadily. Thanks to his improved well-being and the help from his family, he currently plans to buy his home and this makes him very happy.

loans.use: to buy meat, sausages, soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 28 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with ome of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Paul has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells phones.

To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phones for resale, and will help Paul to generate greater profits and improve his family's standards of living. Paul hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a plot of land and own a bigger shop that sells phones. 

Paul is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Paul who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more phones for resale.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona de 55 años de edad, madre soltera por viudez, tiene   4  hijos de  28, 32, 35 y 37 años de  edad  y  vive en la aldea la Limonera de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Doña Petrona trabaja todo el día atendiendo una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como arroz, pan, huevos, refrescos, azúcar, harina, churros etc.
Desde hace tres años  estableció este negocio y ha incrementado el inventario con esfuerzos propios, con la ayuda de un hijo y con los préstamos que ODEF ha otorgado. Este es el cuarto préstamo, con el cual va comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, harina de maíz y  refrescos para mantener siempre productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
De este negocio obtiene sus ingresos para mantener económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Petrona, 55, is a single mother due to widowhood.  She has four children who are 28, 32, 35 and 37 years old.  She lives in the village of Limonera in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  

Petrona works all day tending to her grocery store where she sells basic staple items like rice, bread, eggs, soft-drinks, sugar, flour, snacks, etc.  She opened the store three years ago and has been increasing inventory through her own efforts and with help from a son and from ODEF loans she’s gotten.  This will be her fourth loan and she will use it to buy products like rice, sugar, corn flour and soft-drinks to have the items her customers want always in stock.  She earns income to support her family from this business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

location.town: La Limonera, Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Jahir Wladimir

texts.es:
Jahir Wladimir  tiene 19 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá y el papá en ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Jahir se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol, además tiene animales como pollos de campo. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, abonos para poder trabajar mejor en el campo. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos para tratar la tierra.

El sueño es poder comprar tierras para poder trabajar en la siembra de maíz. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Jahir Wladimir, 19, is single.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas, a canton in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.

Jahir is a member of the LA UNION community bank in the rural Ventanas town of Aguas Frias.  The members of the community bank operate farming businesses.  They grow maize, rice, beans, etc.  

Jahir grows maize and beans for a living.  He also raises animals--chickens, for example.  He buys what he needs in Ventanas and sells whatever he has to sell there, too.  

Jahir is applying for a loan to buy the supplies--seeds, fertilizers, urea, etc..--he needs for the farm.  Your help will allow him to continue his business.

Jahir would like to buy farmland of his own.  In his spare time, he likes to play football.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Ashirbuvi

texts.en: Ashirbuvi was born in 1959. She has seven children three son and four daughters. She is very kind and responsible woman. She has 15 year experience in a farming sphere. She starts her works with buying and selling cattle as a cows and sheep. She has great experience in this sphere. She is ill. She wants to treat herself.   She needs to money.  She is asking for a loan 5000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying firewood and paying labor to make bricks

loans.name: Kifayat

texts.en: Kefayat is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region. She  settled with her family in Sumgait city. She is 52. She widow and has 3 children. Kefayat has lost the husband. Not looking all difficulties in current of 9 years this mother has grown up hers children herself. Five years ago she rented the small shop and has bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc.

loans.use: To construct her own food market and to buy the new refrigerator

loans.name: J Socorro

texts.en:
Mr. G. owns a small restaurant. He wishes to advertise his business, and is asking for financial support so that he can advertise and offer wider variety on his menu. “I would like everyone in the city to come by and try the delicious stews prepared by the woman who assists me. I am asking for $1,200.00.”

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. G. cuenta con un pequeño restaurante, el desea dar a conocer su negocio, solicita apoyo para la publicidad y para tener mas variedad en su menú gastronómico. "Quiero que toda la gente de la ciudad venga a probar los guisos riquísimos que son elaborados por parte de la señora que me ayuda, el apoyo solicitado es de $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use:
For advertising and a wider variety of dishes.
Para publicidad y mas variedad de platillos.

loans.name: Cao

texts.en: Mrs. Cao is 61 years old. She lives with a grandchild, 3 years old. She has no land aside from a hut. She sells groceries at home in order to save money to support herself and her grandchild. The family income is $9 per person/month. Mrs. Cao hopes to get a loan of $75 to run her grocery store. She will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To run the grocery store.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a dairy and small crop farmer and also works dispensing medications to cattle in the rural areas around La Paz. These activities provide the income necessary to support his wife and two children, who also work the fields with him. They live in the village of Tahari - Achacachi, two hours from the city of El Alto.

He will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow to increase milk production and in that way increase his family's income. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregorio es pequeño agricultor, productor de leche y trabaja como dosificador de ganados en el área rural de La Paz, de esa forma genera sus ingresos para la manutención de sus dos hijos y esposa mismos que ayudan con el trabajo del campo. Vive en la Comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito requiere para comprar una vaca lechera, de esa forma incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Mrs. Lun C., age 23, is a housewife who takes care of her two young children. Her husband works as a vehicle tire repairman. In order to expand his business and meet customer demand, she would like to borrow $1,000 to purchase an air compressor to pump tires and invest in a stock of tires to sell to his customers. They expect the expanded business will bring in $10 per day in revenue. They will use the extra income to continue to invest in the growth of the business and to save money for their children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor and tire inventory.

loans.name: Nia

texts.en: Nia is 58 years old, married and has six children. She is very talented at making elei (a traditional Samoan printing material) prints, a skill she acquired last year at a seminar held in her village. She is applying for her first loan to buy the materials and tools needed to start a small printing business. She plans to sell her elei materials to shops in town as well as take orders at her home from her fellow villagers. In the future, she hopes to apply for a second loan that will allow her to expand her business by building a small room where she will practice her craft.

loans.use: To buy tools and materials for her new elei-printing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more fruit and invest in a new cart

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José is 57 years old and has been married for 24 years to Blásida, who is 46 years old. Their marriage produced 5 children, of which one passed away. Their children are 26, 24, 20, and 11 years old respectively. The two oldest are married while the two younger children live at home with their parents and are in school.

José is the owner of a store that operates out of his own house, while his wife tends to the home. His business is very well stocked has a very good customer base. He sells sodas, fruits, vegetables, canned goods, candy, flour, sugar, rice, etc.

In addition to the store, José has a premises for parties, which he rents for events like marriages, birthdays, and popular music concerts among other things. For 15 years he has dedicated himself to these activities. In the future he would like to be able to obtain some land to use for feeding a cattle herd. He requests this loan in order to buy more merchandise for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

José tiene 57 años y está casado hace 24 años con Blásida que tiene 46 años. El matrimonio tuvo 5 hijos de los cuales uno falleció. Sus hijos tienen 26, 24 , 20 y 11 años respectivamente. Los dos mayores ya están casados mientras que los dos últimos aún viven con ellos y están estudiando.

José es propietario de una despensa que funciona en su casa propia mientras que su esposa cuida el hogar. Su negocio está muy bien surtido y cuenta con buena clientela ya formada. Vende gaseosas, frutas, hortalizas, productos enlatados, golosinas, harina, azúcar, arroz, etc.

Además de su despensa, José, posee un local de fiestas, que alquila para acontecimientos como casamientos, cumpleaños, conciertos de grupos musicales populares entre otros. Comenta que hace 15 años se dedica a tales actividades. Y en el futuro le gustaría poder adquirir un terreno para utilizarlo en el engorde de ganado vacuno. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mercaderías para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks, rice, noodles, sugar, meat, canned goods, soda, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Uryi

texts.en:
Uriy supports his wife and two children with a business selling and installing small natural gas water-heating units. He started his business about seven years ago at a time when he and his family were experiencing some financial difficulties. Since then, he has developed a successful, profitable business. He has about $4000 invested in his business and earns around $1200 per month. With the rapidly growing economy that Ukraine has been experiencing, many people are upgrading and remodeling their homes and businesses. The units Uriy sells are a popular way to modernize both heating and hot water arrangements.

Uriy has requested a loan to help purchase a bulk supply of plastic piping that he uses to install the heating units. His business has grown and been successful due in part to the financial assistance he has received through Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for this new opportunity to assist him with his enterprise.

loans.use: Purchase bulk supply of plastic piping

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice M. has been selling new women’s clothing for the past 21 years.  She is married to an integrated officer who is currently stationed in Sierra Leone, and she has 2 children.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy a wider variety of women’s and girl’s clothing. Beatrice is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of women’s and girl’s clothing.

loans.name: Rahel's Peace Group

texts.en:
Rahel is married with five children. She has been selling fruit and other food items since 1993. Every day, she works from 5.30am to 4.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Rahel now hopes for a loan to buy more fruit and other food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Naitovuaki, who has also sells fruit and other food items.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca A. is 30 years old. She is married with 2 children, aged 15 and 9. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, beans, canned foods, evaporated milk, soap, etc in her locality. She deems the loan an opportunity to expand her shop and wants to use the loan to buy increased stocks of rice, sugar, canned foods, soap, vegetable oil, etc to serve her customers and to increase her income for her business and family. She belongs to the community group called Adomako Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of rice, sugar, canned foods, soaps, vegetable oil, etc

loans.name: Aref

texts.en: Aref, 27 years old, owns a perfume, accessories and "Faux-Bijoux" shop in Saida South, Lebanon. Specializing in Arabic perfumes, this is Aref's first contact with the lending Institution of Al Majmoua.  He needs a total amount of $2,000 to purchase goods for his shop, but we will be providing him with a $1,200 loan in order for him to first build a credit history with the institution.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his perfume shop.

loans.name: Pudensiana

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Pudensiana R.. She is married and has three children with ages between 2 and 13.

In 2007, Pudensiana established her poultry business. She earns about US $170 every month from this business. Pudensiana requires a loan in order to purchase additional chicks and feed. In the future, Pudensiana plans to to increase the quantity and range of the stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed.

loans.name: Eufemio

texts.es:
Don Eufemio is 46 years old. He lives in the neighborhood Laureles Sur. He is married and his wife is a domestic employee and helps with the expenses of the household. He has 3 children, 15, 13, and 10 years old. Since he was very young, he worked as a bricklayer, an activity that has served to support his family. He has come to realize with much pleasure that after many years of working as a bricklayer he has come to love his work. Don Eufemio is asking for a loan in order to construct a wall in his house, and therefore be able to give better security to his home and to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Eufemio tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y su esposa es empleada doméstica y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13 y 10 años de edad. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la labor de albañil, actividad que le ha servido para el sustento de su familia, y que él mismo cuenta realiza con mucho gusto porque ya son muchos años trabajando de albañil que le ha tomado amor a su trabajo. Don Eufemio está solicitando el préstamo para construir una pared en su vivienda, y así poder darle mayor seguridad a su vivienda y a su familia.

loans.use: To build a home on the west side of his house

loans.name: Davlatali

texts.ru: Алихонов Давлатали проживает в городе Яван. Работает главным бухгалтером на предприятии ООО»Гаюр». Кроме того зарабатывает деньги путем занятием животводством. Имеет хозяйство где разводит КРС. Поэтому планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить комбикорм и сено. Это поможет ему своевременно откармливать животных и продавать хороших , откормленных бычков. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Davlatali A. lives in the city of Yavan. He works as the head accountant for the firm Gayur Ltd., but supplements his income by rearing livestock. Davlatali has a farm where he raises large-horned cattle, and plans to take out a loan to purchase feed and hay. This will aid him in both feeding his animals and selling well-fattened steers. He plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed

loans.name: Nasreen Tariq Masih's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is the wife of T. M. and lives in a small neighborhood named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. All of her children are in kindergarten. Nasreen baji's husband is a blacksmith. He makes iron boxes and door locks. He learned this art from his brother and started this work 15 years back. Nasreen baji is a housewife and also sews clothes for her neighbors. She charges $1 for one dress. Nasreen baji completed her education through10th standard [grade]. She dreams to see her children in good conditions. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and a Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more iron to expand her husband's business.

Nasreen baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy mason tools. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to complete her customers’ orders. Gogi baji wants a loan to buy electronic items (particularly televisions) to sell them on installments.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron for her husband to make more iron boxes and door locks

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos Mayela de 9, Everson de 7 y Marisol de 4. Se dedica a la venta de verduras de manera ambulatoria para poder sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, los cuales cursan sus estudios primarios y requieren cada vez de mucho más cosas y por ende de mayores gastos.
Lo que agradece Narcisa es que el negocio va progresando, haciendo que ella quiera expenderse mucho más, lo complicado está en que al ser la verduras alimentos perecibles, tiene que vender toda su mercadería en el día y no puede guardarla, haciendo que si le sobra mercadería la tenga que consumir ella misma, o dejar que perezca, lo cual sucede muy pocas veces, ya que en su mayoría termina la venta de todas las verduras. Narcisa se encuentra en el primer préstamo con MFP siendo ella una cliente muy puntual. Con el dinero comprará mayor cantidad de verduras para comercializar en su puesto.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a 30-year-old single mother of three, Mayela (9), Everson (7), and Marisol (4). She works as a street vendor selling vegetables in order to give her children a good start in life. They are currently in primary school and always need more and more things, which requires more spending. Narcisa would be grateful if her business could keep expanding, allowing her to sell much more. The problem is that since she sells perishable vegetables, she must sell all her products in one day and cannot store any. This means that she must consume all the leftover merchandise herself or leave it to spoil, which happens infrequently as she generally sells all of her vegetables. Narcisa is requesting her first loan from MFP and is a very punctual client. With the money she will buy more vegetables to sell from her cart.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Pho

texts.en: Mr. Pho C. is a villager in Dam Nak Ampil village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. His wife, Mr. Eng Phat, is a duck breeder. Since her duck business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Pho C. decided to request a loan to buy more ducklings and duck food for her breeding ducks business. He is 48 years old and the father of six children, three of whom are employed in different positions, while the remaining three are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings and duck food for the breeding ducks business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es: Juanita tiene 24 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres quienes se sienten muy orgullosos de tener una hija muy trabajadora. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales en la afueras de su vivienda, esto lo viene realizando desde hace 5 años atrás y le gusta estar en contacto directo con sus clientes para darles una buena atención. Este negocio le es rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada, y sus principales consumidores son los chóferes de los camiones de carga que tienen sus paraderos muy cerca. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y está comprometido con sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará la cantidad de fruta que vende, además de iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta  de comida.
texts.en:
Juanita is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents who are very proud of their hard-working daughter. She sells regional fruit in the area outside their home, which she has done for the past five years. She enjoys being in direct contact with her clients to provide the best customer service. Her business is profitable since she is located in a high transit area and her main clients are the truck drivers whose stops are nearby. This is her first loan with MFP and she has committed to making the payments. With the loan money she will increase the amount of fruit she has for sale as well as start a new food selling business.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of fruit for sale

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mr. Channy P. is a villager in Teuk Long village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Chhoeun Sreymom, sells firewood. Even though they work hard, they do not earn enough income to provide a better life for their family, which includes two young children.

In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Channy P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: LA FAMILIA DE LA SEGUNDINA ESTA COMPUESTA POR 3 MIEMBROS (ELLA Y DOS HIJOS) EL ESPOSO SE ENCUENTRA EN ARGENTINA, LOS HIJOS AUN SON DEPENDIENTES, SE ENCUENTRAN ESTUDIANDO. SEGUNDINA VIVE EN LA ZONA DE CRUCE TAQUIÑA. SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION Y ARREGLO DE TRAJES EN GENERAL, TIENE MUCHA EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO, TAMBIEN TIENE INSTALADO UN PUNTO INTERNET EN SU DOMICILIO. LO CUAL MEJORA SUS INGRESOS. LA COMPETENCIA DE SEGUNDINA ES MODERADA, YA QUE ELLA ES BIEN CONOCIDA POR LA HABILIDAD QUE TIENE PARA LA CONFECCION. TIENE CLIENTES ESTABLES QUE LE ENCARGAN TRAJES A MEDIDA (DAMAS). EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES, SEGUNDINA COMPRARA MATERIALES Y ACCESORIOS NECESARIOS PARA SU NEGOCIO. SE ENCUENTRA EN LA TERCERA SECUENCIA, EL ANTERIOR CREDITO TUVO UN RETRASO DE 1 DIA EN 30 CUOTAS. SE TRATA DE UNA PERSONA MUY RESPONSABLE.
texts.en:
Segundina's family has three members, herself and her two children. Her husband is in Argentina. Her children still live with her and go to school. She lives in the Cruce Taquiña neighborhood and earns her living making and altering dresses; she has a great deal of experience in her field. She also has an internet connection in her house, which increases her income. Segundina has only moderate competition, as she is well known for her dressmaking abilities. She has established clients, ladies who order custom-made dresses. Segundina plans to use her loan as working capital, to buy materials and accessories for her business. This will be her third loan. With her prior loan, out of 30 payments, she was one day late one time. She is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and to pay off her balance with Agrocapital

loans.name: Pacaycasa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Pacaycasa inicia el 18 ciclo con 19 socias, las socias son del distrito de Pacaycasa que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de verduras, cochinilla, tara, animales menores, abarrotes en general, comida, golosinas, frutas y fabricación de ladrillos artesanales.

Como es el caso de Victoria que es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Victoria vende golosinas en la puerta del colegio del distrito, actividad que realiza hace 4 años, además Victoria se dedica a la cosecha de tara de terrenos que alquila.

Por otro lado Aquilina es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Aquilina tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, además Aquilina se dedica a la crianza de cuy y cerdos. 

Mientras que Basilia es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Basilia vende golosinas y frutas de manera ambulatoria en la puerta del colegio. Además se dedica a la compra y venta de tara y cochinilla.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total de 11,100 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, tara, cochinilla, verduras, golosinas y para el pago del arriendo de los terrenos.

Los sueños de las socias son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, tener casa propia, construir su casa de material noble y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Pacaycasa bank is starting their 18th cycle with 19 members. The members come from the district of Pacaycasa, 30 minutes outside of the city of Ayacucho. The members have a variety of businesses such as the sale of vegetables, piglets, tara, small animals, general groceries, food, candies, fruit, and hand-made bricks. Victoria is in a common-law marriage; she is 34 years old and has three children. Victoria has been selling candies at the entrance of the local high school for four years. Victoria also harvests tara on land she leases. Aquilina is in a common-law marriage; she is 33 years old and has two children. Aquilina has a grocery store in her home and also raises pigs and guinea pigs. Basilia is married, 38 years old and has four children. Basilia sells candies and fruit in the street in front of the high school as well as buying and selling tara and piglets. The members need to borrow different amounts such as 300 soles, 600 soles and 900 soles for a total loan of 11,100 soles to the community bank. The loans will be used to buy rice, oil, noodles, tara, piglets, vegetables, candies and to pay for the rental of land. The members dream of giving their children a good education, of having homes of their own, of building their homes out of durable materials and of improving their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, noodles, tara, piglets, vegetables, candies,  and to pay to lease land.

loans.name: Asef

texts.en:
Asef H. has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never went without their daily bread. He is married and lives with his parents in one house. Asef has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a starting capital of $200, and thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise six years ago. Today this business has become domestic and his wife is also engaged in the business.

Now Asef needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase his range of goods for sale.  He is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices and to push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs to increase his range of goods for sale

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora A. is married with 3 children. She has received an education through primary school.

Dora has been a trader in Bosomtwe since 2006, selling foodstuffs such as rice, tomatoes and groceries. Her husband is also employed as a trader in the same area. Dora uses her income to help pay her family’s expenses, like utility bills and food.

Dora will use this loan to purchase to purchase additional provisions and food supplies for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business Dora plans to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase additional provisions and food supplies for resale

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.en:
K. Abdurasul is 47 years old, married and has two children. He and his wife work in a small farm. He has been a farmer since he was young and, now that he has a family, he is especially motivated to succeed. Abdurasul plants several hectares of potato, tomato and cucumber. He is happy with his work, especially since it is so profitable. As long as his farmland is well-tended, he can harvest all year long. His main difficulty is in dealing with insects that affect his crops. This is Abdurasul first loan from IMON International, and he wants to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his crops. The loan will greatly improve Abdurasul’s income and his family's living standard.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Señor Julio Velázquez de 41 años de edad esta casado hace 19 años con la señora Juana Caballero de 45 años, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos de 17 y 13 años de edad, el primero está en el primero de la media y el otro en el quinto  grado. 
El señor Julio hace siete años que se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas, también comercializa productos agrícolas como mandioca, batata, maíz y otros que el mismo produce porque el señor siempre se dedica a la agricultura, sus mercaderías la comercializa por la zona de Pastoreo y J. Eulogio Estigarribia para eso cuenta con un carrito movido a Caballo, ya cuenta con clientela formada a quien le provee en forma periódica sus productos. 
El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de cebolla, locote, tomate, papa, naranja, banana y en gran parte utilizarlo en la agricultura ya que él produce gran parte de lo que comercializa. De esta forma ofrecer variedad y calidad de sus productos  a sus clientes
texts.en:
Julio Velásquez, 41, has been married for nineteen years to Juana Caballero, 45. They have two children ages seventeen and thirteen. The first is in the first year of middle school, and the other is in fifth grade. For seven years Julio has been selling vegetables and fruits. He sells other agricultural products like cassava, yams, corn, and others that he grows himself. He has always been a farmer. He sells his merchandise in the Pastoreo and J. Eulogio Estigarribia zone. He uses a horse drawn cart to do this. He has a customer base that he periodically provides with his products. He is asking for a loan to buy onions, peppers, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges, bananas and to use primarily in his farming. He produces the biggest part of what he sells. This way he will offer his customers variety and quality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegtables like onions, peppers, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges, and  bananas

loans.name: Marie F.

texts.fr: Marie Françoise, 45 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Son activité est le commerce de tissu, ensembles et chaussures. Elle compte acheter des chaussures, des tissus d’art, du lin, confectionner des ensembles et vendre pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Marie Françoise, 45, is married and raising 5 children. Her business is selling cloth, outfits, and shoes. She expects to buy shoes, artistic cloth, and linen and make outfits to sell to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling cloth, outfits and shoes

loans.name: Hedy

texts.en:
Hedy S. is from the village of Labuyo in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 60 years old. Hedy is widow with four adult children. To make a living, Hedy provides motorcycle transport to local community members. Hedy has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hedy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hedy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to repair the motorcycle that she uses in her business. This will be Hedy's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living condiitons.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es: El Señor Félix Pedro Téllez tiene 44 años. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica  a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Su pequeño negocio, reúne a todos sus vecinos que llegan a disfrutar de una gaseosa o jugo muy helado, y a conversar en la compañía de Félix, además es un hombre que ha sabido administrar sus ingresos. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pollo, aceites, frijoles, gaseosas, jugos y golosinas en general. El sueño de Félix es que su esposa logre recuperarse totalmente para que el pueda salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Félix Pedro Téllez is 44. He has had a mini market for over five years. His business is located in his house. All of his neighbors get together at his market to enjoy a soft drink or chilled juice and chat with Félix. Félix is a man who has known how to manage his income. The loan is for working capital to buy chicken, oil, beans, soft drinks, juice, and sweets. Félix’s dream is for his wife to totally recuperate so that he can have a good future with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de mercerie, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2007 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé où elle exerce son activité cela lui permet d’être plus proche de sa clientèle et d’avoir une idée de l’évolution du marché. La demande actuelle de ses clients est élevée, pour les satisfaire, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour augmenter son stock par l’achat de divers articles de mercerie ainsi elle pourra satisfaire tous ses clients.
texts.en:
This is a lady who earns revenues from commerce in sewing supplies. She started this business in 2007 and stocks up at the grand marketplace of Lomé, where she operates her business. This enables her to be closer to her customers and to have an idea of changes in the market. The current customer demand is high. To satisfy it, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to increase her stock by buying various goods for sewing and tailoring. She will then be able to satisfy all her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is 46 years old and married with one daughter who is currently in college training to be a nurse. Dora works very hard to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader, running a provision store in her community. Dora buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for over fifteen years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Nor Agha Group

texts.en:
Nor Agha is the group leader of Nor Agha group. There are fore members in this group, each of whom wants to take a loan for expanding their business. There requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani. Sohelah wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy new machine for her business.
Nor Agha wants to take a loan for his business of vegetable. He wants to improve for his business. Rahella wants to take a loan for her husband who has electric materials shop.Ghancha Gull wants to take a loan for her business of quilted.   
So they are all very thanking for AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) and Kiva lenders who can support all worlds.

loans.use: their expand and progress for their business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Beatriz es soltera, tiene 49 años y 2 hijos, Beatriz tiene su tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, leña, además vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Beatriz necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, verduras.
Los sueños de Beatriz son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Communal Bank Anabella. Beatriz is single, 49 years old, and has two children. Beatriz has a store in her house where she sells groceries, wood, and also food. Her business is open everyday, and she runs it with the help of her children. Beatriz needs a loan of 2000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, and vegetables. Beatriz dreams that her children become professionals and also wishes to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of sugar, rice, and vegetables.

loans.name: Eugenia Genoveva

texts.es:
La señora EUGENIA GENOVEVA L. L. , tiene 65 años, vive en el distrito de SALPO , provincia de Otuzco, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 2do de primaria porque de niña se dedico a trabajar en el campo.
GENOVEVA es casada  y tiene 12  hijos todos  mayores quienes no dependen económicamente de ella, sino ella cuenta con el apoyo económico de ellos.
GENOVEVA se dedica a la compra y venta de leña así como también a la preparación y venta de pan.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de leña y harina.
Este crédito de 500 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra de leña , harina al por mayor, levadura, aceite y huevos al por mayor para la preparación del pan.
GENOVEVA sueña con aumentar la venta de leña y de pan para obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: compra de leña , harina al por mayor, levadura, aceite y huevos al por mayor

loans.name: El Vallecito Group

texts.es:
PEDRO OMAR S. S.; tiene 36 años D. edad, es soltero. Actualmente desempeña el cargo D. Secretario D. su grupo D. nombre “El Vallecito”.
El Sr. Pedro, es una persona dedicada a servir a los demás, y preocupado por brindar apoyo a las familias D. preferencia D. bajos recursos, mediante el servicio D. capacitación en diversos temas como derechos D. las personas, maltratos físicos y psicológicos, etc.
Junto a  4 personas más promocionan sus talleres, que en muchos casos son gratuitos.
Gracias a esta labor, él nos manifiesta que se siente realizado como persona, pero le gustaría seguir apoyando a los demás, por lo que se ha planteado como próxima meta a lograr en unos seis meses, si todo sale bien, implementar un Centro D. Servicios y Apoyo, que esté ubicado en una zona D. bajos recursos, que presenten casos D. mujeres maltratadas para poder ofrecer ayuda legal y psicológica.
El préstamo solicitado los destinará a la compra D. 3 computadoras usadas, las cuales servirán para implementar con equipos su proyecto del Centro D. Servicios.
texts.en:
Pedro Omar S. Sanches, 36, is single. He currently performs the duties of secretary of the El Vallecito Group. Pedro is a person who is dedicated to serving others. He is very concerned about offering support through loan services to families with scant resources. He is also concerned about diverse themes like human rights and physical and psychological abuse, etc. Together with four other people they promote their shops, which is many cases is free. Thanks to this labor, he says that he feels fulfilled as a person. But, he does not want to keep supporting others. Therefore, he has established his next goal, which is to be met in six months. If all goes well, he will set up a Center for Services and Support. It will be located in an area with scant resources where there are cases of women being mistreated. He will do this in order to offer them legal and psychological support. The loan he is asking for is to buy three used computers. They will serve to implement his Service Center project.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used computers

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es:
Argentina V. Ampie es una señora de 50 años de edad, quien vive,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada La Esperanza, localizada en San José de Upala, Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche) y agricultura. Vive con su esposo, dos hijas un nieto, un yerno y un hijo adoptado.

Doña Argentina se dedica a la agricultura, desde hace dos años específicamente a la siembra de platano. Dice que el mercado para este producto es muy bueno. Comenta que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento, además ha aumentado su autoestima y su seguridad.

En estos momentos doña Argentina desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢680,000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones, ya que quiere agrandar su siembra,así también darle el mantenimiento necesario y además comprar fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto poder incrementar la producción. 

Doña Argentina es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Mujeres la Esperanza; la cual está integrada solo por mujeres, ya que se especializa en apoyar a mujeres no profesionales y  jefas de hogar, es una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su quinto   préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Argentina V. Ampie is 50 years old and lives with her husband, two daughters, a grandson, a son-in-law, and an adopted son. She lives in the small rural Costa Rican community of La Esperanza, which is located in San José de Upala, Alajuela Province. The main business development activities in the area are cattle breeding (for both beef and milk) and agriculture.

Doña Argentina is a farmer, specifically growing bananas the past two years. She says the market for this product is very good. As a result of her work, Argentina’s living conditions have improved considerably. She also says she has grown as a person and has acquired much knowledge. In addition, her self-esteem has increased and she feels greater security.

At the moment, Doña Argentina hopes to expand her farm so she is requesting a microloan of 680,000 colones. In order to maintain her latest crop of bananas, she will purchase fertilizers and other supplies. Argentina expects a good harvest from this investment. This crop usually commands a high selling price, so she wants to increase her production.

Doña Argentina is a member of the Women’s Community Credit Enterprise of La Esperanza, which is composed solely of women. This microfinance institute specializes in supporting women who are heads of households but not professionals. It is one of 100 partner organizations that comprise EDESA in Costa Rica. This is Argentina’s fifth loan and she hopes to continue growing personally and financially. She is also an active participant of her local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & supplies to maintain her banana crop

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.en:
The Mujeres Alegres Group is a committee of women dedicated to investing in their businesses to grow profits and improve productivity. All women in the group use their loans to invest in their businesses, such as selling clothing, dressmaking and tailoring, selling food and delivering groceries, running kiosks and pantries. The amount received by each woman varies from 1,000,000 Gs to 1,400,000 Gs.

Maria D. P. T. Gonzalez-T. sells clothing. 
M. Blanca D. G. sells vegetables. 
Gloria B. C. S. owns a kiosk.
Delia G. A. Lopez is a tailor.
R. G. Pabla Rivers owns a pantry.
Victorine S. sells groceries. 
Martina S. owns a kiosk.
Beatriz C. Lucila F. sells vegetables. 
Aurora Concepcion V. N. has a pantry. 
Felipe G. T. sells clothing.
Ana Noemi S. B. sells food.
Delia V. C. N. owns a pantry.
Fatima B. M. S. sells clothing.
Alexandrina D. G. sells groceries.
Maria T. Lopez Acuna is a tailor.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen D. C. is from the village of Roxas Avenue Extension in Iligan City. She is 45 years old. Helen is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Helen sells used oil in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Helen's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is 35 years old and married with four children. She is a Bini by tribe but she lives and works in Benin City, Edo State. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Blessing is a friendly woman. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers and with these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members. She hopes to own a world-class supermarket in the future.

Blessing needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 33 años, es una madre muy amorosa y cariñosa. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Mariano, de 45 años, y a sus 2 hijos: Yesenia de 14 y Rolando de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Hace un año, con los ahorros que logró reunir de su restaurante pudo comprar un auto bus, el cual puso a trabar inmediatamente como un medio de transporte local. Aunque éste le genera muy buenos ingresos, Marcelina sabe que no puede dejar de lado el restaurante que tanto le ha ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida, es por eso que todavía sigue satisfaciendo a sus clientes con los deliciosos menús que prepara.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que atender a sus clientes, ya que casi siempre su restaurante está lleno. 
Para más adelante, espera implementar mejor su restaurante, ya que desea brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Marcelina con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo si no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en el cual es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingrediente para elaborar sus sabrosos almuerzos.
texts.en:
33-year old Marcelina is a loving and affectionate mother. She lives in her own home with her 45-year old husband Mariano and their two children, Yesenia (14 years) and Rolando (3 years). The children are the reason for all their hard work. A year ago, with the savings Marcelina had managed to accumulate from her restaurant, she was able to buy a bus which she put to work immediately as local transport. Although the bus generates a good income, Marcelina knows that she can't set aside the restaurant which has also helped her improve her quality of life. So she still continues to please her customers with the delicious food she prepares. What she most enjoys about her work is the cooking which she does with much care. She’s been doing this work for six years. The most difficult part is finding the time to serve her customers as the restaurant is almost always full. In the future she hopes to better equip the restaurant as she wants to provide her customers with better service. This is Marcelina’s third loan with Kiva partner MFP. She knows that she has to make all her repayments on time if she doesn’t want to cause problems for the members of the community bank. She is well-like there for her happy approach to life. With the S/. 1500 she plans to buy more ingredients for the tasty lunches she cooks.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the food she cooks

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Rice farming is the main source of income for Romeo, 42. He has two children; the eldest is 20. He said that in his business, he makes a profit but sometimes it's just enough to provide for their daily needs. He does not have enough capital to provide farm supplies. He joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, and requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will enable him to operate his business well and have a good harvest in the future.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Tusuubira Mobilizers Group 2, Kampala

texts.en: K. Fred is the leader of his lending group in Kampala. He is a hardworking and friendly man who is married with five children aged 9, 5, 4, 3, 3.6 and 1 years-old and he takes care of two other dependants. For the last eight years, Fred has had a dry cleaning business in Makindye from which he is able to make 200,000/= a week profit although he faces challenges with electricity problems and limited capital. One of his reasons for success is that he is caring to his customers and has good time management therefore winning his customers’ trust. He hopes to develop his dry cleaner business and educate all his children to higher levels. Fred needs a loan to be able to buy an additional washing machine to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy another washing machine.

loans.name: Fredis Antonio

texts.es: Fredis Antonio F.
texts.en: Fredis Antonio F.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: María Haydee

texts.es:
En el Mercado Iván Montenegro en Managua, la señora María Haydee S. tiene su propia pulpería o distribuidora que atiende a diario desde muy temprano ofreciendo todo tipo de productos principalmente productos comestibles que vende en su localidad.

Actualmente ella está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de comestibles como queso, cuajada y crema por la razón de que actualmente se le ha agotado y necesita continuar ofertándolo en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
María Haydee S. has her own grocery store in Managua's Iván Montenegro market. She is open for business daily from very early in the morning and stocks all kinds of products, primarily food items. She is asking for funding to buy food items like: cheese, cuajada (milk curd), and cream because she has run out of these items and needs to continue stocking them in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock dairy products.

loans.name: Nema

texts.en:
Because of low educational attainment due to low economic status, Nema M. and her husband were not able to get good-paying jobs. Therefore, they were not able to support the needs of their three children, especially the financial need to sustain their education until college. Therefore, the same thing happened to their children: they are now 22 to 26 years old and are working as laborers. Nema’s eldest and youngest children are fishermen while her middle and only daughter works as a housemaid. As a mother, Nema felt sad for the lack of achievement by her children. However, despite the hard work her children do every day, they are still happy and are enjoying their lives with their parents.

When Nema joined ASHI in 2006, she and her family were very happy. With the opportunity to receive a loan, their family can have a business that everybody can work in and have earnings from. Since Nema’s two sons are into fishing, Nema decide to support them financially by using the loan from ASHI to make their business grow and become profitable. Now, Nema is requesting for a much larger loan because she wants to purchase a motorboat for her sons to manage. She is the one who sells their fish to people in their village and in the market.

Nema hope that one day their business will be profitable and sustainable enough for her only daughter to work with her in trading their fish instead of working as a housemaid, for which she receives only a very small salary.

loans.use: To purchase a motorboat for fishing.

loans.name: Fausate

texts.en:
Fausate sells foodstuffs like garri, rice and more for a living in Lagos. She is 40 years old, a widow with 4 children. She lost her husband some years back and since then she takes care of her children alone. She is very hard working and hopes to give the children the best in life. She has been in the business for over 10 years.
Fausate wants more stock in her shop in order to make more sales and profit. She is requesting for the loan amount of NGN50, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Jappo Liggey Asf N°5 Group

texts.fr:
Jappo Ligguey (asf)  est une association mixte composée de plusieurs personnes microentrepreuneuses. Elle a été créée en 2009 par un groupe de femmes pour  rassembler  tous leurs  paires  du  quartier  Angle Serigne Fallou  (asf) autour d’un même idéal  « l’entraide  pour travailler ». Elle est dirigée par Madame Marie Ndiaye Diouf et  est scindée en plusieurs sous groupes de 5 sous l’influence de l’agent de crédit de la caisse Moda Kane pour  que tous  les membres  puissent  bénéficier mieux des services d’U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que certains sous groupes ont déposé leur demande de crédit de 500 000 FCFA qu’ils vont se partager en part égale. 
Quant au  sous Jappo Liggey asf n°5, elle est gérée par la présidente Madame Saly S.. C’est une femme mariée qui s’active dans le commerce du couscous qu'elle prépare elle-même depuis 2006. Elle compte avec sa part du prêt, ses 100 000 FCFA,  renforcer son activité en approvisionnant en matières premières pour le couscous. Elle veut acheter du mil, maïs, arachide etc . Ainsi ce prêt va lui permettre de renouveler ses stocks afin de mieux tirer profit de son business.
Pour les autres membres du sous groupe, ce prêt leurs permet de renforcer leurs activités. Elles sont entre autres :
 La trésorière Madame Fatma Koné s’active dans le  commerce de la friperire depuis 2 ans. 
Madame Khady M. vendeuse de prêts à porter au marché central de Thiès depuis 2 ans.
 Madame Magatte M.  qui vend du petit déjeuner et diner dans la devanture de sa maison, il y'a tout juste 1 an.Et Madame Fatou M. qui gère depuis 5 ans sa boutique d'alimentation générale

loans.use: Get supplies of various goods

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres que esta ubicada en la zona alto Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora es empleada de supermercados Ketal y en su tiempo libre se dedica  a realizar masitas (repostería).
El crédito solicitado es para un capital de trabajo (compra de harina, huevos, levadura, etc.) para la elaboración de masas para pan y galletas y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sonia is single and lives with her parents in the Obispo Bosque highland zone of the city of La Paz. She is employed by Ketal supermarkets and in her free time she makes pastries to sell. The loan Sonia solicits is for purchasing flour, eggs, yeast, etc., to make bread and cookie dough and, thus, to increase her income. This is the first occasion in which she has requested a loan and our socioeconomic analysis finds her qualified and eligible for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING FLOUR, EGGS, YEAST AND OTHER INGREDIENTS FOR HER PASTRY BUSINESS

loans.name: Natividad Julia

texts.es:
La señora Natividad Julia L. A., se dedica a echar tortillas para salir adelante, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas para la palmeada, es soltera, sus hijas viven con ella pero no dependen de ella ya son casadas, habita en el barrio Camilo Ortega, y ella solo trabaja para su manutención.

La señora Natividad solicito crédito con CEPRODEL, para compra de quintal de maíz y leña, ya que no contaba con capital suficiente, lleva ya 28 créditos los cuales los ha pagado en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
Ms. Natividad Julia L. A. works making tortillas to get ahead. She has the help of her daughters who assist her in shaping the tortillas by hand. She is single and her daughters live with her, although they do not depend on her since they are already married. She lives in the Camilo Ortega neighborhood and supports herself by her own work. Natividad applied for a loan with CEPRODEL for the purchase of a quintal of corn and firewood, since she did not have sufficient capital. She has had now 28 loans which she has paid back promptly and in the appropriate fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic materials (corn, firewood)

loans.name: Noch

texts.en: Mrs. Noch D. is a 33-year-old married woman and is a villager who lives in Ta Toem village, Takeo province. She is a grocery seller in the local village who owns a small store as a business and with this business, she is able to earn a small income to help support her family. For this business, Mrs. Noch D. decided to ask for a loan to buy Khmer cheese and more groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sokha Nun is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on and also helps his wife's business. This couple has two children, who are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy Khmer cheese and more groceries to resell

loans.name: Floravelia

texts.en:
Floravelia B. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old, married and has three infant-aged children.  To make a living, Floravelia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  Floravelia has been in business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Floravelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Floravelia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be the first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

-------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gabino Antonio

texts.es:
Gabino de 32 años de edad es soltero, no tiene hijos, trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 1 año, desempeñandose como ayudante de albañil. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto en la casa de su papá, para asi contar con mayor privacidad y poder teniendo condiciones para cuando forme su propia familia.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder tener su casa con las mejores condiciones y estudiar.
texts.en:
Gabino is 32 years old and he is single with no kids. He has worked in the city hall of Juigalpa for the past year as an assistant laborer. He requests a loan with the plan of building a room of his own, in his father’s house. He hopes to gain some privacy and to be ready for a family of his own. His greatest dream is to have a house with better living conditions, and he dreams of going to school.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom.

loans.name: Odalia Alexandra

texts.es:
Odalia Alexandra, tiene 22 años.  Es soltera y vive con los padres. No tiene  hijos. 

Odalia es una socia de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.
Odalia se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener cinco cuadras de cacao. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en le cogollo.

Le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Odalia Alexandra is 22 years old. She is single and she lives with her parents. She has no children. Odalia is a member of the rural community of San Jose de los Amarillos. The group is made up of 23 members and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they seek from the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Odalia is an agriculturist and she has corn plantations. She carries out her purchases every month in the city of Ventanas and she sells her product in the same city. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of corn seeds. She sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to have five blocks of cocoa fields. The challenges she faces are pests and blights, especially langosta moths. She enjoys resting.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will buy building materials and supplies like: gravel, sand, cement and iron rods to start building concrete walls and have a better home for her children.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
