Mrs. Khiev M. was born in 1984. She lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chatha Toem, is a taxi driver who is able to earn some money to support his family.

She has a problem because her field is infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Khiev M. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. With the rest of the loan she will hire farm laborers and a plow to plow her field.

Mrs. Khiev M. has a two-year-old child. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Aygul

texts.en:
Aygul O. is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  Since childhood, Aygul has been fond of sewing and her dream of becoming a designer led her to get a job as a seamstress at the state knitted goods factory. She gained wide experience in this activity and became a team leader of a sewing workshop.   In 1996, within the period of breakdown in the Soviet Union, she lost her job.  Aygul and her family went through some difficult times with little money and no house, but they did not give up and made every effort to improve their living conditions. Aygul, being a very persistent and hardworking woman, borrowed a sum of 8,000 KGS and began her business in clothes selling. Her start as an entrepreneur was successful due to her strong efforts. She managed to rent a sales point at the local market and raise her floating capital to 60,000 KGS. Her activity was marked by her designer's approach and personal advice to every client. 

In 2009, in order to broaden her business, Aygul obtained her first loan of 20,000 KGS from Bai Tushum and Partners, which was repaid without any delays. Now  Aygul is requesting a loan of 40,000 KGS to expand the range of products in her shop. She hopes that the loan will help her increase revenue. In the future, Aygul wants to buy a car for her  family.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that leads to increased employment and meets the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Pel

texts.en:
Pel N. is a 56-year-old married man and father. He lives with other family members in his own small family home in Kompong Chhnang Province. His wife is also helps him in this field. The couple is married and have two children. He owns a piece of land that he inherited from his grandmother. Pel grows different kinds of crop on his land, such as cabbage and morning glorys. 

Pel N. has also raised a few of piglets and he had hoped to sell them to buyers three months after he began raising them. Unfortunately, the pigs are not big enough, due to the lack of food. To help solve this problem, San Naun has requested a loan that he will use to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten his pigs. He will use the rest of the loan towards purchasing more pigs.

loans.use: To buy sacks of pig feed to fatten his pigs. He will use rest of the loan towards purchasing more pigs.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana A. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 41 years old. Bibiana is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Bibiana raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Bibiana has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Bibiana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Bibiana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. Bibiana is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Bibiana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena P. is from the city of P-7 Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old and is married. To make a living, Lucena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling used clothes in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lucena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lucena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es: La Sra. Dalia es una madre soltera que debido a su situación económica-social se ha tenido que dedicar al servicio del transporte urbano, ya que cuenta con un hijo de 7 años de edad y por lo tanto alguien por quien seguir adelante, doña Dalia vive en casa familiar y cuenta con todo el apoyo de su madre quien es la dueña de casa. Doña Dalia a venido trabajando desde ya hace bastante tiempo en el rubro del transporte y por lo tanto a aprendido a detectar las épocas de bastante movimiento; debido a eso y a cierta mejoras que son necesarias en su vehículo es que ella se acercó a nuestra institución a solicitar un crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su vehículo y que la ayude a poner a su vehículo al 100% para estas fechas donde el movimiento vehicular aumenta,  por tal motivo no se le negó dicho préstamo, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo bridado.
texts.en:
Dalia is a single mother.  Due to her socioeconomic situation she has had to go into urban public transportation services.  She has a 7 year old son for whom she strives to get ahead in life.

Dalia lives in a house belonging to a relative and has all the support from her mother who is the owner of the house.

Dalia has been working for a long time now in transportation so she is able to detect times of high usage.  Because of this she has noticed that her vehicle is in need of repairs.  

She approached out institution to request a loan for vehicle maintenance and repair so that it will be back to 100% efficiency during these times when vehicular traffic increases. 

Due to this the loan was not denied.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Enilda Del Carmen

texts.es: Enilda es una mujer muy cristiana, tiene una Hija de 12 años con quien  vive, ademàs de su madre, hermana y dos adorables sobrinos. Enilda es una profesional que aplica sus conocimientos a sus multiples  negocios, en los cuales se mueve en compañía de su hermana y su madre, como son el de elaborar productos congelados como deditos, empanaditas,  bolitas de carne  y demàs pasabocas , que empaca cuidadosamente y que forman parte de los productos que consumen sus clientes durante eventos como reuniones familiares, de amigos de profesionales y de filiales de su iglesia, en la cual pariticipa activamente. Enilda como es una mujer inquieta, tambien trabaja en una empresa estatal por contrato y de manera estacionaria, haciendo investigaciones estadisticas y asi mismo se dedica a vender mercancia de acuerdo a la temporada;  algunas veces ella y su hermana fabrican calzado y lo venden, otras veces compran perfumes, ropa y otros productos cosmèticos para lograr la sostenibilidad de su negocio, pero  Enilda siempre està en funciòn de mejorar como persona,  como empresaria, como miembro de familia y de su comunidad. Con su credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento comprarà ropa y productos cosmèticos, pero ademàs invertira en harina de trigo y sus componentes, para elaborar productos derivados de esta. Su sueño y gran desafio es que su pequeña hija logre estudiar y ser una profesional exitosa, con conocimientos de muchos idiomas para que la prosperidad siempre la acompañe y tambien tener  un gran almacen, donde los clientes siempre que la busquen , encuentren todo lo que ellos necesitan y deseen. Mientras tanto vive agradecida con Dios por su comunidad cristiana y por su gran familia,  que tambien han sido grandes forjadores de recursos para su hogar compartido con ellas.
texts.en:
Enilda is a very Christian woman.  She has a daughter, 12 years of age, with whom she lives along with her mother, sister and two adorable cousins.  Enilda is a professional who applies her know-how to her multiples businesses, in which she works in company with her sister and their mother.  The businesses include making frozen products such as 'fingers', patties, and pellets of meat and also appetizers, that she packs carefully and that form part of the products that their clients consume during events such as meetings of family, friends, professionals and subsidiaries of their church, in which she is an active participant.  
Enilda is a restless woman.  She also works in a state business on contract and in an office, doing state investigations and at the same time she is dedicated to selling seasonal merchandise.  Sometimes she and her sister manufacture footwear and sell it.  Other times they buy perfumes, clothes and cosmetic products to achieve sustainability for their business.  Enilda is always working to improve herself as a person, a businesswoman, a member of family and of their community.  With this loan, which is her first, she will buy clothing and cosmetics, and also wheat flour and other ingredients to make food products.  Her dream and greatest challenge is that her small daughter manage to study and to be a successful professional, with know-how of many languages so that prosperity always accompanies her.  She would also like to have a well-stocked store, where the clients are provided with whatever they seek and can find everything that they need and desire.  In the meantime she lives thanks to God, her Christian community and her  great family, that have also been great foragers of resources for the home that she shares with them.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and other items such as clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité est crée le 14/05/2010.il est composé de 11 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Elles font partie des promoteur du Banc Villageois de FONK SA BOPP GRAND LOUGA qui abrite leur groupe

KHADY D. debout à droite de sur la photo avec une écharpe blanche en bandoulière est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de poisson frais. En parallèle elle vend des habits et chaussures 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer ses activités afin de réaliser des bénéfices plus importants que dans le passé.

Elle soutien son mari dans le payement de la scolarité des enfants. Progressivement elle se procure de meuble pour sa maison
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on 5/14/10. It is made up of 11 women from the same area, who came together as friends and neighbors. 

Their group belongs to the Banc Villageois "Fonk Sa Bopp Grand Louga." Kady D., standing on the right of the photo wearing a white wrap, is the group's leader. She is  46 years old, married and the mother of 6 dependent children. Kady runs a small business selling fresh fish, and she also sells clothes and shoes.  Her new loan will allow her to strengthen these activities in order to make more profit than before. She helps her husband in paying for the children's schooling. Little by little, she is also looking for furniture for her house.

loans.use: To buy fish to re-sell

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. Petrona del Carmen L. se dedica a la elaboracion de rosquillas, tustacas y quesadillas actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación con ayuda de sus hijas, su producto los distribuye en diferentes negocios de la ciudad de El Paraíso Y Danlí, sus rosquillas tienen una gran demanda son caracterizadas por su sabor y lo crujientes que son, esta es su principal fuente de ingresos que doña Petrona Posee.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las rosquillas, tustacas y quesadillas.
Petrona es una mujer emprendedora y con espíritu de superación, a tenido que luchar sola para darle la crianza y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Petrona del Carmen L. makes rosquillas (a doughnut shaped cracker), tustacas (a type of corn cake with sugar) and quesadillas. She makes these in her home with the help of her daughters. She distributes her product to different businesses in the cities of El Paraiso and Danli. Her rosquillas are in high demand. They are characterized by their flavor and how crunchy they are. This is the main source of income for Petrona. 

She will use this loan to buy materials to make her rosquillas, tustacas and quesadillas. 

Petrona is an enterprising woman with a spirit to overcome difficulties. She has had to fight on her own to raise and educate her children.

loans.use: Purchase cheese, corn, wood, lard, brown sugar and cinnamon.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily L. is from the village of Amoyong, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 51 years old. Emily is married and has 4 adult children. 

To make a living, Emily owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetics, detergents & beauty products from PERSONAL CARE, to the local community. Emily has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Emily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Emily is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like lotions & colognes. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emily from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and personal products to sell

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is a married woman with seven children, four of whom attend school while three have already graduated. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Bendera faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the 40,000 KES loan she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy, tiene 41 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, nació en la ciudad de Cusco y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad. Eloy es albañil y trabaja de forma independiente, él realiza los trabaja a todo costo y después de terminar la obra cobra por la mano de obra y por los materiales que utilizó. Eloy en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como por ejemplo cemento, pintura, madera, clavos, focos y otras cosas más. El sueño de Eloy es abrir una empresa constructora.     

Eloy pertenece al banco comunal “Inti Pakareq” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Eloy is 41 years old and has two children. He was born in the city of Cusco where he still lives. Eloy is a brick mason and works independently. He covers all the costs of a construction project, then collects for labor and materials when the work is done.

Eloy requires a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, paint, lumber, nails, and lights. His dream is to one day have his own construction company.

Eloy belongs to the “Inti Pakareq” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity provided by this organization, and promises to make his payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Gnogondeme Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe GNOGONDEME sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Siékourani un des villages de la commune de Loulouni, préfecture de Kadiolo (Sikasso) 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les trois prêts précédents  se sont bien dénoués.
MARIAM O. fait l’achat vente de riz dans ce groupe de femmes GNOGONDEME. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  200kg de grains de riz. Elle s’approvisionne à Siékourani et dans les villages environnants.
Elle les revend au  marché du village et de la ville de Loulouni, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The ten members of the GNOGONDEME group are married women.  They are, on average,  40 years old and have four children.  They live mostly in polygamous families in Siékourani, one of the villages of the Loulouni commune, in the Kadiolo (Sikasso) prefecture, the third administrative region of Mali. 
They are on their fourth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of being able to meet the needs of their customers.  The previous three loans have all been properly repaid.
Mariam O., one of the women in the GNOGONDEME group, buys and sells rice.
She plans to buy 200 kg of rice with her loan.  She gets her supplies in Siékourani and in the neighboring villages.
She sells the rice for cash at the village market in the city of Loulouni to a clientele of men and women.
She foresees earning an average monthly benefit of 22,500 FCFA.  A part of this will be used to pay the loan and interest, and the rest will go into savings.
She aspires to increase her turnover to be better able meet the needs of her clients.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Edita Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres 13 De Septiembre, esta ciudad es conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época.

En este lugar conocimos la señora Edita, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y el menor tiene 15 años y estudia en colegio. El marido es taxista.
 
Ella es licenciada en enfermera y trabaja en un dispensario del seguro campesino, también se dedica a la venta de productos de la marca Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), productos para el hogar, zapatos y lencería. Trabaja todos los días, ella vende en su trabajo, en las tardes y fines de semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días. Lo que más vende es la ropa intima de mujer que son muy solicitadas por las damas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es alquilado.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres 13 de Septiembre” (13th of September Women) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, a city known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the large amount of this fruit that existed there back then.

We met Edita, 44, here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three children, two adults and the youngest who is 15 years old and going to school.  Her spouse is a taxi driver.

She is a Nurse and works at a clinic run by farmer’s insurance; she also sells Avon brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories), home products, shoes and lingerie.  She works every day.  She sells her products afternoons and on weekends.  She sells on credit and collects weekly or biweekly.  What she sells the most is women’s lingerie which is highly sought after by the ladies.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and underwear.  It’s her fourth cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to do.

Her dream is to have her own house because she currently is renting.

loans.use: to buy creams, cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 4 Group

texts.en:
Antonia lives in Hato Mayor, one of the country’s more rural cities whose economy depends on agriculture. Antonia and her group of five members are taking loans for their businesses. Most of them sell clothes and miscellaneous products. This group is named Fuerza Divina 4 (Divine strength).

This is Antonia´s 11th loan with Esperanza International after she successfully repaid her previous loans, each of which gave her one more step toward improving her business and her life. She said that she has been able to start building her house, which was one of her most difficult challenges. Now her home is in the building process, thanks to these loans, her savings and profits from her business.

Antonia runs a miscellaneous products sales business. She will invest this loan to buy accessories and underwear to sell. She has had her business for over five years, starting when she received her first Esperanza loan. 

She says that her favorite thing is to work on her business and she wants to see her children become professionals. Antonia and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy underwear and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Jose Carlos Emguelber

texts.es:
José, reside en  Alegría departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de plantas, vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad, el negocio inicio por su propia cuenta y trata sobre la compra y venta de plantas, lo tiene ubicado en su propia casa, desde hace 12 años, no tiene un horario para atender a los clientes.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de plantas caseras, Árboles frutales y semilla para cultivarlas, el préstamo le servirá para surtir el vivero, ofrecer a los clientes una mayor diversidad de plantas.
Sus sueños es ampliar el negocio, ser capaz de abastecer las necesidades de los clientes, y continuar con mucho empeño en el desarrollo como microempresario.
texts.en:
Jose lives in Alegria of the department of Usulutan. He sells plants. He lives with his wife and their children, aged 8 and 4. He started his business by his own account and it involves the buying and selling of plants. He has the business in his own house for 12 years and he doesn't have a fixed schedule when he attends his clients. 

He requests a loan to purchase household plants, fruit trees, and seeds for cultivation. The loan will help him to stock his greenhouse and to offer his clients a wider variety of plants.

His dreams are to expand his business and to be able to meet the needs of his clients. He is also committed to continue developing himself as a small business owner.

loans.use: to purchase household plants, fruit trees, and seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.en:
Safarmo is married and the loving mother of her two children. Her husband is a master. 

Safarmo works hard to provide for her family. At the present time, she has her own place at the market where she sells children’s clothes and manufactured goods. 

She has been in this business for six years and she would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase new children’s clothes. She thanks all lenders who will support her and allow her to increase the assortment of her goods as this will attract more customers. 
   
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Malick Fall Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé depuis le 11 mai 2010 veille de l'inauguration de son Banc Villageois d'appartenance. Il est composé de vingt femmes qui habitent le quartier, elles sont parentes et amies; la principale activité que mène le groupe est le petit commerce.

Madame Ndeye Lissa la responsable est âgée de 28 ans, mariée elle a un enfant en charge. Elle est couturière avec cinq ans d'expérience. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en corsage blanc avec un pagne multicolore tenant un châle noir dans sa main gauche.

Ndeye Lissa achète ses tissus et accessoires nécessaires pour la couture dans la capitale et les grandes villes confectionne des draps qu'elle revend au marché hebdomadaire du village.

son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité pour satisfaire la demande et gagner plus de revenus.

Elle ambitionne d'acheter une villa pour y loger sa grand mère;les dépenses de la famille et ses besoins personnels sont à la charge du mari qui veut assurer de bonnes conditions de vie.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Malick solidarity group was created on May 11, 2010, the day before the inauguration of the "Banc Villageois" to which it belongs. It is composed of twenty women who live in the neighborhood; they are friends and family. The group's main activity is retail.

Mrs. Lissa, the group's leader, is 28 years old. She is married and has one dependent child. She is a seamstress with five years of experience. She is standing on the right of the picture, dressed in a white blouse with a multicolored "pagne" and holding a black scarf in her left hand.

Lissa purchases fabrics and the accessories necessary for sewing in the Capital and in big cities. She sews bed sheets which she sells at the village's weekly market.

Her loan will allow her to strengthen her activity to meet the demand and earn higher revenues.

Her ambition is to buy a villa to house her grandmother. The family's expenses and her personal needs are provided for by her husband, who wants to guarantee them good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sew bed sheets for retail.

loans.name: Alejandrina Bernardina

texts.es: La señora alejandrina tiene 49 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 21, 18, y 11 años de edad solo el de 11 años esta en la escuela, su esposo trabaja como obrero de construcción civil, alejandrina se dedica a vender productos de belleza de casa en casa teniendo clientes eventuales  y con los ingresos de dicha actividad apoya en los gastos de su familia, alejandrina viene realizando esta labor hace mas de 2 años, el dinero del préstamo será invertido en comprar mas productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas, talcos, joyas entre otras cosas, y también una vitrina para poder mostrar dichos productos, su sueño en el futuro es hacer crecer mas su negocio para que así le genere mayores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida, alejandrina esta muy contenta con el apoyo que se esta brindando.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandrina is 49 years old, married, and has three children (ages 21, 18, and 11). Only her 11-year-old is still in school. Her husband is a construction worker. Alejandrina sells beauty products house-to-house to her regular customers. With the income she earns, she is able to help with the family expenses. Alejandrina has been in this line of work for more than two years.

The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of more beauty products such as perfumes, crèmes, talcum powders, jewelry, and other items. She will also purchase a display cabinet in order to showcase her products. Her dream for the future is to grow her business so that she can generate more income and have a better quality of life. Alejandrina is very pleased with the support that has been provided.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, crèmes, talcum powders, jewelry, a display cabinet, and other items.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is 30 years old, married and has two children aged ten and one. In 2002, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, Shanti supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Kiva partner, Patan Business and Professional Women, and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her shop. In the future, Shanti plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La Sra. Justina está casada con el Sr. Mariano, son padres D. 7 hijos, están domiciliado en Ciudad del Este.
La Sra. Justina tiene casa propia, donD. realiza la venta D. bebidas  para el Barrio, está dedicada a este rubro a varios años, debido a que cuenta con una cancha donD. se realizan deportes al lado D. su casa, mediante la cual tiene una demanda fija D. algunos moradores y vecinos.
Ella manifiesta que tiene mucha demanda por lo cual le gustaría poder aumentar la cantidad D. bebidas que tiene. Ella solicita el credito para la compra D. bebidas como ser cervezas, gaseosas, energizantes y demás.
texts.en: Justina and her husband Mariano have 7 children. They live in Ciudad del Este. Justina has her own home, where she sells drinks in her neighbourhood. She has stayed in this area for several years because there is a sports field next door, which makes customers of her neighbours and other locals. Justina is dealing with high demand, so she would like to carry a better variety of drinks. She has applied for a loan so that she can buy more beer, soda, energy drinks, etc.

loans.use: buy soda, energy drinks, beer, wine, whisky, etc.

loans.name: Lelia Orfelia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Lelia tiene 72 años  de edad, está separada hace varios años pero de esta relación tuvo 7 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad y que ya son independientes. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque sus compañeras son como su familia ya que siempre están allí cuando las necesita.

Ella para poder subsistir y tener para sus gastos  hace varios años puso un pequeño bar en su casa en el cual  vende aguas, sodas, energizantes, hielo, cervezas, entre otras bebidas, ella aprovecha que frente a su casa se reúnen todos los días personas que llegan a hacer deporte pues allí hay unas canchas de fooball y de voleibol, nos cuenta que esto lo hacen todos los días por las tardes, además también ella prepara deliciosos helados de frutas, nos cuenta que lleva haciendo esto por más de diez años y que gracias a Dios esto le ha servido para sus gastos ya que es una persona que vive sola.

Este crédito es para comprar sodas, aguas, cervezas, hielo, entre otras cosas.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y que esto le de lo necesario para sus gastos.
texts.en:
The loan group called “María Auxiliadora” meets every two weeks in the “La Squita” parish of Montecristi, a settlement known as the crib of the old wrestler, Eloy Alfaro.  It’s also known for its straw hats that are appreciated within and outside the country.

Here we meet Lelia.  She is 72 years old and has been separated for various years, but she has seven children, all adults and on their own now.  She’s been with the group since the beginning and she enjoys it because her fellow members are like her family and are there for her when she needs them.

A few years ago she opened a small pub in her home so that she could make money to pay her expenses.  She sells water, soda, energy drinks, ice, and beer, among other drinks.  She takes advantage of the fact that people meet each day across the street to play sports, where there are soccer fields and volleyball courts.  She tells us that they do this every evening.  She also makes delicious frozen treats.  She tells us that she’s been doing this for more than ten years and thanks to God this has helped her with her expenses because she lives alone.

She will use the money from this loan to buy sodas, water, and ice among other things.  She wants to continue ahead with her business and hopes that it will continue to provide for her expenses.

loans.use: to stock her pub.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Doña Juana se dedica a la venta de tortilla, y cosa de hornos con mas de cinco años, trabajando para el bien comun de la familia, su esposo labora como operario, y sus hijos cursan la primaria.
Juana ha venido mejorando su casa con prestamo en Afodenic, el cual ha sido de gran sastifaccion ya que ha avanzado bastante poco a poco en tres ciclos. en la construccion de un cuarto, aumento su porche y sigue mejorando.
Con este nuevo prestamo podra hacaer su baño para lograr mejor condicion de higiene como mejor aseo personal. Comprara materiales como: perlines, arena, laminas de zinc, bloques y cemento logrando terminar la obra.
texts.en:
Juana has been selling tortillas and baked goods for five years.  She is working for the common good of her family.  Her husband works as an operator, and her children are in elementary school.  

Juana has been improving her house with loans from Afodenic.  It has been very satisfying because she has, little by little, made good progress in three cycles.  She has built a room, expanded her porch, and she continues to make improvements.

With this new loan she will be able to construct a bathroom in order to obtain improved hygienic conditions and better personal care.

She will buy materials like crossbeams, sand, zinc metal sheeting, cement blocks, and cement to finish the work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a bathroom in order to obtain improved hygienic conditions and better personal care.

loans.name: Namaskali's Group

texts.en:
Namaskali is the leader of this group. She is 62 years old and is unfortunately a widow. She has raised a daughter and two sons.  Her daughter and older son live separately from their mom, and the second son, 13, is studying at a local school. 

Namaskali works as a cleaner.  Her monthly salary is 2000 soms. In order to earn additional money to meet their daily needs, she also breeds livestock and then resells them at a higher price. 

Namaskali has applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future she hopes to expand her business and with the profits gained she wants to improve her family's living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say runs a grocery store at her home. She is a widow with four sons. She lives along national road number one about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Say has asked for Kiva loan several times already. She now is requesting another loan of $600 to buy more groceries for her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her inventory.

loans.name: 12 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Lan operates a food stall selling rice noodle. She is requesting a loan to purchase material for her rice noodle stall. She is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 12 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 9 members. Lan lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. 

In 2008, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor women. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and to buy more land. She wants her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase material for her rice noodle stall.

loans.name: Lora

texts.en:
Lora, a 38-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are in school, has a business selling bananas, tomatoes, and onions in Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has had this business for four years.

Lora requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan in the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income arising from the loan will help her to pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, bananas, and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a business of selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Teresita is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell in her stall.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Belarmina

texts.en:
50-year-old Belarmina is a married woman with five children. Her husband works as a farmer and coconut gatherer.

Belarmina earns a living through basket-weaving. She has been engaged in this kind of business for almost 30 years. Belarmina also owns and manages a sari-sari store business. She sells items like soft drinks, canned goods and soap. She requested this loan to buy materials for basket-weaving and more items to sell at her store. Belarmina hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket-weaving and more items to sell at her store

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua has three children. She sells cassava, plantain, fresh pepper, tomatoes, onions and other items at Elmina. She has done this for four years. Her husband is a farmer. Akosua uses her income for general upkeep of their home. Akosua will use the loan to obtain cassava, plantain, fresh pepper, tomatoes, onions and other items to resell. She anticipates building a shop one day.

loans.use: to obtain cassava, plantain, fresh pepper, tomatoes, onions and other items

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Luque, 16 mujeres se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas con las otras por medio del trabajo en equipo. De esa unión es que surge el grupo llamado mujeres luchadoras, en el cual, las integrantes tienen mucha esperanza de crecimiento, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. 
Una de esas mujeres luchadoras es la señora Mirna, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo. Por medio de este negocio ella gana el dinero necesario para ayudar a su familia y también para poder mantener su negocio. Mirna se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora, emprendedora y muy sacrificada. 
Solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de kiva para la compra de vinos, whiskys, energizantes y demás con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Luque there are 16 women who joined together to help each other through team work.  They formed a communal bank called "Mujeres Luchadoras" in which they have placed great hope for growth, not only economic but also personal.

One of these "determined women" is Mrs. Mirna who sells all kinds of beverages.  Through her business she has been able to earn enough income to support her family and maintain the business.  Mirna sees herself as a hard-working, determined entrepreneur with much of self-sacrifice.

She is requesting a loan from the Fundación Paraguay and Kiva to buy wines, whiskeys, energy drinks and other items to stock her business and offer more variety to customers.

loans.use: To buy wine, whiskey, energy drinks and other items.

loans.name: Simana Group

texts.en:
Magdaline is the facilitator of the Simana group. Magdaline and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Magdaline takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Magdaline had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Magdaline was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Magdaline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Magdaline will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Simana group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kitwe_Twetungure Group

texts.en: For the last eight years, Aston has earned a living by selling food items such as maize flour, cooking oil, beans and bread to people who live in his town, Bushenyi, Uganda. He has overcome many hardships and challenges to keep his business going, and uses his income to support his wife and three children. His goal for the future is to expand his business. He is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Laura Delia

texts.es: La Sra. Laura es una persona  trabajadora  que  día  con día se  esfuerza  por  sacar  adelante  a su  familia,  ella  se  dedica  a la venta de ropa usada lo  cual le a  permitido  salir  adelante   día  con día,  es  por ello  que  en  esta  ocasión  requiere   realizar  la compra  de mercancía  para  la  venta,  ve  en  el  crédito  la  posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer   su  negocio lo cual le  generara  mayores  ingresos.
texts.en: Laura is a hardworking person who day by day makes the effort to get her family ahead.  She works selling used clothing, which has allowed her to get ahead every day.  Because of this she now needs to buy merchandise to sell.  She sees the loan as the possibility to make her business grow, which will generate greater income for her.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 56 years old, married to Ruth. They are blessed with two children aged 20 and 17 years respectively. He has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. John will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase his income and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: Jhon tiene 26 años, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, así como alegre y amable. Convive con Betsy, quien es empleada. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de su hija de 4 meses de nacida. La actividad que realiza Jhon es la venta de gaseosas, para esto cuenta con una congeladora que compró con sus ahorros, y la instaló en su propia casa. Desde hace tres años que atiende a sus clientes con bebidas heladas. Paralelo a ésta actividad también se dedica a la pintura, realizando hermosos cuadros con motivos amazónicos, lo cual realiza en sus ratos libres y a pedido, En tanto su pareja lo apoya en atención de los clientes si requieren de alguna bebida. Le agrada ambas actividades ya que cuenta con un ingreso económico y gracias a ello le permitió salir de apuros económicos. Ahora que tiene su hija recién nacida, tiene la necesidad de invertir su capital para poder generarse más ingresos. Tiene planes de seguir con su negocio y además de incursionar en la venta de abarrotes abriendo una tienda en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 1 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gaseosas a precio por mayor en diferentes presentaciones y sabores, además de pintura óleo, telas y otros  para pintar más cuadros.
texts.en:
Jhon is 26 years old.   He is a hardworking, dedicated man; he’s also cheerful and pleasant.  He lives with Betsy who is an employee.  They live together in their house in the company of their four-month-old daughter.

Jhon’s activity is selling soft-drinks.  To do so, he has a freezer that he bought with his own savings and installed at home.  He’s been providing his customers with ice-cold beverages for three years.  Alongside this business, he also paints.  He makes beautiful paintings with Amazonian themes in his free time and to order while his spouse helps him take care of customers who need beverages.  He enjoys both activities because he has income that has gotten him out of some economic difficulties.  Now that he has a newborn daughter he needs to invest capital to generate more income.  He plans to continue with his business as well as to go into grocery sales opening a store at home.

This will be his first MFP loan and he hopes to have your collaboration to make his plans a reality.  He will use the requested 800 new soles to buy soft-drinks in assorted presentations and flavors at wholesale prices; he will also buy oil paints, canvasses and other supplies to paint more paintings.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of beverages and also oil paints and canvasses for his paintings.

loans.name: Esra'a

texts.en:
Esra'a is 19 years old single woman, she lives in Hay Nazal, Jordan.
Esra'a is looking to have a loan of 500JDs thus she can buy nuts and cereals and improve her social level.
Esra'a is under 30 years old her loan is youth.

loans.use: to buy and sell cereals and nuts

loans.name: Paraje Tzancoral Group

texts.en:
Santa Lucía La Reforma is a town in the Department of Totonicapán in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. Ten women who live in the town have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Paraje Tzancoral” and have the mutual goals of expanding their small businesses, sending their children to school, improving their homes and empowering themselves. The women have various businesses that include agricultural endeavors (growing corn and beans), animal husbandry and a tortilleria where tortillas are freshly made three times daily. Another member of the group has a convenience store. The women’s average age is 35 and ¾ of them did not attend elementary school. 

Juana was elected President of the Trust Bank and is a good leader who sets a great example for the ladies in the group. She had six years of formal education. Juana is 34 years old with two children who are 8 and 12 years of age. Her children are both in school. This motivated woman has the dream of expanding her businesses (agriculture and animal husbandry). She grows corn and beans and raises chicken, turkeys and pigs. She sells all in the local market. She also has a convenience store in Guatemala City! Juana is requesting her third loan from KIVA investors and will use the funds to open an additional convenience store and will buy supplies like sugar, salt, oil, pasta, beans and other products for the store. This is a hard-working and motivated woman!

The ladies are on the road to more prosperous futures thanks to the generosity and kindness of KIVA investors. They understand that KIVA investors come from all parts of the world and are very grateful for the opportunity to secure loans. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to increase inventory of the store, purchasing essential items, like oil, rice, beans, pasta, juices, and soft drinks, as well as dish soap, laundry soap, and body soap.
